Summary: Very accommodating in letting us store our luggage before check-in time so we don’t have it sitting in the car while we are at California Adventure.  Very helpful front desk personnel.  Easy check-in. Though our room was directly just beside the elevator and the key fob cover on the door was missing, it was still working and the room was clean.  The water pressure in the shower was weak so I opted not to wash my hair since it will take forever to get shampoo out (I have a lot of hair on my head & thick as well). My sister said she could hear all the elevator open and close and the people passing by the hallway.  Our TV was not turning on and the hotel was quick on repairing it.   Parking spaces are limited as the lot shares with the steakhouse up front so some spaces are
Room tip: Ask for a room away from the elevator.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review!  We're happy you had a pleasant experience with us! It's lovely you enjoyed our service so much. That's what we like to see! However, we regret that our accommodations didn't meet your expectations. We endeavor to offer a top-notch experience for our guests so we'll be sure to discuss your concerns moving forward.  We look forward to hosting you again soon for an even better experience!

Summary: Walkable to disney parks, safe neighborhood & super great experience all the way around.  Madison was so helpful at the front desk, she went above and beyond to ensure our group had rooms nearby one another & even got us conjoining rooms.  We had such a memorable time at this hotel, we couldn't have had a better stay.  Thank you!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review, ysc8689!  It's outstanding your time at Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center was so amazing and that you appreciated our convenient location and friendly staff. We love sharing our excellent service with each person who walks through our door. It's team members like Madison who ensure our guests are getting the best level of service. That's what we like to see!  We can't wait until your next visit so we can once again share our high-caliber service with you.

Summary Heading: DO NOT BOOK YOUR TRIP HERE!
Summary: They will NOT refund you even when I was in the hospital with COVID-19 three days before my stay. The manager is rude, unkind, and only wants your money. I easily got my money back from another Marriott hotel for a stay that was supposed to be the following day, yet this hotel refused to make any exception. I guess they wanted me to show up and infect everyone with COVID! Unbelievable.
Manager Response: Dear Q6257DEanniet,  As we had explained, the reservation you had reserved was a full advance purchase booking that could not be refunded. While we would have been happy to modify your reservation dates, we are not able to refund this booking. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you. Thank you.

Summary: Worst hotel experience I’ve ever encountered, I made the mistake of booking a one night stay here while I was in town. I am a gold elite with Marriott and usually trust all hotel stays, but this hotel over charged me for my stay and repeatedly made it impossible to get my money back. My room was a total of $150 and I was charged nearly $500. They refunded me $187 weeks later and insisted the other charges were for parking and a “restaurant bill” that was charged to my room. I checked in late and checked out early, I never ordered anything from a “restaurant”.  I understand billing issues happen but I felt that they purposely added these charges thinking I wouldn’t notice. I say this because I never received a copy of my hotel bill after checkout, my stay never even showed up in
Room tip: Just don’t stay here or demand a printed hotel bill upon checkout.
Manager Response: It is our goal to exceed the expectations of all our guests and we are sorry to hear we have failed to accomplish this for your visit. As I explained during our phone call, there was a computer error that caused multiple parking charges to be added to your reservation. This was brought to our attention by you on September 30 and our accounting team refunded you for the excess parking fees on October 2. You then stated that you did not park a vehicle at all during your visit so in good faith we adjusted off the 1 remaining night of parking on October 7. You then contacted the hotel  October 7 and disputed the restaurant charge to your room, even though the hotel did have a signed receipt showing these charges were billed to your guest room. Please know that there was no purposeful attempt to bill anything incorrectly to your reservation, all error posted charges have since been corrected and you should have received receipts for all transactions that have been processed.

Summary: Joanna was amazing…. She was the best thing at this hotel. From check in she made my birthday business trip special… her attentiveness and exceptional customer service is definitely a reason I’ll be coming back for any business needs I have….
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent review, 725coreyk!  We're thrilled that your time at Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center was so amazing! We endeavor to go above and beyond to ensure our guests have a memorable experience. It's not surprising that Joanna took such wonderful care of you and made you feel so valued. She is an important member of our team!  We look forward to hosting you again soon for another fantastic experience!

Summary: One of the worst experiences i've ever had a hotel if I could give it negative stars I would. The check in process was fairly smooth but the person at the front desk failed to explain that there was a parking fee. I arrived around 5 and as I was walking to my room there were bags of trash along the hall way, it seemed like rooms were being cleaned but it was odd to see the large trash bags and laundry in the hallway. When I arrived at my room it had a distint mildew smell. I asked if there was another room availble due to the smell and they obliged. I thought this would be the end of my issues with this hotel but regretfully it was not. When I arrived at the new room it was very apparent that someone had gone in to spray air freshener, which made me question what smells they
Manager Response: Dear R3605OPelizabethc,  We appreciate your feedback regarding your visit. Unfortunately, our staff was not able to validate either of these issues and thus did not meet the criteria for the complimentary room night that you were asking for while at the hotel. We had informed you that it was your choice to continue your visit, but we would not be providing you any compensation as you had already utilized the original room you had been given for multiple hours prior to bringing this to our attention.  Thank you.

Summary: Let’s start with the best greeting ever , when I booked this trip to take my 3 year old nephew to Disneyland for the first time. He was greeting at the front desk with being the “Guest of the day with a sign saying WELCOME JAXX!!” Then breakfast at the bistro was so well done and made simple for kids but really enjoyable for even adults with ready to order Starbucks coffees! No matter what we asked for we were always greeted with kindness and excitement to help us out. When we didn’t know the best way to  get to Disney the front desk was so helpful with showing us the ART bus passes. The room we had not only had two queen beds but also a pull out couch and 2 bunk beds (bunks big enough to fit me… a 5’6 30 y/o female … yes I enjoyed the bunk beds too !!) also from our room we had
Manager Response: Thanks for the amazing review, Elliemrgn!  It's excellent your time at Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center was so fantastic! We take great care in providing top-notch service for all of our guests. Your praise for our team lets us know we're doing our job! We look forward to hosting you again soon so we can share another splendid experience with you!  Thank you again for sharing your feedback!

Summary: The location of this hotel is great if you want to be close to Disney. There are restaurants both in the hotel and within walking distance. Starbucks on site and a decent bar. As well, there are conference rooms spaces for meetings. That said, the hotel rooms are dated and you can definitely tell the hotel has seen a ton of traffic and not as much housekeeping. Stained carpets and furniture, grout in disrepair, an unusual smell (I changed rooms because if this). It’s not horrible. It’s perfectly safe, comfortable enough, and the staff are nice. I just prefer a more updated environment and a higher degree of maintenance.
Room tip: I wouldn’t bother with the valet. The parking is super convenient and I’ve never seen it full.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback.  It's unfortunate your stay in our hotel didn't exceed your expectations. We regret you weren't entirely satisfied with our furnishings and accommodations. We care deeply about the happiness and satisfaction of our guests so we'll address all of your concerns with our team moving forward. We are pleased to share our hotel has recently received a full renovation in 2021 and hope you are able to enjoy our new product offerings.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel as it was clean, modern and a great location. The pool area was a nice place to spend time outside. It is close to lots of restaurants as well as Disneyland. There is a shuttle you can take for a small fee to Disneyland from the hotel next door. We would definitely return!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review!  We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. It's wonderful to know that our cleanliness, modern features, location, and shuttle service left a lasting impression. We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We look forward to hosting you again the next time you're in town!

Summary: I stayed at the hotel while I was in the process of moving. The hotel was a brand new hotel and loved the fact that it was close to Disneyland as well. The hotel employees were so nice and breakfast server even remembered what I like to order very morning! Thank you for your hospitality and I will sure to recommend to my family and friends!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing!  At Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center, we strive to provide exceptional service for each person who walks through our doors. Thank you for sharing your perfect rating with us. We look forward to sharing the same quality experience with you during your next stay with us.

Summary: This hotel is in such a great location for all families visiting Disneyland! We were able to walk to the parks within 25 minutes so it was an easy hike after the parks.  I stayed in a family suite, which had one big bed and two bunk beds in another separated room for kids. It was a great separate area for them in the same room. I didnt have kids but it was a great room to work from home from when on necessary. In addition, their beds are the best beds I have ever slept on in a hotel. They are so comfortable and I instantly fell asleep.  The breakfast was very good but a bit more expensive than I thought it should have been priced for. Breakfast is also slow so apply plenty of time for this.   The staff was kind.  Only problem is we had a mistake on our bill. There was an extra
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave this wonderful review, samanthao520!  We're thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay at Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center so much! We strive for excellence so we're pleased to hear you appreciated not only our prime location and spacious accommodations, but also our comfortable bedding and wonderful staff! Your praise lets us know we're succeeding! Please know that your concerns will be addressed with the appropriate members of our team moving forward.  We can't wait to host you again for yet another unforgettable visit! Have a lovely day!

Summary: Wonderfully stay at this property. Close to all the theme parks though I was traveling for business . Lovely pool and hot tub  to unwind at the end of a tiresome day. The staff was amazing. Geovanni went above and beyond to make my stay extra comfortable and made me feel at home l.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close to Disney, busy hotel as expected.  Elevators fast and convenient. The room was small and the floor was a tile looking linoleum that was uneven in spots and when stepped on felt as if you were going to fall through. Again another stupid Barn door to the bathroom but at least this on was by the door and not in the middle of the room as I have seen before. Still does not shut well so kids might be uncomfortable with adults moving about the room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was nice overall but there are some weird and annoying things about it. The front desk only had 1 person most of the time and they are busy because of the area. So most likely at check in/out you will have to wait. You need your room for everything. To get inside, to use the elevator and even to use the restroom in the lobby. That’s an exaggeration and annoyance specially as the elevator some times took longer to accept the key.  The rooms are good for the price. They have a mini fridge and are clean overall. The shower i don’t know who designed it or set up the door but they need to do a better job. It’s very small the opening and the water makes a mess. Also I think the opening is on the wrong side.  The AC wasn’t working on the bathroom so the mirror was all foggy
Manager Response: none

Summary: Absolutely wonderful stay at this Courtyard location. I was greeted so warmly by front desk staff Curlessa. She does her job very well showed me excellent customer service. Based on this stay this will be my go to property for trips to Disney and other local theme parks. The location is excellent for everything you need to do. Almost everything is within walking distance or a $7 Lyft ride away.  The room was also cleaned to my standards. The ladies do an amazing job keeping everything
Manager Response: none

Summary: We usually stay at the Sheraton Park when we come to Anaheim, but it has gone downhill so we decided to try this Courtyard. It’s not any better - if fact, it’s worse.   The walls are paper thin, which is especially bad in a hotel that is full of families. We could hear running and arguing (and one night other activities) non-stop.   Our two-bedroom room was great since we were tracking with two kids who lived the bunk beds. However, when you close the divider one room gets freezing cold and the other one gets hot. Someone needs to figure this out.   The “restaurant / bar” is a glorified Starbucks counter that presumable microwaves stuff in the back. One morning they had 6 completely brown bananas on the counter for sale.   The best part was the staff. Everyone was really
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is the best thing of this hotel as it is very close to disneyland and has 2 great places (mortons and ruths chris) to eat nearby. Breakfast was very good but takes a long time, the people attending do have a good attitude and are friendly but they just have to many people to serve. Rooms are not that big and cleansiness is not great (old carpet). Elevator was out a couple of times so had to use the stairs. Parking lot is small so you do have to wait to be able to park sometimes. Might change for next trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments.  Thank you for your compliments regarding our location and staff.  I am sorry that you were disappointed by some elements of your stay.  We have a renovation planned later this year, and we will be replacing all of our carpet.  Our elevators are normally very reliable, and I am sorry that we had some difficulties during your stay.  We normally have plenty of parking, but on the rare occasions it is difficult to find a space, please speak with our Front Desk team and we will be be happy to explain our back-up options.  Thank you for staying with us, and I hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you when you return to Anaheim.

Summary: Great location to the convention center without the crowds and the prices of the Hiton and Marriott. Five minute walk to the ACC. The absence of the crowds also allows for excellent service at the Bistro for breakfast and dinner. Say Hi to Joanna and Elvira at the Bistro
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott for three nights during a conference in February 2020.  Overall this is a nice hotel conveniently located a short walk from the convention center.   The rooms are clean and nicely laid out and the front desk staff are efficient.  They have a few service issues though.  I asked for and received late check out on the final day, and I had a do not disturb sign on the door.  Housekeeping staff were knocking on my door while I was in the shower, even with the sign up.  The shower did not have sufficiently hot water in the afternoon/evening.   I reported the problem on day 1, but it went unresolved, so 5 PM showers were just kind of warm, but not hot.  Also, the fitness center was really tiny with two treadmills, one elliptical and a number of small
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  I appreciate your compliments about our location, clean room and Front Desk staff.  I am sorry that you also had some disappointments during your visit.  I will share your comments with our team for their review and follow-up.  We are scheduled to have a renovation later this year and we plan to have a much larger Fitness Center once it is complete.  I hope that you will return to visit us again after the renovation.  Thank you for sharing your feedback.

Summary: good budget hotel. nothing fancy rooms had queen beds. a plus. little bit of a walk to disneyland. staff friendly and met our needs. close to convention center. many restaurants around. quiet in the evenings
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with our property, and sharing your feedback.  I will share your compliments with our team.  I hope that we will see you again when you return to Anaheim.

Summary: My family & I arrived from the Bay Area on Wednesday night about 20 mins before the lobby grill was due to close & we were greeted with open arms by Joanna & Ezze. They provide us with fast & excellent service all while showing amazing patience with my 8 & 4 y.o.  Provided us with great food & great service not to mention spot on cocktails to take of the edge from a long car ride. I would highly recommend this hotel & grill. Lastly, our room is awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed one night since our company holiday party was at Ruth Chris steakhouse (courtyard is behind Ruth Chris). Maybe 2 blocks from Disneyland. Hotel is clean, staff is nice at check in. Room was nice, clean and comfy bed. Only disappointment was trying to get a latte in the morning downstairs. Girl seemed confused, didn’t greet me as I stood there alone and then couldn’t figure out change. But other then that a good stay. I would stay here again if going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Kids Suite was a great size for our family of five. We had two rooms - one with bunk beds and sofa and tv and the other with king or double queens and tv. We asked for double queen on check in and it meant we didn’t need to use the sofa bed.   Very close to Disney (but still worth buying an ART bus pass to save your legs for the park.   Nice decor. Soft beds. Quiet on 4th floor. Bistro basically empty but we ordered Bistro meals to take to our room one night and very good. 24 hour reception.   CVS pharmacy (supermarket) and fast food joints close (o.5km easy walk).   Very limited kitchen facilities (no sink, no crockery just a fridge, coffee machine and paper coffee cups) - we gave up on trying to do anything other than stock our own breakfast. No milk provided for coffee so
Manager Response: none

Summary: Reserved this hotel with our Costco vacation package. Absolutely loved it! We had a "King Kid's Suite." King size bed for mom and dad and a bunkbed for our daughter. Our 8 yr. old daughter had her own side of the room with a door dividing the suite which she loved. The microwave and refrigerator were on her side. The only negative about the rooms is that the walls and floors are a little thin and you could hear noises fairly easy. In regards to the hotel staff, they were fantastic! From the desk personnel, to the restaurant staff and the housekeeping service, everyone was VERY nice and helpful! Joanna, who worked the bar was excellent and very friendly! Elvira was super nice as well! But the star of the show was "EZ." EZ was an older Hispanic gentleman who did everything. He
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: In Need Of A Serious Overhaul
Summary: Stayed in a Family Suite Wirth bunkbeds and 2 queens. Room was extremely dark throughout the day and lights did not help. Furniture and bath was quite old and it looks like it has had a lot of use. Beds were comfortable though.   Avoid second room floors and above as the elevators are extremely slow. I've never experienced such terrible elevators. Buttons to close the doors did not work either. So much time wasted waiting.   Walking distance to both the convention center and Disney Resort make it  a convenient location, but for the reasons above I would seriously reconsider staying here. There are plenty of better options nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments.  Thank you for the compliments regarding our beds.  We replaced the mattresses recently and have been receiving great feedback on them.  I am sorry that you were disappointed regarding other elements of your visit.  We are planning a renovation and next year and I will share your thoughts with the appropriate individuals for consideration.  I hope that you will give us another chance on a future visit to Anaheim.  Thank you again for telling us about your experience.

Summary: Ezekiel was the nicest and most helpful in the bistro. Not only was he fast but the food was delicious!!! I’ll be coming back with my family!!! Also good prices and delicious food for kids and adults.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We decided to take a four day trip to California and visit Disneyland.  From the time you walked into the hotel to the time you left they treated you like family.  The water park on premises was nice for the kids. The hotel was spotless. The front end agents were nothing but accommodating. At one point my son’s glasses arm fell out and we did not have a eye glass repair kit so I asked the Front desk where I could go get one and they suggested me to place where I  can go. The agent actually called for me to see if they had one so I didn’t go up there for no reason.  I went and got it and came back and the screw driver didn’t work for it. So we resorted to other ways we asked the front desk if they a safety pin and they searched hi and low and pulled it out of a mending kit.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Disney, Would Stay Again
Summary: We stayed in a 4th floor room room (top floor) with 2 queen beds. Bathroom with the sink in the bathroom. Room was renovated, it is an older building with small, old style tub. Shower had no trouble with hot water and good pressure. No sink outside the bathroom like some hotels. Lighting in the entry way very dark, so it was hard to use the mirror outside the bathroom. Coffee station with Keurig. Room was very quiet, we didn’t hear anyone in other rooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Pool and hot tub outside, but we didn’t use them. Looks like they had reclining chairs and umbrellas.  We could have walked to Disneyland, but chose not to. About a 20 min walk to Disney. Shuttle bus stop about a half block away goes to Disneyland. Easy to use, they announced where to
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my second time staying at this hotel for a work meeting and I can’t say enough great things about everyone that I interacted with. The front desk staff were kind and welcoming, but the best folks were the ones tending the bar! Joanna and her partner (whose name I’m forgetting) were AMAZING! They were fun to chat with and gave the best service.  I highly, highly recommend this hotel for work or fun!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My company has quarterly meetings of our regional team and have stayed here the last two times. As many people who travel for work know, it can be a real drag. This hotel turns that frown upside down! From check in to the hospitality staff, to the eating area and bar, each face is warm and friendly! We gave our boss a surprise baby shower in one of the conference rooms there and both Joanna and Ezze from the restaurant went above and beyond to help us celebrate. Their big smiles and warmth were delightful and they even brought in a huge platter of fruit for us to enjoy! If you need to travel to Anaheim for work or need a place to bring the kids for that trip to the Happiest Place on Earth, why not stay at the happiest hotel on Harbor!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Came here for a business meeting. The room was great with a good layout and decor, the location was great, and the customer service was awesome. Probably the best part was Izzy and Joanna at the bar. They made it an incredible experience. I highly recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This has been an exceptional hotel! It’s is very close by to Disney if that’s where you are going. The rooms and lobby are clean and modern. However what made this hotel a better stay was the amazing staff. Specially Joanna, thank you!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room was fine, but there was no safe. Lighting very dim. Shower was good. The water pressure and temperature were good.  No room service. Restaurant had limited hours. Food not very good. I do not recommend the restaurant.   The staff were great.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest,   Thank you very much for you feedback, we truly appreciate it and will address you concerns.  None of our rooms have safes, but we do have safes at the front desk to store your valuables. We feel that safes are important and we are currently looking to place one in each room.  The Courtyard brand does not have room service, but we do have delicious to go items.  We will talk to our staff to push our full menu more and ensure you are aware that from 5pm to 10pm we have a full happy hour bar where we serve pizzas, burgers, chicken BLTs, chicken pot pies and much more.  We hope that you visit us again soon and we can personally have you sample our delicious quesadillas.    Cordially,   The Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center team

Summary: The room was very pretty. Everything was upgraded and beautiful. The staff was especially friendly. Higher grade amenities in the bathroom. The bed was divine.  Now the bad stuff...   I requested extra towels, a shaving kit and extra shampoo be delivered to my room. It was not delivered. What is the point of making advance requests if I have to call at the front desk?   The tiny store is very tiny. Super tiny with the bare minimum of supplies. Nothing fancy or special here.   The “bistro” is a small cafe with a very small selection of food that is not as good as it could be. Breakfast was primarily bagels or fruit. They had coffee which was a plus, but the whole thing just felt lacking. Service was slow, coffee was stored in carafes, there were no stir sticks. It was a very
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your stay.  Thank you for the compliments regarding the room, amenities and service.  We just recently replaced all of our mattresses, so I am glad you enjoyed it!  I am sorry that you were disappointed by the other aspects of your stay.  We expect our team to deliver excellent service, and I apologize that we disappointed you.  I have shared your feedback with our team and we are working to ensure we avoid these problems in the future.  I appreciate you sharing honest feedback, as it gives us an opportunity to improve.  Thank you for staying with us - I hope that you will give us another chance when  your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Wished we could have stayed longer.
Summary: Out of the bag, I’ll start out by saying that we visited Anaheim purely for Disneyland. Saying that, I couldn’t afford the cost of Disney’s own resorts, so I google earthed the hotels that were in walking distance. Which it is, about 3min to the gates of Disneyland & California Adventure. Incidentally, a McD’s is halfway down. Perfect placement for a quick something before or after the park. My draw to this hotel was the pool and waterslides it offers, having 4 kids it was perfect. Google earth wise, it looked good. In reality, it was flipping awesome! In house restaurant, lounge, and store. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The pool has life guards on roster (not that I’d let mine swim alone anyway) And was a genuinely relaxing place to unwind after the parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for an overnight getaway. This hotel is a short distance from Disneyland and Anaheim Garden Walk. Also there is a walkway from the rear of the hotel to the convention center. Hotel has basic amenities but no safe in the room. Overall not a bad stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a great place to stay especially with being so close to Disneyland. Joanna and Ezee are really the ones that made this stay above and beyond. They were running the bistro in the evening time during our stay and both were so happy to help and attentive to detail. Loved that they wanted to provide the best service. Overall great hotel and great price for a nice weekend stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had an amazing stay at this hotel for our family Disneyland vacation. Walkable to Disneyland but well worth the $6 uber each day to avoid the heat. Front desk staff were great and Joanna in the restaurant and bar was so amazing and friendly. Awesome staff, great accommodations = unbelievable value! Highly recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary: All pretty standard Courtyard...The room was very spacious and clean, the beds were comfortable, walking distance (25 mins) to park entrance, nice common areas with Starbucks coffee at the restaurant. The front desk was not clear on my perks as a  titanium elite member, I was told I had $10 credit, when it was actually $10/day. The restaurant prices are way too high, go elsewhere for breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I did not actually stay at this hotel, however, I had colleagues from work staying here.  I stopped by to hang out with them after our conference and can honestly say that out of the hundreds of hotel bars I have been to, this was by far one of the best I have ever visited, primarily because of the staff working in the bar, Ezze and Joanna.  They were so much fun!  We were laughing, telling jokes, and even did a little singing.  I would highly recommend visiting them in the bar.  You will not be disappointed.  Joanna and Ezze were very professional, but also so friendly and accommodating.  We had a big group sitting outside in the patio area and they were so kind to bring our drinks out to us.  If I am back in Anaheim, I would go visit this property just to see them.  Joanna and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us.  Thanks for the great compliments about our Bistro Bar, and our Associates, Ezze and Joanna!  I will share your feedback with them.  We hope that we will see you again when you return to Anaheim!

Summary: From check in staff to Joanna at the bar/restaurant, we were treated kindly and professionally. We felt comfortable our entire stay and that we were valuable customers. We highly recommend this Marriott!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with us.  I'll share your feedback with our team, especially Joanna.  We hope that we will see you again when you return to our area!

Summary: I really like this Courtyard. From the friendly efficient staff to the pool and everything in between.  Close to Disneyland without the madness of it being in the middle of the most crowded area.   Good pool with a hot tub and a small kiddie pool.   I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for sharing your comments about your visit.  I'm very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  I will share your compliments with our team.  Thanks again - we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We had a decent stay here. It’s not a 5 star hotel, but we still wished it had a restaurant open all day on property. Otherwise, all was fine. Breakfast is really expensive here. I wish I had good restaurant recommendations...
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments about your visit.  When you return, please let us know what types of restaurants you are looking for - our team has great recommendations from the many to choose from in Anaheim.  Thank you for staying with us - we hope to see you again when you return to our area.

Summary: We stayed in the family suite with 2 queen beds and 2 bunk beds which was excellent. We had a minor issue during our stay and the staff made sure our needs were not just met but exceeded expectations. Special shoutout to Reda B who ensured our satisfaction going above and beyond. This is one of the reasons I continue to stay loyal to BonVoy!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences with us.  I'm sorry to hear that you had an issue during your stay, but it's great to hear that our team responded appropriately.  I will thank Reda for taking great care of you.  Thank you for your compliments - I hope that we will see you again on your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary: Firstly let me say not only are the beds pillows and staff the worse ever but also their corporate office does not care about any issue you have as well we stayed there on July 10 the pillows were as flat as a pancake and the beds were like sleeping on the floor I complained to the front desk who had security bring me 4 more pillows that were no better than what I had never offering to switch rooms either we were ready to check out they told us we would still be responsible for the next night I asked for manager who was not on duty I went down to tell Tiffany person at front desk who screamed in my face saying go ahead but you will pay for the next night I got up to my room mind you this was 8 am and they had already locked me out of my room. I was given the manager card Mario
Manager Response: Dear valued guest,   Thank you very much for your feedback, we are sorry that you did not have a pleasant stay. We are looking into the matter and will be reaching out to you shortly. We hope to get this resolved and hope that you visit us again when your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sincerely,  The Courtyard Anaheim Team

Summary: I stayed here in june with kids 6 and 10 years old. They love the bunk bed. I like the spacious room and cleanliness. The front desk are friendly and helpful during the 4 nights stay. Only minor complaint, the fridge and oven next to kids' bunk bed. Difficult when making a supper snack.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When I am in the Anaheim area I usually stay at another hotel. However, after my stay at this property, it is now my top choice when visiting. Hotel cleanliness is top notch and the staff is amazing. Jonathan at the front desk was extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and upholds the "Marriott Standards" of customer service. I will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the worst hotel I’ve never stayed at they screamed at my mom won’t let us check out when we are very unhappy with the rooms and service the pillows are paper thin DO NOT STAY HERE worst experience of my life
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments.  I am very sorry that you were disappointed by your experience at our Hotel.  We have high standards for service, and I apologize that was not evident during your stay.  Please contact us at your convenience so that we may follow-up with you.  Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: We decide to stay on this property even though we didn’t go to Disneyland this time because of how secure is Anaheim area and we really enjoyed our stay here; we were there for 6 days and wee loved it very clean rooms comfortable beds small hotel but nice my kids really had a great time there, the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful thank you for the great service
Manager Response: none

Summary: A short walk to the Anaheim Convention Center. The front desk staff, especially Christian, was helpful and knowledgeable.   The guestroom was spacious and the bed was very comfortable after long days at the Convention Center.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms are clean and the staff is super nice! You can walk to Disneyland from here which is definitely a bonus!   I would stay here again. I was here for a conference so this perfect location for the event.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had some late evening snacks and drinks made by Eze and Joana, what amazing service and friendliness. In a city defined by service Eze and Joana set the bar.  Thank you for your smiles and amazing drinks
Manager Response: none

Summary: My Hunny and I stayed here for a couple nights on a small get away. We were very happy with the Hotel. Far enough away from Disneyland to not really get all the hustle and bustle, but close enough to walk if we wanted to. Very clean and staff is very friendly. My hunny is a house keeping manager here in Vegas and he was extremely impressed. No complaints, will definately stay again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were in town for a cheer competition at the convention center and stayed for 6 nights. The distance and walk to the convention center was good. The lobby was clean and the front desk staff was helpful.   However, there was only 1 elevator for the side of the hotel we were staying and it was soooo slow. 2 of the days we stayed our room was not cleaned, so we had to request towels and other items each day.   Not much to do or eat around the hotel, and distance to Disneyland was to far to walk so we Uber’d everywhere.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with us.  I'm very glad to hear that you enjoyed our proximity to the Convention Center and that our Front Desk team was helpful during your stay.  I apologize regarding your concerns about the elevator and room cleaning - I will share your feedback with the appropriate individuals.  There are several close options for shopping, dining and entertainment close to our property - please feel free to speak with our Front Desk and we will be happy to provide this information.  Thank you for staying with us - I hope that you will consider visiting us again when you return to our area!

Summary: Wasn't real close to anything we needed do other then visit a vendor; however, not long to get to a lot of shopping, restaurants and the Honda Center.  Staff was friendly.  Rooms were clean and comfortable enough.
Manager Response: Thank you for telling us about your experience at the property.  Thank you also for the compliments about our friendly staff as well as clean and comfortable rooms.  I'm glad that our location worked for you - there are many great restaurants, shopping, and entertainment options close by, about which our staff are always happy to share.  Thank you for your review - I hope that we will see you again when you return to our area.

Summary: Excellent service throughout my stay. Suggested improvement- every room should have a decent kettle - the coffee making machine provided in house just didn’t get water hot enough to make a cup of tea.  My room looked over a rooftop full of ACs - so it was a pretty noisy stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us.  I'm so glad to hear that you received excellent service during your stay.  Thank you for the suggestion about the coffee maker - we will review that with the appropriate individuals.  I am sorry to hear that your stay was noisy - we do our best to keep the Hotel as quiet as possible.  For your next stay, please let us know if you have a room location preference, and we will do our best to assist you.  Thank you for staying with us - I hope that we will see you again when you return to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed for one night before visiting Disneyland.  The upgrade to a suite with bunk beds was fantastic.  We all had plenty of room and the kids liked having their own space.  The King bed was the most comfortable I have slept on at a Courtyard property!  The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5 is that the thermostat seemed to regulate the temperature in the kids' room (it was freezing for them) but not the main room. Also, this hotel doesn't have an included breakfast for Platinum guests as several others in the area do.  Overall, we liked the location and the friendliness of the staff and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for telling us about your stay.  I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your Suite and that the beds were comfortable.  Thank you also for the compliments about our location and friendly staff.  I am sorry for the difficulty with the thermostat - I have asked our Engineering team to check them.  Thank you again for your comments - we hope you will return to visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Great Location and Awesome Staff - Hidden Gem
Summary: Our flight into LAX was super delayed due to weather so we didn't land and get to the hotel until after 1am.  With a long travel day behind us we were tired, hungry and knew we had a very early start for Disneyland.  We arrived and were met by a super gracious Front Desk Agent.  She was very energetic, polite and super efficient, especially for 1am!  She was able to quickly check us in, get us a great recommendation for late night food (pizza!) and perfect directions to our room.  The beds were insanely comfortable, the corridors quiet and the rooms very clean.  The Hotel was just a very short 15 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland.  How convenient is this!  The morning walk was beautiful and you can see the vast mountain skyline on your walk.  After a long and tiring day at
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing your experiences with us.  I'm very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  I'm so happy to hear that you enjoyed our service, our beds and our breakfast service.  I have shared your compliments with our great team.  We hope that you will stay with us again soon!

Summary: We (family of 4) stayed here over the Christmas and New Years Holidays 2018 for 7 nights.  As a platinum member, there’s really no extra benefits staying here but we still enjoyed our stay.  The rooms were spacious and we could control our thermostat which we appreciated since it was cold outside.  There was plenty of room for all our luggage and stuff.  There’s even a Starbucks downstairs!!  The hotel is not walking distance to Disneyland - it’s over 1.1 miles away. Overall, great stay and we would stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your visit with us.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your time here with us.  We hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary: We’ve used this hotel on two occasions for a Disneyland vacation. We love the queen kids suite with the adjoining room with a bunk bed for the kids. The breakfast isn’t free but it is tasty and there is plenty of room for families. The staff from the front desk, housekeeping, and food service are all polite and helpful. We will most likely return to the Courtyard Marriott if we have another Disneyland vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind comments.  I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  I have passed along your comments to our team.  We look forward to your next visit!  Thank you, again.

Summary: There are lots of hotels by Disneyland and lots of people choose the official Disney resorts, we've stayed in one before at Disney World, and honestly a low cost alternative like this hotel saves so much money. Even if you decide that the Disney resorts aren't worth it, there are scores of hotels claiming to give you lots of cool amenities like waterparks and Disney-themed rooms for cheaper, but those hotels are pretty overpriced also, ranging from 300 to 500, for most of them. This hotel checks almost all the boxes. We had an amazing experience here.  When we arrived, we asked if an upgrade was possible, as we always do at hotels because you never know, and the staff member checked and didn't even really give us an answer just our room-keys, we than arrived to find a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don’t judge a book by its cover
Summary: Hotel is approx 1 mile away from the park entrance (not an issue for us, but want others to be aware.)  Building appearance was updated and modern. Room looked stylish as well.. well except the outdated bathroom and shower. There were crumbs in the bed and it was clear housekeeping doesn’t change the sheets properly. The next morning we woke up with no water at all and we called the Front Desk regarding the plumbing. They were useless and seemed very much overwhelmed. Maybe they haven’t been trained properly? We requested a manager but we were told nobody was there on-site... How could a hotel have a severe maintenance issue and not have a manager there to assist??? We were told that we would get a phone call from the hotel manager when they came in, but as expected, they were
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  I am very sorry that you were disappointed and inconvenienced during your visit.  The problems you experienced are very unusual, and I am sorry that they occurred.  Please contact me when you have a chance - I would appreciate the opportunity to apologize to you and to do our best to make things right.  My direct phone number is 714-591-2440.  Thank you.  Sincerely,  Aaron S. General Manager

Summary: We loved this resort. You can walk to Disneyland in just a few minutes. The staff is extremely friendly. The room was spotless and I am super picky! They have a cool water park and lifeguard on duty. Starbucks is opened early and closed late in the hotel lobby. This is a gem to find so close to Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quiet, clean and close enough to Disneyland
Summary: We were on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool.  Beautiful for watching the sun rise!  Nice hotel.  There was some noise around 9:30 every night from upstairs.  They should probably make it a habit to put families with kids on the lower two floors. Also, there must have been some kind of a water damage issue in the past at some point, as there is a faint smell of mold at times.  Staff were reasonably accommodative.  Nice for a Disney stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here one night while on a quick trip to Disney land.  The check in clerk was very welcoming and got us in quick.  The room was well maintained and very clean.  The decor was nice and the bed was comfortable.   At check out the clerk was very friendly and helpful with us but she did allow her frustration show from the call she was on when we walked up.  Maybe wait until the guest in front of you is gone before you let out your frustration.  Overall a great stay and we will probably stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Short 2 day stay for the Disneyland Resort. Isidro at the front desk was very attentive to our needs during check in and check out. Hotel was quiet, conveniently located near Disneyland and had many great restaurants around the area that could be accessed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived late on a Thursday night for a quick 2 day visit to Disneyland for our 39th anniversary. We were on the 4th floor overlooking the pool. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathroom is adequate and clean with good water pressure. The room had a fridge, a 1 cup coffee maker and a nice tv with ample channel selection. We spent 16 hours a day out of the room, so a place to sleep and shower is all we were looking for. We were missed for room service one day, but a quick call to the desk and we had fresh towels and shampoo in 5 minutes. It’s about a 20 minute walk to the parks, it is safe and well lit both early and late.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Courtyard Anaheim Resort & Convention Center for your recent travels to Anaheim.   Commitment to service and guest satisfaction is a main focus and we are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay. The pride and dedication our hotel team takes in providing exceptional customer service to our valued guests speaks strongly to our company’s core values, “good service at a fair price.”  Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Anaheim and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sabrina Laude General Manager

Summary: Both Hugo and Klarrisa were awesome at the Bistro! Great service!!! Room was awesome too! Love it here. Had a much needed night out with my wife and they took care of us very well. Each booth had its own tv which I thought was awesome
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Courtyard Anaheim Resort & Convention Center for your recent travels to Anaheim.   We are so glad to hear our outstanding Bistro staff really made an impression on you during your stay and will be sure to pass on the notice!   Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Anaheim and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sabrina Laude General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay at a great hotel!
Summary: I had visited Anaheim last year and was shocked at the conditions of the hotel only a few buildings away so I wasn't sure what I'd find at Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim/Resort.  To start with Tiffany and Cesar were great communicating with me through emails and phone conversations.  My hubby and I were flying in from Philly and what a welcome site to see this hotel and our room!  Clean lobby, clean rooms, excellent service all the way around.  Thank you all!!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Courtyard Anaheim Resort & Convention Center for your recent travels to Anaheim.   We are sorry to hear yur last stay in town was not ideal but are glad we were able to provide you with excellent rooms and service this time. Cesar and Tiffany truly are gems and we are lucxky to have them, Im glad they were able to assist you and your husband during yur already stressful travels.  Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Anaheim and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sabrina Laude General Manager

Summary: Excellent location for Disneyland, the bus picks up right by the bigger Marriott close by and drops you off at Disneyland in 5 minutes. Rooms were nice and clean and the pool area was decent size and enjoyable as it has a large pool, kids pool, and hot tub.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Courtyard Anaheim Resort & Convention Center for your recent travels to Anaheim.   We are located less than 1 mile from Disneyland, so just a short 15 minute walk or as you mentioned the ArtPrize bus can pickup right across the street. We are glad you enjoyed your time with us.   Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Anaheim and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sabrina Laude General Manager

Summary: Great value with excellent location for a decent price.  Highly recommend staying at this location for a great hotel in the Anaheim area.  I traveled to the area to go to Disneyland and it worked out great.  No shuttle service from the hotel however you can pay a small fee with the city of Anaheim and get a pass for the shuttle they provide to and from the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Courtyard Anaheim Resort & Convention Center for your recent travels to Anaheim. We are located less than 1 mile from Disneyland, so just a short 15 minute walk or as you mentioned the Anaheim Resort Transportation Bus Service (ART) can pickup right across the street. They also offer Adult and Child fare passes for 1-5 days of transport.   Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Anaheim and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sabrina Laude  General Manager

Summary Heading: Great weekend stay for a mix of business and pleasure
Summary: Stayed here for a business meeting followed by a trip to Disneyland with my wife. This was a well-run hotel that simply takes care of its guests. The hotel is not big enough to get out of control like the other hotels in the convention area. Front desk held our bags during our last day at Disney which was greatly appreciated.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Courtyard Anaheim Resort & Convention Center for your recent travels to Anaheim. Commitment to service and guest satisfaction is a main focus and we are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay. The pride and dedication our hotel team takes in providing exceptional customer service to our valued guests speaks strongly to our company’s core values, “good service at a fair price.”   Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Anaheim and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sabrina Laude  General Manager

Summary: After our flight landed at LAX and the rental car company didn’t have our van ready, we finally go to our rental home around 1:30am. Long story short we were unable to access the home and had to cancel the reservation and find a hotel at a reasonable price for 8 people at 2:00 in the morning.   Not knowing the area very well, we came into the Courtyard where we dropped off two members of our larger party of 12, a little after 2:00am where Tiffany greeted us at the front desk. She was a ray of sunshine after a stressful and exhausting day of travel. Tiffany was very friendly and her peppy mood improved my terrible mood. After the computer system reboot, she had worked her magic and we now had two Queen standard rooms that were connected. Tiffany provided excellent customer
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perfect hotel, very friendly and welcoming staff and excellent hotel. Comfy beds and spacious rooms would recommend to stay here. Only a very short walk to Disneyland which is great. Fantastic water slides and pool if you have kids is a must, overall definitely will stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: Located in the parking lot with Ruth Chris steakhouse we found the rooms extremely clean and well maintained. The Queen size beds were exactly what we hoped for four a family of four. The bonus of a fridge and coffee maker in the room was nice. Having spent one night at a local Radisson that was far beyond our expectations this room was a welcome change. We used the ART bus for $5 each to go to the Park. We did have to walk to the neighboring hotel for the shuttle but it was still worth it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I really can't think of a negative from our stay here.   The room was comfortable, clean and quiet.   Like most of the people in the hotel, we were on a trip to Disneyland and the staff were extremely helpful in hints, tips and suggestions.   Huge cudos to Christian, Josh and Cesar at the front desk....these guys were especially awesome and always willing to help.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Great Choice for Families Visiting the Anaheim Disney Parks
Summary: There is no shortage of hotel options near the Disney Parks and the Anaheim Convention Center - you will find virtually every brand and price range in the area - but perhaps surprisingly the Courtyard Anaheim Resort / Convention Center (one of three Courtyards within about five miles of the Parks) is a great choice for families with school age children.  The hotel has all the features that make Courtyards a favorite of business travelers and convention goers, but a large number of the rooms are "kids suites" at reasonable prices featuring twin bunk beds and either two queens or a king bed - perfect for families.  The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk from the main entrance to the two Disney parks and Downtown Disney, but being relatively small offers a quiet respite in the evening
Manager Response: Dear Harris L,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share about your experience. As you mentioned, there is a surplus of hotels in the Disneyland Resort Area which include 9 Marriott properties in the immediate area, so it is hard to stand out. This being the case, our team works extremely hard to make a lasting impact on our guests, so they will take the time to leave reviews just like this one. We know sites like Trip Advisor allow us to connect with our guests on a direct level, so we always appreciate it when our guests give us the opportunity to connect beyond their stay by writing a review. Thank you again! We look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim in the future.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Stayed for a convention and was pleasantly surprised with how close it is to the Convention Center thanks to a pathway at the back of the hotel to the Marriott parking lot.  The Staff was wonderful. My room was clean and quiet. The Starbucks in the lobby was hot and always ready. Highly recommend staying here if you're attending a convention.
Manager Response: Dear Jesse T,  I am very happy to read that we will have the opportunity to welcome you back to Anaheim in the future. Our location and service set our hotel apart as a great option for guests travelling for business or leisure.   Thank you again,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary Heading: Spotlessly clean, convenient, quiet, friendly Disneyland hotel
Summary: Perfect base for Disneyland. A 5 minute walk away to the Parks and close to restaurants. Our spacious room with 2 queen beds and bunk beds and a generous sized bathroom suited us perfectly. The room was spotless and deeply cleaned with high quality sheets and furnishings. The bed was a little soft for me. The hotel is quiet and hardly saw anyone because everyone's out or in bed, so we loved sitting by the fire pit with a bottle of wine in the evening, or having a quiet breakfast in the Bistro which served healthy and diverse options. My 12 year old loved the water park and the pool and we liked to sunbathe on the loungers when not at the Parks. A great option and worth the price. There's no need to go anywhere else and pay more, the Courtyard Marriott gives all you all you need.
Manager Response: Dear Naomi C,  Thank you so much for your very kind review, but I believe you have us confused with the Courtyard Anaheim Themepark property. Although we do not have a water park we do have a beautiful pool area which includes the heated pool, kiddy pool and Jacuzzi. We are also centrally located next the Anaheim Convention Center and less than a mile from the Disneyland Resort.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: This Courtyard was clean and comfortable enough but it lacked above average service.  An empty dispenser that was never filled during our stay and incorrectly billed for parking when I had no car.  It is about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear poulsbo99,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I'm sorry to read that our service was lacking during your visit. Our service is actually our strongest category when it comes to our guest scores, so this comes as a surprise, but I hope we will have the chance to demonstrate that to you on your next visit to Anaheim. I will also say that if the billing issue has not been resolved you can contact me directly at (714) 591- 2440 and asking for me by name fr assistance.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Great Service began with my pre-arrival email from Tiffany, with information about the hotel and answering any questions about my stay.   Great check in experience, and the room was wonderful-clean, bright, and comfortable.  I went to purchase a ticket for Disney the next day mentioned my friends had season passes-he advised me that if that was the case they could buy the ticket a much better discount-which they didn't even know!  Thanks Cesar, you saved me $68!!!  I'd come to Anaheim for just a day after attending a convention in San Diego-I'd been staying at the "luxurious" Westin brand for 5 days, and experienced a nicer room & better service at this Courtyard!!!
Manager Response: Dear sandief,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay. I love the title of your review because it really covers the basics of a great hotel stay. Tiffany and Cesar are two of our Guest Service board leaders, so I'm not surprised to get another positive review about their service. I'm grateful to know I have the opportunity to work with a team of individuals who sincerely care about our guests.  Thank you again for your review and we all look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim on your next visit to Disneyland!  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary Heading: Outstanding Service and Good Value and Near Disneyland
Summary: Great choice walkable to Disneyland but without parking/resort fees.  Property has just what you need including good food options, pool, and laundry facilities.  The only downside to this property is the poor soundproofing above/below the floors which can be an issue with large families and others up at all hours.  Special thanks for Cesar for all of his assistance throughout our stay.  Also to Adriana for going above any beyond one morning in taking such good care of us at breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear bruin4life93,  Thank you for the kind review. I will make sure to personally thank Cesar and Adriana for making such a positive impression. I would like to note that although we do not charge any type of resort fee, we do charge $17 per night for parking. I also want to take the opportunity to extend my apologies for any noise issues you experienced during your stay. We always invite guests to let us know ahead of time if you have a preference for a top floor room, as we will always do our best to help provide the most comfortable stay possible.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Our family of 5 stayed in the king bed suite with a bunk bed. It was pretty clean, but kind of outdated with the decor.... and it was pretty roomy with a sofa and coffee table. We loved the nightly views of the fireworks from Disneyland from our room. The room had a fridge and a microwave. We were surprised how cheap our stay was (under $500 for 3 nights!) so it was a good value.
Manager Response: Dear hockeyyogatravel,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review. Our family Suites include a king or double queen option and make for a great option for families visiting Disneyland.   Thank you again,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Our family of 4 families stayed in 3 rooms. Each large room had 2 Queen beds  and a set of bunks. The bathroom was two bathrooms with 2 sinks and shower over a bath then a shower room with a toilet.  Reception staff were more than helpful especially as we had an ill child during the stay . cleaners and other staff all accommodating. Hotel only has a cafe which was adequate for snacks and coffees but there is a restaurant Mimi’s out front. Car parking is a bit of an expense with valet parking. Big plus is that it’s 10 min walk to Disneyland and hotel has fantastic waterpark for kids which is well supervised. Couldn’t have enjoyed our stay more!
Manager Response: Dear golfingkiwi2,  Thank you so much for your kind review! I would like to note that our hotel is just under a mile from the park so the walk time varies from 15- 20 minutes for most guests.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Overnight stay at this hotel while in Disneyland.  This location is a bit far to Disneyland if you want to walk.  But it's along the busy street so when you walk you barely notice the distance.  Great service, neat, clean and fresh sheets.  We were happy that this stay was quiet despite a busy queue of people going in and out.  Will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear 24Ceecee,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. I look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim in the future, and hope we can step up our game in order to get the five stars on the next review ;-)  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: This hotel was perfect for what we needed for our stay while visiting Disneyland.   After a long travel day, I was eager to get to my room and luckily the staff at the concierge was on the same wavelength as they quickly checked me in and got me to my room. The room was clean and standard for what you come to expect from a Courtyard Marriott.  We opted for no housekeeping to gain additional points (this never happened so inquire if you do the same service).   The walk to Disneyland is farther than I had thought, but it is a quick $6-8 Uber ride. It is located within walking distance of many shops and restaurants in a trendy and safe area that surrounds Disneyland. There is a Disney parking area close by so what you might try is to take the shuttle to that parking area and then
Manager Response: Dear peteyd121,  Thank you for your very kind review! I want to start by inviting you to email me directly at roger.rodriguez@courtyardanaheim.com so I can ensure you get your additional Marriott Rewards points for participating in the "Your Choice" program during your stay. With that said, I'm very appreciative of you sharing your insights as to transportation to the Disneyland Resort. Uber is definitely an inexpensive option for getting to the parks. I would also highlight the Anaheim Resort Transit shuttle as another transportation option for anyone who plans to come and go from the park throughout the day. The ART shuttle costs $5.50 for adults (ages 10+) and $2 for kids (ages 3-9) and offers unlimited rides back and forth for the day to the parks AND throughout the Anaheim Resort Area. The shuttle runs every twenty minutes and picks up next door to our hotel at the main entrance of the Anaheim Marriott.  Thank you again for your review. We look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim on future visits!  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary Heading: Fair for the price, very close to Disneyland
Summary: The staff here were absolutely excellent and the service was great, but the facilities were sub-par. The food options in the hotel are not great, everything is pre-packaged and of generally poor quality. The hotel is in desperate need of a remodel, and this is obviously the ugly cousin of the next door Marriott - which is gorgeous. But, you get what you pay for, and this hotel is definitely inexpensive, a block from Disneyland, and has truly excellent above and beyond service.
Manager Response: Dear Vanessa L,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay at our hotel. I am very glad to read that you felt our service was excellent, but I'm sorry we failed to exceed your expectations on the condition of our hotel and in our Bistro offerings. I would like to note that our rooms were recently remodeled and we are in plans to update our lobby and public areas. I would also like to note that all our Bistro hot items are made to order. The only items that are prepared in advance are the sandwiches and salads that we sell in our Lobby Market during lunch hours when our Bistro is closed, but even those items are made fresh daily. I hope this helps bring clarity to anyone who is curious after reading your review. Thank you again and I hope we have the chance to welcome you back to Anaheim in the future.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Stayed there for 3 nights. We noticed since we walked in a weird smell. And on the last day at 7 am we got a call that maintenance needed access to our room to check our bathroom for sewer issues. WHAT!! apparently few rooms next to us were having an overflow issue. Sure enough it was our bathroom too! So on our last day that we had planned to sleep-in to get ready for our flight back we had to shower and get ready in another room all the way on opposite side of the building. Not convenient at all with kiddos and trying to pack with in an awful smelly room. For our inconvenience we got offered free breakfast! like we really wanted to eat and stay there longer. With so many options of hotels around this area why bother staying here. Worse experience ever in a hotel!!!
Manager Response: Dear Rita F,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel. I am so sorry to hear about how your stay came to a close. Plumbing issues are not a common occurrence on our property, but they do happen at times at all hotels. As a traveler, especially one on vacation, you want to know that you are staying at a property that will do all they can to make a situation like that right. With that said, please know our Front Desk team was doing their best to help make the situation right for you and your family when they offered you complimentary breakfast. It seems clear that we failed to leave you with that impression, so I invite you to please contact me directly in order to discuss this matter and find a resolution. Please contact me directly at roger.rodriguez@courtyardanaheim.com or (714) 591-2440.  Sincerely,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Loved the location across from Angels Stadium. I’m not much of a Disneyland fan but it’s right there for everyone. I, on the other hand, prefer downtown, Disney. Either way, you can't go wrong with the location.
Manager Response: Dear jdobrole81,  Thank you for the kind review. Our location is central to the Disneyland Resort, the Anaheim Convention Center and Angel Stadium, which makes it easy for anyone travelling out to the Anaheim Area.  Thanks again,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Great hotel for a quick business trip to the area.  Hotel was very clean, staff were very friendly.  Nice addition with having the food service adjacent to the lobby area.  Would certainly stay here again
Manager Response: Dear JayCes,  Thank you and we look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: In town for a basketball tournament.  The airlines lost my luggage, the staff was so helpful and supportive.  Isidro went above and beyond to serve me!  Great location, you can walk anywhere.  Lots to do. Clean pool.  I would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear tiffany c,  Thank you for the big praise for Isidro. I will make sure to share your kind words with him and the entire team.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary Heading: Would stay again. Walk to Anaheim Conv Ctr
Summary: PROS: Overall, very happy with this Courtyard. There are 2 in the area, this is the 2045 South Harbor Blvd location. Staff were all very friendly, personable and helpful. Rooms are very clean, beds very comfortable. Bathrooms appear updated with tile floors and granite counters. Anaheim Convention Center is a 5 minute walk. Keurig and a small fridge in room. Generous desk/ workspace. Bonus - we were on the third floor, 322, and could see the Disneyland fireworks at night. Laundry is only on first floor. Bring your room key to enter, and quarters. $2 to wash, $2 to dry. CONS: No microwave in a basic room, but there is a micro in the family suite, the one with bunk beds. Bathroom has 1 sink and no exhaust fan.  Carpeting in the hallways needs major updating, or at least a good
Manager Response: Dear ILBCNUOK,  Thank you for taking the time to outline your list of PROS and CONS. I also want to thank you for pointing out that there are two Courtyard hotels on Harbor Blvd near Disneyland. We often have gets mistake our two hotels, so I appreciate you listing our address to help future travelers to find the right hotel. With that said, I would like to mention that we do offer microwaves on a request basis for our basic rooms, but inventory is limited so make sure to ask at check-in if a microwave is available if you would like it in your room. I also want to note that our hotel is currently in the process of having all our carpets cleaned. This includes guest rooms, public areas and all hallways. Thank you again for the review!  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: This is the place to stay if you have an event at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Beds are very comfortable.  Service team very nice.  The only negative:  I requested a late check-out -- which I was given - but when I went back to the room  my keycard didn't work! Apparently the lock system didn't know about my late checkout.  It took a while to get someone to let me in my room -- I barely made it back in time for the tournament!
Manager Response: Dear RahbinSD,  Thank you so much for your kind words. Reading that you feel like that our hotel is THE place to stay when visiting the Anaheim Convention Center is extremely gratifying. Our team works very hard to make every guest feel this way, so it feels great to see you share your experience on Trip Advisor. I also want to apologize for the mishap with your late check-out. Our key system runs on a separate program than our hotel operating system, so we should have done a better job communicating this to you when you requested the late checkout. Thank you again for your review.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Recently stayed at the Courtyard for a quick visit to Disneyland. The hotel is in a great location and easily walk able to the resort. The hotel staff was pleasant and thoughtful, sending goodies to the room for the little ones. Our girls were over the moon - their best trip ever! Such a nice touch and great customer service. Look forward to coming back. :)
Manager Response: Dear 49DO,  Thank you so much for the kind review! I'm so happy to read that your little ones enjoyed the goodies. We look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim on your next vacation.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful Visit, Couldn't ask for anything more.
Summary: We had an amazing stay recently at this Courtyard. The atmosphere of this hotel is quite warm and welcoming. Each time we entered the hotel, we were greeted nicely. I could tell very quickly that the whole staff, starting with Roger Rodriguez (the General Manager) were genuinely invested in ensuring my family and I had the most comfortable stay possible.   The rooms were modern and very clean! The beds are awesome and the sheet were soft (not all are, so A+) and the food was very tasty!  I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Anaheim/Disney area. Shuttles are available but Disney's front gates are within a 20 minute walk and there are many dining options (and a CVS) within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Adam M,  Thank you for the great review! We all look forward to welcoming you and your family back to Anaheim for your next visit to Disneyland.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary Heading: Good, affordable hotel for the area
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It is relatively affordable for the area (Anaheim), about a 5 minute walk to the convention center, and a 20-25 minute walk to Disneyland. I found the employees to be very pleasant, helpful,and easygoing. The rooms were clean and I like how you could use your Netflix account on the televisions.  The beds were sort of lumpy and uncomfortable, not what you would expect when you're paying $150/night on average. Housekeeping did a good job of cleaning every day, changing towels, etc. The room was quiet and I didn't hear a lot of activity in other rooms. Since I was here for a convention at the convention center, this was the perfect location for me. For families looking to go to Disneyland, it is about a mile away and I don't believe there
Manager Response: Dear bbb421,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay. I'm very glad to read that you enjoyed your stay and found our rates to be an affordable option for families travelling to Anaheim. I would like to make one note about your review: Although our hotel does not provide a shuttle to Disneyland we utilize the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle which offers unlimited rides to the parks (and around the resort area) every 20 minutes at the cost of $5.25 for adults (ages 10+) and $2 for children (ages 3-9).  Thank you again,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value, but rooms need improvement
Summary: I spent 3 nights at this Courtyard while visiting Disneyland.  Whether paying by cash or points, this hotel was significantly the cheapest Marriott in the area.  The room itself was a typical Courtyard in terms of decor and room size.  It appeared to be renovated within the past few years; however, it could definitely be better maintained.  There were signs of wear and tear throughout the room, including stains on the headboard and numerous marks on the bathroom walls.  It looked like a previous guest had attempted to carve their name into the desk.  The sheets were scratchy and some of the pillowcases had noticeable pilling on them.  The mattresses were a bit on the softer side- though I got a good night’s sleep, when I sat on the edge of the bed you could feel it sink and
Manager Response: Dear mbg996,  Thank you for taking the time to offer feedback about your stay, although I hope the next time you stay with us we can do what it takes to get the 5 Star review. With that said, I want to note that the ART shuttle runs to Disney every 20 minutes and starts on hour before the park opens and stops a half hour after the park closes. Although there is no shuttle pick up at our property, the shuttle does pick up at the Anaheim Marriott, which is connected to our hotel via a walkway adjacent to our parking area. I hope this information helps any readers thinking about using the ART shuttle for their Disney transportation needs. Thank you again and I hope we have the chance to welcome you back to Anaheim in the future.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager

Summary: Great hotel, friendly employees. Nice pool and jacuzzi with excellent customer care. They have excellent downstairs activity and accommodate any needs necessary for your visit to be very pleasing. Recommend it!
Manager Response: Dear kajal0329,  Thank you for the kind review. As a father, I know the most important hotel amenity to my kids is a heated pool, so I'm glad you enjoyed ours.  All the best,  Roger Rodriguez General Manager
