Manager Response: Dear rjp94952,  Thank you for your positive review!  We are so happy you chose our hotel to make wonderful and warm memories with your family.  There are many convenient ways to get to the park for our hotel.  I am glad you found the one that worked best for you.  I am delighted to hear that your stay was a memorable one and that a crib was all ready for you!  I will make sure to share your feedback with the team.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Very comfortable hotel with Starbucks in the lobby. Nice and close to Disneyland. Hotel staff was professional and helpful. Watch out for people on skateboards....they will run you over on the sidewalks on Harbor Drive.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was very happy with my stay at the Courtyard in Anaheim.  The staff was helpful in every way.  The room is very comfortable and the bed was also.  Slept like a rock every night.  I thoroughly recommend this motel to anyone thinking about going to Anaheim for work (which is the reason I was there) or to play at Disneyland.  There are restaurants close by within walking distance and the staff was very good at recommending places to eat.
Manager Response: Dear ckinzell,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying at the Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  We know your time is very valuable.  Our location is very convenient and we are glad that you enjoyed some of the most wonderful dining options in the area.  Sleeping is also very important and sleeping like a rock is the best way!  I made sure to share your comments to the entire staff. They all smiled and were so happy!  If there is anything we can do for you, please reach out.    Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed here at the beginning and end of VidCon.  On our first night we were bumped to a suite.  The room was huge and clean.  We returned at the end of our stay and this time were booked in a regular room.  The bathroom was nicer than the bathroom at the big convention center Marriott.  The pool and hot tub area is nice.  There is also a wading pool for the little little kids.    The best part of our stay was the staff.  Everyone was helpful, professional and great.  It was very busy - all the hotels were overbooked because of VidCon and other events.  The staff was professional no matter what disgruntled guests said to them.  I think it is important for folks to realize that the front desk folks are not responsible for overbooking.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone in
Manager Response: Dear lhymowitz,  Thank you for your feedback while visiting us!  We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your room, the pool area and our customer service.  You are very important to us and we love your understanding!  We look forward to seeing you next year.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This was an excellent hotel and I would highy recommend it to all my friends and family! we will definetly be back when visiting Anaheim again. The staff both management and regular team members were ALL so profesional and friendly, made us feel so at home and welome.
Manager Response: Dear tannahiatt,  Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback.  We are excited to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that we made you feel at home.  This truly made our day.  We look forward to your next visit.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I guess in the five or six times I talked to people at this hotel no one ever told me they don't take cash at check-in and a credit card for incidentals.. You have to have a credit card.  Well,  I do not have a credit card (on purpose) for the large amount I needed but I did have cash.  This trip was a present but because they would not take CASH the gift recipient had to put it on her credit card.  Talk about embarrassing.  The room was a room, the beds uncomfortable and if the bathroom door was open you could not open the front door.  Three good things:  short walk to the convention center  and they did provide a shower chair. and the maids were absolutely the nicest and accomodating of all of the people there., but   I will not stay there again or recommend it to my friends.
Manager Response: Dear cafegirl29,  I want to thank you for taking the time to share your experience while visiting the Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  I am glad to hear that you found our location convenient and that our housekeeping department gave you great service.  Thank you for acknowledging our team.  My apologies that a valid credit card is needed to check in and that information was not explained to you.  It is the policy of hotel.  You are very important to us and we hope you understand that we are following proper procedures.  Sincerely, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The room was very clean and nice. The service was excellent! There's nothing else they could improve. The breakfast downstairs was very delicious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that's staying here in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear ismailm72,  We are so delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  You are so important to us!  The bistro is the perfect place to sit down, relax and enjoy a hearty breakfast.  Our guests need energy to face the fun filled activities Anaheim has to offer.  The team and I are looking forward to your next visit.  Thank you for making our day!  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The hotel is within walking distance to the convention center and many restaurants. It's only about a mile and a half from Disneyland. Great location! We stayed for business and the little cafe was perfect for breakfast every morning and for a quick drink in the evening.
Manager Response: none

Summary: All just as expected for a Marriott property. Easy check in with courteous service. Staff was very helpful with shuttle to Disney, dining nearby and parking. Have only positive things to say as an established world traveler.
Manager Response: Dear Matt K,  Your feedback really made my day.  I have shared it with the entire team.  Thank you very much for taking the time.    We hope to see you again the next time you visit Disneyland - the happiest place on earth.  Thank you for your business and loyalty.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This Marriott was very clean and seemed to have been recently renovated.   Rooms were very comfortable.  I would recommend this Marriott for both pleasure and business.  Very high quality with a reasonable cost.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed in Family Suite. Nice room. Loved having separation from kids but still close enough. Staff was amazing. When we needed something that hotel was out of, the desk person volunteered her own. The cafe staff also very great. Very helpful and accommodating. Would stay again in an instant. Expensive for two days, but still worth it.
Manager Response: Dear Diane R,  Thank you so much for your positive review while staying with us.  I agree with you, the family suite is perfect.  Everyone is happy and comfortable.  I appreciate you recognizing our front office and bistro teams.  They love to hear from you our special guests.  We all look forward to your next visit.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for half a week, and then moved to a Disney hotel the other half of the week.   The rooms at this hotel were much larger, and the bathroom very large, in comparison to the Disney hotel, which cost more.  The only downside is that it is too far to easily walk to Disney, so we had to pay for parking.  But if you are spending your vacation time at the beach or elsewhere most of the days, this hotel is excellent.  It was also extremely clean, and one day we were in and out so much they didn't have a chance to clean it, but they came in and did so while we were at dinner!  I didn't expect that.  The Courtyard/Marriott is opening a hotel much closer to Disney, with a water park for the children.  If I had to go back, that is where I would stay over a Disney hotel
Manager Response: Dear Beccafrooloo,  We thank you for your time!  The team and I are delighted that you enjoyed your stay.  You are making great memories with your family.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for.  We all look forward to your next stay with us.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Slow elevator, no free coffee, & no coffee before 7 AM!
Summary: I DO NOT recommend this hotel at all.  This is probably one of the biggest disappointments I've had at a Marriott hotel ever.  The first think you will deal with when you arrive is a slow elevator.  I don't mean just slow, but excruciatingly slow!  The slowness is exacerbated by the bad design, whereby the entire staff uses the same, main elevator as the guests, and they are constantly on it with carts, cleaning, and maintenance supplies.  No kidding, i timed it once, but to go from my room 15 feet from the elevator on the 4th floor to the lobby and back (just picking something up) took almost 15 minutes.  Once you settle in, the beds seem quite worn out.  After sleeping one night, my shoulder hurt so bad it felt like it was dislocated and I've never had a shoulder problem
Manager Response: Dear John S,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.    As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the lack of customer service. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.    Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Recent Stay at Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort
Summary: This is an excellent medium sized hotel located within easy walking distance to the Disneyland Resort.  It has everything you would expect, and is ideal for family as well as other aged groups.  The rooms are fresh and comfortable and the staff friendly and accommodating. We have stayed there for the past three consecutive years.  Good sized swimming pool.
Manager Response: Dear Alexander C,  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort / Convention Center.  I will make sure to share with the team.  Have a great summer and safe travels!  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I just spent 5 days at the courtyard Marriott near Disneyland.  Nice comfortable rooms and comfortable bed with plenty of pillows.  Staff very courteous and helpful. Wireless and LAN Internet was included.
Manager Response: Dear Marie N,  We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  If we can be of further assistance, please reach out to our team.  Have a fun filled and safe summer.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel has clean rooms, friendly staffs and good restaurant. The checkin and out process was very smooth. I would recommend this property to everyone even if you don't want to go to Disney. I dont think they should charge that much for parking but that just minor. If we come back to LA, We will stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Tyler  S,  Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience while visiting the Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  We are the perfect hotel for families visiting Disneyland.  Thank you for making memories at our hotel.  Have an awesome summer!  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is a nice hotel... like it a lot. But be aware of the rising prices. Hotel costs... then parking costs, breakfast costs, etc. Other tham that is simple and nice. Were hardly there due to Disney. There was a small issue at check in but it was quickly rectified. Hotel could use more attention to detail.
Manager Response: Dear InnoAvenue,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback.  We hope you had a wonderful time at Disney.  We look forward to your next visit,  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, helpful friendly staff, nice rooms, almost killed me.......
Summary: I hate to have to give this place less than 4 stars, but their lack of attention to detail could have killed me.  The location is walking distance to Disney and is surrounded by restaurants.  The hotel restaurant however is awful.  Skip it.  Nice pool with lots of sunlight hours.  Great launch location to hit the beach.  Newport, Huntington, Laguna all within 30 minutes.  However, I have a severe feather allergy.  The website permits you to request a feather free room, and i did.  However, I awoke the first morning with a closed throat, wheezing and sneezing horribly.  I opened a pillow case and guess what fell out. F'n feathers!  The cleaning person informed me EVERY room has a mixture of half feathered and half non-feather pillows. To the manager;s credit she offered to send
Manager Response: Dear Zen H,  I am deeply sorry for what occurred.  I sent you a private email as you are very important to us.  If there is anything we can do for you, please let us know.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: very impressed for the service after I checked in. But the first time when I made extended stay request on July 7, a male from your reservation dept. was not nice and ask me pay $300 more for the extended day stay and also need to switch room during my stay.  I did not accept. I called your reservation dept again and hope some one  else can help me. Unfortunately I got same guy, I ask his name and he refused to spell it and hang off the phone. I feel insult and called your front desk directly. A nice lady helped me adding one more day stay and no need to switch room. Many thank for her. My kids are happy not to switch the room often.
Manager Response: Dear hu2008,  Thank you for calling our hotel directly.  I am happy to hear that we were able to make things better for you and your family.  You are very important to us.  We look forward to your next visit.  Please contact us at the hotel so we will have everything ready for you and your family.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Wow! What a great little hotel. We stayed here for a Disneyland Vacation and thought the place worked out splendidly.   There were four of us in our party and we reserved the Family Suite which was  perfect. It was super clean and had a door dividing the two rooms. A well thought out use of space. You can easily fit 2 adults and 3-4 kids in this room, or 3 adults and two kids. I wouldn't do more than 3 adults in this room. The room also had a microwave and refrigerator for snacks and drinks.   We used the ART shuttle from the Marriott hotel across the parking lot. I'd say it's about a 1/3 of a mile walk. The ART cost $5 a day per person and you can purchase the shuttle passes at the Marriott which also has a Disney Desk for park passes.   We took an afternoon break from
Manager Response: Dear Shelleeee,  Your review just made us all smile - the entire day!  Thank you from all the team at the Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  I am also a huge fan of the family suite.  It is perfect to relax, unwind and have family time together before heading out to the happiest place on earth - Disneyland!  The ART is a great option too!  We look forward to your next visit.  Please give us a call so that we have your family suite ready for you.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Short trip to disneyland. Location was perfect. Rooms very clean. Always had plenty of towels and toiletries. The breakfast area was nice to pick up a quick breakfast or to sit and relax. Food was very good.
Manager Response: Dear Andrea S,  Thank you for choosing our hotel while visiting Disneyland.  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed our services and location.  We look forward to your next visit.  Hopefully you can stay longer.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you,  Till next time!  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Thoroughly enjoyed my experience at the Anaheim Courtyard. I had been looking for a good quality, but affordable, hotel to serve as my "base camp" during a recent conference for work. Everything met or exceeded my expectations.
Manager Response: Dear cbuettner2015,  Thank you for choosing our hotel while conducting business in the area.  The team is very excited to hear that we exceeded your expectations.  We know your time is very valuable so we appreciate you taking the time to share your positive feedback.  We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Very friendly, attentive staff! Clean, well-serviced property. Our room was great for our family of four! Our kids loved having bunk beds! Great kids' breakfast options and well priced! We didn't have a chance to swim because we spent most of our time at Disney, but the pool looked very nice! A bit further walk to the Disney parks than we have had with other Anaheim resort hotels, but we would stay again!
Manager Response: Dear leapx2,  Thank you for choosing our hotel while visiting the happiest place on earth - Disneyland!  We are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed our family suite.  It is perfect for children as they are spacious and the bunk beds make it so much fun.  The bistro has the perfect menu and is very kid friendly.  I will make sure to share your wonderful experience with the entire team.  We appreciate your business and loyalty.  If there is anything we can do for you, please let me know.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Not too far from Disneyland and close to a number of amenities and restaurants. Rooms were comfortable but could've been a little nicer- maybe I'm just used to staying in really nice rooms. Room had a bit of a musty smell but ok for a brief layover to recharge batteries.
Manager Response: Dear perthboy2015,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience while staying with us.  I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed our convenient location and you were able to rest a bit.  Please let me know if I can be of further assistance.  Have a fun filled and safe summer.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: I loved the service, location fo Courtyard Anaheim. You can walk to convention center and the hotel & staff were outstanding and immaculate.  The beds were new with top grade memory foam for an excellent nights sleep.  Sincerely,  Mike
Manager Response: Dear michaelfidkowski,  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  Our location is ideal for all the fun Anaheim has to offer.  The team is very happy to hear that our service exceeded your expectations.  Thank you for your business and loyalty.  We look forward to your next visit.  Have a fun and safe summer!  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Next room with babies and heavy used diapers odor!
Summary: Super helpful staff when next morning odor Seward type thought was the bathroom but after some research odor was coming form next door by the interconnecting door went down and explain front desk staff were very concerned and tried to move me to another room but hotel was overbooked so housekeeping came and after apologizing for the smell actually it was even worts when we came back to the room they sealed the door all around with towels and spray deodorant liquid but literally empty a couple of large bottles over the towels and said Hope you can sleep in here ! Anyway that helped a lot next day at check out they didn't charge me for that night they blew my mind really and I'm sorry about this event nothing to do with that dirty guests next door !!! Room was great clean and tidy
Manager Response: Dear mauricio g,  Your feedback really made our day!  Thank you very much for sharing.  Even though there was an uncontrollable issue encountered, I am delighted to hear that our staff exceeded your expectations.  If there is anything else we can assist you with, please reach to us.   Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Awsom staff. Friendly.   Clean helpful  they notified me of different events going on where to go help me with tickets to Disney & parking   The staff helped with directions to baseball stadium  when to go  & how to get back
Manager Response: Dear Badeaux12,  We know your time is very valuable and I  thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying with us.  I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay and our service.  It seemed like you had a very busy and fun trip!    The team and I thank you again and we hope to see you in the future.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: The Kids suite is fantastic for families of 5.   Has a bunk bed and sofa bed in a separate room and a King bed in the main room.    Room was clean and just what you would expect from a Marriott.  The last two times we stayed here you could hear noise from the room above you.  Overall it was not to bad.   The breakfast area is fantastic.  They offer menu items only.  This is a plus for us since we are not fans of the typical free buffet breakfast.  And it seems to be quiet and have plenty of seats available.  The food is really good too.   The hotel is about a two mile walk to Disneyland.  The hotel offers a shuttle service from the nearby Marriott. We drove to the Disneyland parking garage. This seemed to be easier for us.    Nice hotel.  Service was fantastic.  I would stay
Manager Response: Dear Soar573,  Your feedback made my day and made our team very happy!  We are here to make sure you are taken care of and enjoy your time away from home.  I am a huge fan of our family suite too!  It is perfect, it makes every family member happy.  The bistro does offer a great variety of food.  Whether it a quick grab and go or if you have the time to sit down and enjoy a warm and hearty breakfast. Great time to catch up with the family before heading out to the day's fun activities.  We look forward to your next visit.  Thank you for your time, business and loyalty.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel and the staff was very nice/helpful, but not as close as you think to Disney. They need a shuttle to Disney and other places. Breakfast was too expensive, but there are places to eat nearby. I would recommend staying there if you are ok with walking about 1.6 miles to Disney and ok with pay for breakfast. They need to do a little work on the pole and clean the hair and stains.
Manager Response: Dear Lewis G,  I am happy to hear that our service exceeded your expectations.  We are here to make your stay as memorable as possible.  You are very important to us.  Your feedback has been shared with the appropriate team.  We hope that you will come visit us in the near future again.  Thank you for your business and loyalty.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great place for families at Disneyland. Its a little far of a walk for small kids but its a great value. Having an in-room fridge is nice and the amenities are nice. Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear jamestI9969ST,  Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to share your experience while staying with us.    We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  I agree with you, having a mini fridge in the room is essential.  The amenities we offer are perfect for families and it looks like you all had a great time!  We appreciate your business and loyalty.  If there is anything we can do for you, please contact us.  We look forward to your next visit.  Have a safe and fun filled summer.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Really enjoyed staying here with my family.  We had a "family suite" so the kids got to have their area and the parents theirs.  Property was real close to Disneyland (walkable).  The staff was very friendly and courteous.  They responded to our needs promptly and with a smile.  Couldn't have asked for a better experience.
Manager Response: axelfoley2015,  We are so delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay!  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  We truly appreciate it.  Enjoy your summer and we hope to see you in the future!  Sincerely,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: The location & facilities I would rate 4 star. Very clean, nice, facilities. However, they have charged me double of my room charges. We stayed for a week. It was 1,100$. Double that it's 2,200$charge
Manager Response: Dear laurairene3,  Thank you for your feedback as we know your time is very valuable.  I am sorry to hear that there were some issues with your stay.  Please let me know if all has been resolved as you are very important to us.  We look forward to hearing from you.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: The staff was friendly and the area was nice.  The room was clean other than the shower.  We stayed a total of 3 nights.  When we got there I took a shower and noticed a long red hair on the shower wall.  I did not touch it.  It was still there when we left 3 days later.  Which means you dont clean the showers when you switch guest.     Also, what would it take for a shuttle to Disney land to come directly to the hotel?
Manager Response: evan264,  Thank you for taking the time to share you experience while staying with us. I hope your family had a great time at Disneyland.  Even though I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our service, we fell short with the issue you encountered.  Please know that you are very important to us.  I apologize for the inconvenience and I hope that you will give us another opportunity to make your stay better.  If there is anything we can do for you, please contact us.    Enjoy the summer!  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Quick one night stay while working in the area.  Hotel was clean.  Service was great.  My only wish was that the hotel had a view of the fireworks.  I was working in my room and they sounded impressive.  Would have loved to see them.
Manager Response: HR_ontheroad,  We appreciate you taking the time out of your busy schedule to share your experience while staying at the Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.    I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your quick stay.  I will make sure to share with the team that our cleanliness and service exceeded your expectations.  I hear you in regards to the fireworks.  I hear them on my way home :)  Have a safe summer and we look forward to your next visit.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, good location
Summary: When we do family travel and stay in hotels, our preference is always Courtyard. Courtyard hotels have undergone big changes in the last few years, making the hotel look modern and stylish, yet reasonably priced. This particular Courtyard is in great location, close to Disneyland/California Adventure parks. Well kept and maintained, clean and fresh smelling lobby, friendly staff, rooms are clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the patio and pool area, as well as mini restaurant that offers breakfast and dinner. Would definitely considering staying at this hotel again when visiting Anaheim area.
Manager Response: Dear Bolor B,   I want to thank you for the wonderful feedback you have shared.  I look forward to sharing it with the entire team.  We are conveniently located to the parks and we are perfect for families!  I agree with you, Courtyards are modern, clean and have the great Bistro menu.  I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your clean and spacious room!  We look forward to your next visit.  Have a fun filled and safe summer.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: We chose the Courtyard Anaheim Resort for our recent trip to the Disneyland Resort; it was an excellent decision!   The hotel staff was courteous and welcomed us every time we entered the hotel. The front desk employees asked how the room was on several occasions and asked if there was anything that they could do to make our stay better. They were also pretty knowledgeable about the local area and Disneyland (useless for us, being former cast members at Disneyland nearly a decade ago- but great for anyone else staying there).  Our room was about what you'd expect for a business oriented hotel near a major convention center, decor was modern and had a slight Disney touch. The bathroom looked brand new and our bed was fantastic (especially for a hotel). I didn't notice any
Manager Response: JoshandIssa,  I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Providing the best customer experience is very important to the entire team.   I will share your feedback with all our team members.  Thank you for your time and we hope to see you in the near future.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is located about a 15 minute walk to Disney, or you can walk through the parking lot to get to the ART bus at the Hilton or Mariott convention center.   The hotel has limited food service, a basic breakfast menu, good espresso based drinks and a limited bar in the evening. The pool is nicely kept up, but was out of towels when I wanted to use it. Very slow elevator.  We were there with a group of students. We have several problems with our reservations, which were resolved.
Manager Response: Dear L W,  Thank you for sharing your feedback while staying at our hotel.  I am glad to hear that the location was ideal and that you enjoyed the expresso drinks.  I am sorry to hear about towels not readily available.  I will make sure to share with the team as you and your group are very important to us.  If we can be of further assistance, please contact us directly.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland even though it wasn't our destination.  Only a couple blocks a way from American Sports Center where we were going.  Within reasonable distance to Medieval Times and Knotts Berry Farm.  Room was kinda small for a family suite(up to 6 ppl) compare to others in the area.  Very clean and full of amenities like wall plugs everywhere in room for easy charging.  Even saw some in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear Tom N,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience.  I am delighted to hear that you found our location ideal for your needs.  We strive in providing the best stay for you and your family.  We look forward to your next stay when your travels bring you to the Anaheim area again.  Safe travels and have a fun filled summer.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Family Suite was Ok for sleeping purposes but not very comfortable or spacious enough to meet our needs. Desk staff told us there was no way to hook up PS4 to TV. Two days later we asked the maintenance supervisor and he came in and set everything up in 5 minutes. Location was good for easy walk to Convention Center. Shuttle to Disneyland is from nearby Marriott with no stops at other hotels.
Manager Response: Dear kennoe7,  Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We know your time is very valuable.  I am delighted to hear that you found our location convenient for your family.  What concerns me is that your request of hooking up the PS4 was not taken care of promptly.  Please know that  this is being addressed as we want to ensure you that will consider us again in the future.  If I can be of further assistance, please feel to contact me directly.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Okay hotel. Elevator was extremely slow.  Need to have ice water in the lobby. Pool needed to be open longer so you could relax after the park. Need better eating choices. Housekeeping have us pool towels instead of bath towels.
Manager Response: Dear Mindy T,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  Your feedback is very important to us.  We will look into all the items you mentioned.  Please feel free to contact our management team if we can be of further assistance.  Best, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what I expect from a Marriott property - terrible vacation
Summary: We booked a 7 day, 6 night trip to Anaheim for a Disneyland vacation. Prior to our arrival, my interactions with the hotel and staff were fantastic. We explained that our son has some special needs which they partially accommodated by upgrading us to a family suite. However, we are Gold Elite with Marriott and expected to be treated as such upon arrival and during our stay. Our room was not ready when we arrived and were told it would be approximately 30 minutes, we waited an hour, still not ready. When our room was finally ready, it was not on the top floor. This was one of the items that I had discussed in great detail prior to our arrival. We explained that we would rather have a standard room than a lower floor due to noise (our son is very sensitive to noise). Needless to
Manager Response: Dear  Happylaines  Thank you for sharing your experience at the Courtyard Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  As a Gold Member, we appreciate your feedback. I would like to expend my most deeply apology for the poor service you and your family encounter while staying with us. I would like the opportunity to make thing right and hopefully change the perception of our service. We take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. Please contact me at the hotel at your earliest convenience.   Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time   Sincerely, Violet Ayala Guest Service Manager violet.ayala@courtyardanaheim.com 714-740-2645

Summary: We stayed here while visiting Disneyland with our grandchildren. The location was quite close to the Park.  We had a Kid Suite which gave us a second room for the children.  It was very clean and well maintained with a large pool and hot tub (always a priority for the grandchildren).  The staff was friendly and responsive to any requests.  I would highly recommend this for families visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: suzanne548,  I am so happy to hear that you and your grandchildren enjoyed the family suite and the pool area.  We are perfect for families as our hotel is family friendly and located near all the fun attractions.  We look forward to your next visit.  Have a fun filled summer!  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel in a great location
Summary: I stayed here for a wedding. The hotel was clean, comfortable and conveniently located near to many restaurants and Disney Land. The staff here were friendly and helpful. This hotel offers good value for the money spent. I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Simone1019  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your lodging in the Anaheim Resort area. We are very grateful for the good comment and especially for your recommendation.  Thank you

Summary: Had cockroach in room & no one did anything about it after noticing manager & front desk :(. Not happy at all. Always had great service but this was the worst that I have ever exprecienced. That's all
Manager Response: Dear shayedasharefi, Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We are so sorry to hear that you encountered a most uncommon occurrence and that your stay was not typical of our Marriott experience. We are sincerely sorry that you had to come across a cockroach. While cockroaches are common in our warm Anaheim environment, they are most certainly not common in our hotel and we are absolutely horrified that you had to encounter one. We take this matter extremely seriously and while we did not come across any others in our inspection, we have since fumigated the room and performed extensive carpet conditioning. We empathize with this unfortunate occurrence and we are most sorry to hear that you felt there was no service recovery despite being contacted by two managers. It is important to us that our guests feel taken care of and we are very sorry that you were not given this impression. We do hope you will be back in touch with our Guest Service Manager to discuss this issue further and allow us to resolve it to the best of our ability after the fact. Thank you again for sharing your feedback. We take guest feedback very seriously and are always listening. Michael Rotunno, General Manager  Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center

Summary: We stayed four nights and the room configuration was perfect for a family. There was a separate room with a sliding door which had its own TV and bunk beds with bottom bunk being about 3/4 size.  Also a sofa bed in this room - which, very typically of most sofa beds - was not very comfortable. The 2 King beds in the other room were very comfy and good quality. The room size was good for 4 people.   Lots of towels for a family and a portable standing mirror in the bathroom was a big help so that makeup could be done outside the bathroom while others were having showers. Good thinking Marriott!     The room was clean and modern. The free wifi was reliable and consistent; no problems with it at all.  The front desk staff were very friendly, helpful, efficient and professional. We
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is very nice! My family stayed in one of the family suites and it was a good fit for the 5 of us. We're all adults too and we didn't feel cramped. The staff was super kind and very polite even though our room wasn't quite ready when we arrived. It is close to Disneyland and there is a convenient bus nearby to take you to the park. I would definitely consider staying here again. The only negative I have is that there is only one elevator for the entire hotel, staff included. This causes it to be a little bogged down during high traffic times like the morning and around dinnertime. Other than that, it's lovely!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay was great; ver friendly staff.  Great menu for the grill.  I'd love it next time we come back if they served iced tea!  The location was great, and the rooms were very clean.We had a fun..                     Gayle
Manager Response: none

Summary: Outstanding customer service. Cleaning service personnel on 4th floor were the nicest I've ever encountered. They always greeted us with a smile, said hello, and asked us about our trip. Our home away from home.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very good, could be better with a few changes
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights in June 2015. Location is very convenient for Disneyland visitors as you are literally within a short walking distance to the park. Several upscale steakhouses and many fastfood eating options are within easy walking distance. Many positives for this property. Top of the list is the very high level of customer service from the employees. It seems to be part of the culture. From the front desk people, to the Bistro staff to the housekeeping staff, without an exception they were friendly, helpful yet professional. The hotel is not on the Main Street so you have to look carefully for the sign, especially if finding it at night. Cleanliness of the hotel and surrounding property was excellent. Rooms were very clean and appeared to have been recently updated.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was new, in great shape, very attentive staff, very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. I'd go back there in a heartbeat. Darrell, at the front desk, puts a smile on everyone's face. Close to convention centre and amenities.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: Shuttle nearby for Disneyland. Great location and property. Staff was very helpful. We would stay here again if we ever are in the area again. We took the ART Shuttle from the hotel next door for $5 (entire day rate).
Manager Response: Dear jra1341,  We are delighted to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay.  It is our mission to make sure we make your life just a little bit easier.  We look forward to your future visit.  Have a great summer and safe travels!  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: I would have reviewed this hotel higher had it not been lacking in a few areas that I found inconsistent with the brand. At the outset, the front desk staff were outstanding, friendly and very helpful.  The same holds true for the room cleaning service folks.   The bar staff was woefully under trained.  The quality of the mixed drinks was poor, the red wine was warm, and the bar staff were unfamiliar with the items on the bar menu. The quality of our beds were not up to expectations of previous Courtyards (or Fairfield Inns) - we found ourselves rolling towards the middle. Our room was on the bottom floor, one room away from an exit.  The security guard exited / re-entered the door all night allowing it to slam shut followed by a clank of the lock.  Perhaps, if I was sleeping in
Manager Response: Dear jra1341:  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying with us.  We are delighted to hear that you received great customer service from our front desk associates.  My apologies for the issues you encountered at our bistro, I will be sharing your feedback with the entire team.  If there is anything else we can assist you with, please feel free to contact our management team. We hope to service you in the future.  Have a great summer and safe travels.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Highly recommend this place. Although have to pay $14 for daily parking, it was walking distance to the Toy Story store parking lot that in the long run cheaper than paying parking there. Nice decor, I think recently remodeled rooms. Great customer service, from the front desk to housekeeping staff who went out of their way to help us with our luggage. The only downfall is no free breakfadt. But I told staff that we plan to return here should we have another Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Courtyard Anaheim Resort Hotel was an idea location for my daughter, grandson and her childhood best friend. They were on holiday from the United Kingdom. I am a AAA and Mairiotts member and this was a perfect location for our Disney vacation. It was almost opposite the main entry to Disneyland. You could walk from the Woody car park in about 10 minutes which is great if you are visiting and don't want to drive. There are two great steakhouses on your door step and loads of local fast food junks on Harbor BLVD. This is a great location for a Disney vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great easy walk the "back way" to the convention center & simply beautiful walk down the street in any direction! Just loved this location! Hotel itself very modern & clean. Renata in housekeeping made us smile with her towel creations. And Mari at the front desk dug a safety pin out of her own purse when we lost a button. It's the little things that make it extra special :) Thank you!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, great service
Summary: The hotel is close to both Disneyland and Anaheim's Convention Center. Rooms are spacious and clean, and hotel staff accommodated all of our requests. They even had a nice card with a few goodies for my daughter when they found out it was her birthday! Great choice, would most definitely recommend to friends!
Manager Response: Dear ccorra,  We are delighted to hear you had a great stay!  We all wish your daughter a happy birthday.  The team is excited to see you and your family in the future.  Have a great summer and safe travels.  Best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Built illogically, rooms dark and hot, not sound proofed, poor check-in
Summary: We are currently staying here, and if it weren't for being our sixth hotel in three weeks (on our annual trip back home to the US, this being the fourth Courtyard), we'd probably move to another location. We arrived early, and I'd checked in online saying we'd arrive at 11 am. I knew it was a long shot, but couldn't hurt to ask. When we arrived our room wasn't ready. No big deal, we went to eat lunch. Came back around 2, when we were told it probably would be ready, to find it wasn't. The girl said she'd call housekeeping to speed it up, and it'd be ready in 30 minutes. Came back just after 3, and it still wasn't ready! As a newly Gold Elite member, this was very disappointing. Our room was supposed to be on the 4th floor, but because we were so tired we agreed to take whatever
Manager Response: Dear Katelyn C,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience.  Your feedback plays an integral part in finding better ways to make your life just a bit easier.  I sincerely apologize for the issues you encountered.  I am sharing your information with our team and we are hoping to find quick solutions.  You are very important to us and the summer is our busiest time.    If you would like to further discuss your stay, please feel free to reach out to our management team.  My best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: The location and rooms were great. The only thing that I had an issue with was the lighting in the room. I had the kid/family room and while the kids side was well lit the other side with the king bed was very dim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As always, I booked my room on Marriott.com.  I clearly indicated that I would need a crib/playpen and extra towels. I also requested an upper floor room.  Upon check in, the clerk went through the motions of checking people in with little expression or eye contact. I did not feel welcomed. I asked if the crib/playpen was available.  He stated that our reservation did not indicate one was asked for.  I then asked if we had the extra towels.  He stated 'I'm sure you do."  I asked him how they knew I wanted extra towels but not the crib/playpen and proceeded to show him my email confirmation from Marriott showing both the towel request and the playpen.  He just looked back down at his computer and said nothing.  I was assigned a ground room floor.  So much for the 'upper floor'
Manager Response: Dear 613douga,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while visiting us.  I truly apologize for the issues you encountered at check in.  I can assure you that this is not normal of our team and I will be sharing your feedback.  You are very important to us.  Please reach out to our management team if there is anything we can do for you at this time.  My best,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: I attended a 4 day national conference in the area. It was GREAT to have the ability to do work each morning and return in the late afternoon to relax before evening events. I also had time to relax in the pool!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great facility and staff. Rooms were clean and bed was comfortable. Kids enjoyed the bunk beds and we had a room with a view of the fire works each night. The elevators are a little slow but that would be the only issue we had with the hotel. Great hotel, will stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Courtyard Anaheim Marriott for a two night stay and loved the hotel.  The staff was very personable and professional.  Our room was wonderful and very clean and updated.  The lobby was very modern and beautiful.  We were able to catch the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) at the Marriott hotel next door.  It was a quick three to four minute ride to Disneyland.  A three day pass was only $12.  Well worth the money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for Disney Half-Marathon, staff was friendly and helpful.  Rooms were clean as well as property.  Good food in the service area and good WI-FI connection. I will definitely stay her again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good lower-priced alternative to Marriott and Hilton for conventions
Summary: My perspective is a little different from most of the other reviewers because I came alone for a conference and had no interest whatsoever in Disneyland. So this is a solo business traveller review.   The Marriott was sold out for my conference, so I chose the Courtyard because it was walking distance from the Marriott (the conference hotel). It is indeed a very short walk, so well chosen on that score. I loved the bed - firm but also kind of soft at the same time, with good linens and firm pillows (I hate pillows that go flat) - and agree with other reviewers that the room is spacious and well-decorated. I did not need any unusual service during my stay, but the service I did receive from the front desk was good.   The dining options are pretty limited, which one should expect
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel several times before since its been redone and have enjoyed each and every stay. The rooms (this trip we stayed in 455) are a decent size, bathrooms and toiletries both good, and the bedding very nice. The faux-down pillows and high thread count sheets were a nice surprise and made for a good night's sleep. The staff is friendly and helpful. We have never eaten at The Bistro but it looks excellent and we have not taken the shuttle to the park as it is within about 12-15 minutes walking distance. One night when we were tired we took and uber back from DL and it was only 4$ - well worth it if you don't want to walk. Our room was a great value and we will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Notorious_CHP,  Thank you for staying with the Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort/Convention Center many times.  We are excited to hear about the comfortably of your stay from the plush pillows to the soft sheets.  When you do try the Bistro, you will be pleased.  We also are near ART Shuttle service which cost $5 per person for all day that will drop you off at Disneyland and pick you up.  The ART shuttle runs every 20 minutes during park hours.  Thank you for sharing your experience!  Michael Rotunno, General Manager

Summary: We were pleased with our first stay, EXCEPT they ignored our 2 different requests for additional towels because they did not provide enough towels for all of us.  The front desk's "sorry" did not resolve the lack of towels, nor did housekeeping ever appear after either request.  We gave them a second chance several months later because: 1. we liked the large room size (unusual in hotels, but great for people traveling with kids on a budget), 2. the cafe's breakfasts were great (if you have teens, it is worth it to purchase as part of the hotel bundle), and 3. we could purchase Disney tickets and catch the shuttle at the Marriott next door.  However, we will not return a third time.   I thought the towel issue was a fluke, but, alas, they are towel Scrooges. When they cleaned our
Manager Response: Dear TravelJunkie1967, Thank you for sharing your experience.  I am glad to hear you were pleased with the size of the rooms and the convenience of buying Disneyland Tickets at our hotel. I am disappointed to learn about your situation with the linen. We can assure you that this situation is a one time event.  We strive to uphold a very high standard of service.  With your feedback, we are able to improve upon our processes. Thank you so much for staying with us and we hope to see you next time! Kindest Regards, Michael Rotunno,General Manager

Summary: Overall your typical Courtyard, rooms well appointed, staff was friendly, check in easy. Parking was I think $11, as almost all he hotels along Harbor Blvd. have been charging for some time.  We did the walk to Disneyland has my wife needed fitbit steps, it's about 15+ minute walk to the parks.  I actually found the bed really uncomfortable way to firm, bur my wife said they were fine, so not sure.  You can take the ART shuttle from the full service Marriott at the convention center to Disneyland for a few bucks, so that's a good option if you don't want to walk to Parks.  Hotel was quiet too, unlike that Fairfield Inn down the road which can be noisy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Less than a mile from the Disneyland Resort. We stated with my son and grand-kids this summer. Great location so very close to Disneyland. Good free hot breakfast with lots of selections. Rooms were very spacious and clean. The beds were so comfortable. Went swimming the pool with kids. It's a short walk to the Anaheim transit bus stop that takes you to the Disney resort.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was friendly and it was a quick check in/check out process. We were exhausted because we had been at Disneyland all day so we were glad the check in process was quick. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The room was very spacious and the decor was nice. It was within walking distance to restaurants and Disneyland. I would definitely recommend it to family and friends. The price is very reasonable. Will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Christina R,  Thank you for sharing your stay at our hotel.  We are glad to hear that you had a fantastic stay.  We pride ourselves on our service and cleanliness at the Courtyard Marriott Anaheim Resort/ Convention Center.  We are glad you were able to take advantage of the close proximity of Disneyland and local restaurants.  Thank you for staying with us!  Michael Rotunno, General Manager

Summary: Only a mile from the Disneyland Resort and within walking distance of several great restaurants and amenities (drugstores, Target) makes this a perfect location for our family when visiting the Magic Kingdom. The rooms are spacious and well appointed – all rooms have ample clothing storage and a refrigerator. The housekeeping staff is very friendly and accommodating. Bonus points for the small restaurant serving cooked-to-order breakfast and evening snacks. Internet (complimentary) was reasonably fast. The pool looked great – but it was raining, so we didn’t swim. The parking lot was usually pretty full (additional charge) but we were always able to find a space. Overall, clean, friendly, comfortable, and priced competitively. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for your wonderful review about our hotel. You pointed out some great benefits of staying with. We are pleased to hear that everything was exceptional during your stay. I hope you choose to stay with us the next time you are visiting the Magic Kingdom.

Summary: My wife and I took our two little daughters here last September for my daughter's 3rd birthday. We drove from Seattle and it was the longest drive ever. Once in Anaheim, we arrived at Courtyard by Marriott. The hotel was perfect for Us and it exceeded our expectations.   Location: is perfect even though it's off the Disney resort. It's a short walk to the Anaheim transit bus stop that takes you to the Disney resort. Plenty of parking and close to the garden grove mall and restaurants.  Food: the cafe downstairs was perfect for us after long days at Disney. We had breakfast and several late night dinners here and it satisfied our appetites and the kids.  Rooms: rooms were very spacious and clean. The beds were so comfortable as none of us had problems sleeping and were well
Manager Response: Justin,  Thank you for staying with us during your daughters special occasion. I am pleased to hear that everything during your trip was perfect. We would love to have you stay with us again the next time you are traveling to the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Great location near Disney parks!  Safe, clean & friendly!
Summary: We took our granddaughter to Disneyland for her graduation. We chose this hotel because of the location, proximity to restaurants, shopping and of course Disneyland. We were very pleased with our entire experience. The hotel is clean, the rooms are very comfortable and well appointed. The gym is small but equipped with a weight bench and 3 cardio machines. The pool area was the only disappointment. Not because of cleanliness, but because it's a bit dated and right off the parking lot. We didn't utilize the pool as our trip was during the recent cool wet weather. There is a shuttle ($5 round trip) from neighboring Marriott Hotel, Starbucks is there as well. 5 minute walk.  The  hotel staff is outstanding!  Everyone I came in contact with was kind, professional, knowledgable,
Manager Response: Michelle766,  Congratulations to your grand-daughter for her achievement. I am very pleased that you enjoyed your recent stay with us! Thank you for your kind words about Ivan, he will be happy to see that he was able to make your night a great one. We will enjoy making your next stay with us as enjoyable as your last. Please come see us again the next time you are in Anaheim.

Summary: Exceptional customer service. As a Guest Rewards member for about 30 years, I can honestly state that this was a "top 10" stay. I am definitely not a fan of Courtyard's Bistro concept, but everything else about this stay was excellent. Special thanks to Sales Manager Connie for being willing to go out of the way to provide us with an umbrella due to unexpected rain as we did not have a car on this trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and for rating us a "top 10" stay! We are excited to hear that you had an excellent stay. I hope you will stay with us again the next time you are in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Booked on Marriott.com with AAA discount
Summary: I managed to get a really good deal on this hotel. The Marriott website with the AAA code was the best offer even with all those discount travel sites. I had a double queen Friday and Saturday for $99 a night.   I visited Disneyland and the staff at the courtyard helped me purchase discounted tickets that morning. Take the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) to and from the park. It's only$5 a day and you hop on at the Marriott across the way. I drove to the park one day and ended up spending 45 min trying to park because the lots fill up quickly.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. It was very nice of you to point out some of the benefits of staying at our hotel. We hope you choose to stay with us when you are in town.

Summary Heading: Family with small child stay for disneyland
Summary: Friendly staff and great location for disneyland. Plenty of towels and pillows. You have to pay daily for parking though and breakfast is not included, however the bistro was decent. The beds were fairly uncomfortable and the closet doors were annoying because the closet was tilted forward. The tv was ok but all in all the room was clean and i was happy with the cleaning services. Theres laundry service available as well. Id recommend it for short term stay if youre looking for a place to sleep while youre out most of the time. Good location for disneyland if you dont mind the 25 minute walk.
Manager Response: Sarah B.,   I want to thank you for taking the time out of your day to review our property. I would like to apologize that your stay wasn't completely up to your expectations. We take pride in our staff and our hotel, if you would like to email me any feedback that would help us in making your stay exceed your expectations the next time you're in Anaheim I would greatly appreciate that. My email address is jared.tillman@courtyardanahiem.com. As for your kind words about the staff and the service they provided I will pass that along to them to encourage them to keep up the great work. Once again thank you for your time and we hope to see you the next time you visit Anaheim.

Summary: Upon check in the staff was very friendly and helpful. We felt welcome from the beginning. The room was very nice and clean. The bed was comfortable and the room temperature was great. The checkout process was easy and once again the staff was friendly and courteous. We will definitely stay there again. Also not a bad walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Darin H,  I am so pleased that our staff made you feel welcome right from the beginning and through-out your entire stay. I will be passing your kind words on to the staff so they know of the wonderful service they provided you. We will be honored to repeat that level of service the next time you stay with us. Thank you for this wonderful review.

Summary Heading: Very nice and low key visit
Summary: Every employee we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff kept our room beautifully. Off the main road just enough, so the hotel seemed more relaxed. Nice pool area, and about 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Took a taxi back one day and it was right around $7 (not including tip) ART bus a possibility but we just walked. Might be a good idea with little kids at the end of the day. We had a quick breakfast in the bistro one morning and it was good, my Starbucks Americano was great! I got an excellent deal using an Expedia coupon but the prices on the Marriott website were good too. Wouldn't hesitate to book here again.
Manager Response: Hjwells,   I would like to thank you for your very kind words regarding our staff. I will make sure to pass along your comments and encourage them to keep up the great level of service you received. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: Good Hotel, close to the restaurants, Disneyland coffee house, and the yummy Ruth Chris SteakHouse.  Very close to the convention center walking distance to the park.  The also have a shuttle you can pick up next door at the other Marriott Hotel.  The staff are friendly and the lobby area was quiet if you needed to get some work done.
Manager Response: Mishelle V,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your time with us. Our hotel is located near many attractions in the Anaheim Resort area and I am glad that worked to your benefit by staying with us. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: My husband and I were in Las Vegas for a conference and decided to take a side trip to Disneyland afterward. I like to stick with Marriott and for one night this was a good choice. I received a great AAA rate. The front desk staff was polite and helpful. I liked the coffee shop in the lobby, very convenient. However, I was shocked at the $14 parking fee! It wasn't valet parking, we parked ourselves for that I must pay $14? Parking fees are an absolute rip-off unless you're in the middle of a metropolitan city with limited options. The room was spacious (there were only two of us), comfortable beds and pillows. Very clean. It had a refridgerator that made a lot of noise, we had to unplug it. The elevator was very slow - only four floors. Rooms not noise proof if kids were running
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but not walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: One of the things I try to do when visiting Disneyland is stay in a hotel within close walking distance. As much as I enjoy the Courtyard properties, this one is not within walking distance. That said, they do have a bus that will take you there and that's convenient BUT...when you have children, there's nothing like a close place to crash which is why I prefer the location of the Fairfield Inn property instead.  This Courtyard property is very nice though, great rooms, super-comfy beds, friendly staff & love having the coffee shop in the lobby! If it were closer, I'd choose it instead 😊
Manager Response: none

Summary: First off want to state that my husband stays at Marriott properties at least 2 times a week every week and I've stayed at quite a few.  This by far has been the worst which is hard for me to say because I generally love Marriotts.  We booked a big 4 night stay + Disney trip for the family and chose this Marriott. Upon arrival, my reservation couldn't be found. Then after finding it, I was told we'd have to move on the last night because it was sold out. Huh? But that I could upgrade from the two queens they'd move us to (from a jr suite) for a fee. UMMM no. I paid for the jr suite, I want a jr suite....not 2 queens!  Finally I settled on just checking back in the am for the room update as I was tired!  Unfortunately, I was at their front desk sooner as my 11-year-old son
Manager Response: eastcoastgirl1976,  I would like to apologize that your stay with us wasn't what you expected it to be. If you would like to reach out to me directly and we can discuss what we can do to improve my e-mail address is jared.tillman@courtyardanaheim.com.

Summary Heading: The beds are not the only thing that's Magical...
Summary: This updated, contemporary hotel is just what you expect from a Courtyard. Nothing out of the norm except that it in less then a mile to the entrance of Disneyland. Comfortable beds, spacious room layout, good size bathrooms and an onsite cafe for eating in. They also offer a shuttle service that you pay for if you don't want to walk.
Manager Response: S V,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Our hotel just went through a $6 million renovation just under a year ago, and we are excited to see that our guests are enjoying the updates that were made. Hopefully you choose to stay at our property each time you come back to the Anaheim area.

Summary: My friend and I stayed here for a convention we were attending.  It was a nice hotel.  Very clean, friendly staff and the Bistro had a pretty good breakfast.  Everything I needed for the week was within walking distance.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a standard interior room overlooking the pool and courtyard. Very spacious, clean, quiet, comfortable, updated, well-equipped rooms. Very comfortable beds. Coffee maker and mini-fridge were nice, but a small microwave would have been great. Reception was friendly and efficient, but when we asked for a “local” dining suggestion they could not get past Bubba Gumps, Cheesecake Factory, Red Robin, etc. The on-site restaurant is bland and has a boring menu, but fairly priced and ok to grab a bite on the go. Good size swimming pool and lots of sun chairs, but unfortunate (and understandable) that it closes early—after a long day at Disneyland a soak in the Jacuzzi would have been nice. Speaking of Disneyland, it is a easy 15 minute walk to DL front gate, or there is free
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stay 2 night for disneyland  in family suite Family suite was wonderful - 2 queen bed, full bunk, and pull out sofa - family of 5 never been this comfortable in courtyard  Staff was friendly  Disney was close enough - first day we happen to have taxi (someone was drop off) was $8 to main gate  Swimming pool was small but was good for end of day after park  We would love to stay here again if we back to disneyland  Only "complain" was wall is thin we can hear everything from upstairs or hall way but my kids doesn't even notice since they were super tired from park  Great great family hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel right by the parks
Summary: We stayed here for spring break, the hotel staff was very helpful, answered all of our questions. We used our Marriott points to pay for our stay, so I can't speak about the price, however, parking was relatively cheap considering we didn't have to drive and park at Disneyland since there is a nearby shuttle to take you to the park. The shuttle isn't actually at the Courtyard, you have to walk next door to the actual Marriott (right next to the convention center) and go inside, pay for a shuttle pass ($5 for all day) and then you get a ride to the parks. Definitely better than driving and finding a spot, paying for parking, etc.  The hotel does NOT offer a breakfast (I don't think any Marriott does) but there is a (sort of pricey) bistro in the lobby. Also they have water
Manager Response: none

Summary: W were spending the week in San Diego and needed one night near Disneyland.  We didn't check in til just before midnight and checked out after an early breakfast to hit Disney again.  We found the room and hotel to be lovely.  Sorry we didn't have more time there to explore.  We found the breakfast to be very good.    A bit off topic -- We chose this hotel as we were staying on a Marriott rewards night but also chose this particular location for its proximity to Ruth's Chris Steak House(one of the better and more beautifully appointed ones in their chain, I might add!).
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the courtyard marriott for five nights during an epic Disney trip. Most of the features of the hotel were exactly what I've come to expect from a courtyard property. No room service, though food could be ordered from the in house restaurant and picked up. We only got breakfast, as it was included in our room rate. Food was adequate but nothing spectacular.  We were in the King family suite which means we had a king bed and a bunkbed for the kids. The room was large enough, though I would not call it spacious, and came with microwave and minifridge.  Housekeeping deserves lots of credit, as my kids destroyed the place every morning during breakfast, and every evening we dragged ourselves back to a refreshingly clean hideaway.  My only real complaint was with the beds
Manager Response: none

Summary: I write to warn of the sub par customer service I experienced at the Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort, through an honest mistake made by the front desk I was charged for a room that I shouldn't have been charged for. I will spare the details but it took nearly 2 weeks and countless emails and phone calls to be reimbursed. When i did get reimbursed I was reimbursed significantly less then I was charged because of the change in exchange rate between USD and CAD. When contacting the hotel about this, they said they could no way reimburse me for the discrepancy but would offer me a gift card, this was 2 months ago and it is yet to be received, I don't think that I would ever stay at a Marriott again, I believe in honoring your word and exceptional customer service, neither of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Kids suite awesome for mom and dad!
Summary: The kids suite at this hotel is the best buy on a suite near Disneyland.  The kids get their own room, bed, couch, tv and fridge.  Mom and Dad get a nice King bed with their own tv, desk and bar area and a sliding frosted door for privacy!!! Bathroom was large enough for all of our things, didn't feel crowded.  Lots of storage space for clothes and souveniers. $7 cab ride to Downtown Disney, $2.00 all day bus pass per person-stop right across the street or Marriott nextdoor sells shuttle (ART) passes with stop right in front.  Plenty of food within walking distance.  Quiet hotel as set back from the street.  Pool area large with hot tub. We will use again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself was pretty great! The beds were some of the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel. The staff were super friendly, and let us check in early right when we arrived. The hotel restaurant served Starbucks coffee, and I was able to call ahead in the morning and have my coffee waiting for me when I walked down, which saved a lot of time. The pool looked very nice, but we didn't get a chance to use it. The bathroom was very nice, but didn't have a fan, which I hate. We felt very safe at the hotel and the only reason i didn't give the hotel an excellent is because to catch the bus to the park you have to walk through the parking lot of the neighboring hotel and the back of this hotels parking lot. Not a huge deal, and not far at all. But with just me and my daughter
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here again for mini vacation. Loved it !!! The room was bigger this time and I loved everything about it. The only thing is I getted charged for every little thing like parking,occupant fee? What the heck is that but overall I  would stay again. The thing I love the most is its not crowded. Can't beat that!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A good option for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: The hotel overall was a great value for our trip to Disneyland, and was made even better with my Marriott rewards room upgrade. We ended up in a family suite, which was more room than we needed, but we used happily. 2 queen beds in the main space and an extra room with sofa bed and bunk beds! It could have slept 8, though the space is not great for that many people. But for 2 adults and one child, it was super roomy. As far as hotels go, it was very good. Here is a breakdowns of our pros and cons during the trip and you can judge whether or not the would affect you... Pros: The beds are so comfortable. I am huge fan of Marriott beds, and these were up to their standards. Super close to the convention center. Staff was extremely nice and responsive. Free, fast internet.  Cons:
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Property - Over Charge for Parking
Summary: I stayed here over MLK weekend for one night and enjoyed the property. It's really close to the park, I was able to power walk from my door to the gates of the park in 12 minutes. Regular pace would be 18-20 minutes. Another option as pointed out by a previous reviewer is to walk across the street to the Disney Toy Story Lot and take their shuttles. I found out it wasn't worth doing as it took just as longer or even longer.  The room of the hotel was good condition as you would expect of a courtyard. I was granted late check out by an hour which was nice. Also the bistro gave me a banana for free which was nice. Only downside was the fact that I had to pay $14 a day for parking - Disney charges $17 so it's pretty crazy they charge so much. Leaves a bad taste in my mouth on
Manager Response: none

Summary: Ok. I've lost count of how many courtyards I've reviewed.  This one was really no different than any of the others I've reviewed, other than my room was a King suite, which for a family of 3 or 4 that's visiting Disney, this room is perfect. I was on biz, so I didn't utilize it at all. It's clean and had a separate bedroom with French doors that shut separating the two spaces. There are bunk beds and a TV for the kids in the separate room, and there's space to spread out.   Other than $14 to park your car on site, another solid Marriott stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with my boyfriend for two nights to celebrate NYE at Disneyland (using points as I often do, so I can't speak about the price value).     I've been to my fair share of Courtyards and other Marriott hotels over the years, and this is by far the best decorated one I've seen.  Very modern and stylish; I loved the accent wallpapers in the room as well as the grey/yellow couch.      The room was very clean, the hotel was quiet, and the location great for our purposes.   There is a shuttle stop by the Marriott (which is just behind the Courtyard) that you can take to Disneyland (something like $5 a day- although we did not end up taking it).  We wound up walking back from Disney late in the evenings because shuttle lines were crazy long-- it's maybe a mile, mile and a
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm not picky and this place was completely sufficient. The good is that the rooms are quiet, they have a mini-fridge and are clean. The bad is that the shower head was way too short for me to use (I'm 6' 3" so perhaps it won't be small for everybody) but most negative was the lack of room service. If you want something, you need to get dressed and mozy on downstairs where you wait in line at the 'bistro' (which also serves beer in the evening). The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and if you are attending a convention at the center, you are only a quick 6-7 minute walk away.
Manager Response: I'm happy to know that you found your room clean and quiet and our staff friendly.  I can definitely understand how the standard shower head height is less than optimal for you. I hope you are able to avoid those middle seats on the airlines!  Thank you for staying with us.  Please choose us for your next trip to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: Arrived here early and was greeted by the very pleasant receptionist. Got my room quickly. The pool was great, the beds were great. I enjoyed my time in Disneyland. The only thing is there's limited parking and you have to walk to the other Marriott to get the shuttle to Disneyland which is a bit far. But overall I enjoyed my time and will come back for spring vacation.
Manager Response: I'm glad to know that you found our receptionist pleasant, beds comfortable and took advantage of our Southern California weather to enjoy the pool.  I'll be looking for your return in the Spring!

Summary: The rooms are clean, a good size and comfortable. Bathroom is nothing special, but clean and functional. The lobby is a little bland, and has snacks etc for purchase. Free wifi in lobby and rooms. Its a short walk via a couple of parking lots to the convention center Marriott. There you can get a bus to disneyland. One way tickets are $3, exact change required. Daily passes can be purchased ahead of time online (look for Anaheim Regional Transit), or purchased for $5 at the big Marriott's front desk. Its about a mile walk to Disney, but with the walking you'll do in the parks, you'll be thankful at the end of the day if you take the bus. There is a CVS pharmacy a block further beyond the convention center along the main road. Handy for drinks/snacks/forgotten toiletries and
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your visit to the Disneyland Parks.  I hope you found our Free WiFi convenient.  I'm glad to know that you found your room to clean and comfortable. Thanks for sharing the helpful information about the airport shuttle and the CVS just  down the street.  Looking forward to your staying with us again.

Summary: Stayed here a couple of times. It's clean.  A bit of a walk if kids are young but you can walk to Marriott convention center and take the shuttle for about $3 per person per day.  Shuttle comes about every 20 min but is unreliable. Nice to have a fridge in room.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us while you enjoyed the Disneyland Parks.  I'm surprised to learn that the ART shuttle was less than reliable.  I'll be sure to pass your concerns along to them.  I look forward to your bringing your family back soon!

Summary Heading: Convenient, nice rooms, close to Disneyland
Summary: I like the location, which although on Harbor Blvd, is somewhat secluded down a lane to the hotel. Closeby parking is usually available, at a daily charge of $14. There is no free buffet breakfast, but there is a café of sorts in the lobby. Hotel food and a bit pricey, we did not eat there. Foam mattresses, while not luxurious, are a little more comfortable than the upholstered concrete slabs usually found at hotels. Disney tickets can be purchased in the lobby. A 20 minute walk to Disneyland, so think about the ART, Anaheim Rapid Transit.
Manager Response: I'm glad you chose to stay with us while you visited the Disneyland Parks and found purchasing your Disney tickets from our hotel convenient.  My apologies for not pointing out our Green Features, such as our recycling and water saving initiatives. Please stop by and say "Hi" during your next visit.

Summary Heading: Close to the Magic and Disneyland
Summary: Great hotel that has been reinvented since my visit four years ago. It is a short walk from the convention center through the parking lot. It is also a plesant walk to Disneyland from here.
