The staff is still great professional and attentive and the addition of the cafe is great (only problem is they were overwhelmed with convention goers each morning)... Higly recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for coming back and remembering us after four years!  I'm glad to know that our staff did a great job being professional and attentive.  Your high recommendation is greatly appreciated.  I look forward to your return next time you're in the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: A very nice hotel with super friendly staff
Summary: I recently stayed here for a convention. The hotel was in a great location near the convention center (about a 1-2 min walk). It is a few city blocks from several restaurants. Everything was very clean and new and well-kept. The beds were comfortable and the linens were nice. I was in a corner room on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool, and it was very quiet. I did not use the pool or spa, but I did sit outside to eat breakfast and it was very well kept. All of the staff were friendly and helpful, especially Noel who was serving  in the "bistro" one evening. All of the staff should be thanked for their friendliness; it can really make someone's day better! After I checked out, they were able to hold all of my bags for me for the day until I left for the airport. I was very
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  It is always gratifying to know when the friendliness of our staff is recognized.  We know that you have numerous hotels from which to choose; and I believe, as in life, that it is the PEOPLE who have the greatest impact on your experience.  I hope that you will give us the opportunity to be your hosts during your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: I wasn't too stoked about my friend and I both having to pay $14 for parking since we both drove separately, but Darrell at the front desk was very friendly and gave us a free car spot since we were only staying for the night. Room and bathroom were very clean. The location is great, super close to the theme parks and I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank for telling us that you appreciated the efforts or our housekeepers and the benefits of Courtyard's Green-friendly processes.  I'm glad to know that Darrell was able to empathize with your parking concerns and provide a solution that fit your situation.

Summary: I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott with about 18 other people from work due to a convention close by.  The hotel was in a perfect location, right near the convention center.  It was actually walking distance to Disneyland, which we made the trip multiple times.  The rooms were nice and decently sized for 2 of us friends to stay in.  I wish they provided a continental breakfast, but that would have taken away from their little cafe/bar which was over priced.  The pool area was nice, which we spent quite a bit of time at and luckily with our group, there were rarely children around.  If I came to Anaheim again for work, I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks to you and your colleagues for choosing our hotel while you attended your convention.  It's great to know that our convenient location made it easy for you to get work done while still being able to explore Disneyland Park and the Anaheim Resort area throughout your stay.  I'm looking forward to meeting you during your next visit!

Summary: So relieved that we could check into our room when we arrived and not have to wait. Such comfy beds, everything we need. Staff are excellent, one found us a voucher for a free appetizer at Bubba Gumps which we used that night.
Manager Response: I'm glad we were able to get you into your room right away.  Sometimes that can be a challenge. I hope your family enjoyed your visit to the Parks even during the rare South Cal. rain! Thanks for staying with us during your trip to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We stayed here celebrating my daughter's 5th birthday a year ago and our accommodations were top notch. The room was spacious, the bed was super comfortable, and everything was super clean and updated.  Front desk help was polite and pleasant and the pool was great. It's not fancy on the outside or the lobby, but it's a great value for such a comfortable stay. We're going back in 3 weeks and can't wait! Btw the breakfast from the on site cafe was good, too!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us be your host for your daughter's birthday last year!  I look forward to welcoming you back with your 6 year old princess next month!

Summary: we arrived at the hotel a little past midnight. was only able to check in about 1 1/2 hrs later. Frontdesk (Courtney) doesn't even seem apologetic at all, even looked annoyed.   Rooms were okay. nothing fancy.   really bad frontdesk service.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry that our front desk associate treated you poorly!  I am embarrassed that we didn't welcome you, have your room ready, or treat you like the very important guest that you are.  Please know that I am sharing your experience with my team and I am working to ensure that this was an isolated incident that will not be repeated going forward. I hope that you will give us another opportunity to prove our commitment to your complete satisfaction during your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: This hotel was a great choice for us. Staff were very friendly and laid back but also super helpful. Room was awesome - we had the family suite with bunk beds for the kids. Pool was nice and sitting out in the hot tub after dark was awesome. Walking distance to Disneyland. My husband liked the exercise room and kids thought the arcade looked fun but we never went there - way too busy at Disneyland. The bistro is great for grabbing Starbucks and a bagel in the morning or a bite in the evening. Overall fantastic and a good price. We'll totally stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to affirm that we were able to contribute to your fun trip to Disneyland!  It's great to know that we succeeded  in providing you a fantastic experience at our hotel.  I look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort area!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and clean, but I hope you don't need anything.
Summary: The hotel is clean and has plenty of space. Not too far from Disneyland. We arrived early and asked if we could check in early and they said no so we waited in the lobby for an hour until they allowed us to check in. The next day we decided to get a couple extra blankets because the blankets are small so definitely not made for 2 people to share. So we called down to guest services around 2:30pm before heading out to explore and shop for the day asking them to bring extra blankets. When we got back, no blankets. It was now 12:30am. So we called again and they said they would bring them up. 1:15 hit and still no blankets. At this poor we were all ready for bed and in our pajamas and did not want to have to go downstairs. We called a third time, the phone rang for over a minute
Manager Response: I am so, very sorry  for our inability to provide you with extra blankets!  Please accept my sincere apologies. We are reviewing the events of the day, looking into our processes to make sure that such a simple request never goes unfulfilled again.  While we try our best to accommodate guests arriving early, sometimes we need to wait for guests from the prior night to depart before we can ready the room to the level you deserve. Thank you for your patience as you waited until a room was cleaned and made available.  Clearly we failed to provide the level of service you expected.  I ask that you please give us another chance in the future, to prove that we can, not only provide you with a clean, comfortable place to stay; but that we can, and will promptly respond to any requests you may have.

Summary: The stay at Courtyard was decent. It must be hard to keep a hotel that stays this busy clean. We had a family suite, which was very nice. It had two bunk beds, a pullout sofa and two queens. The room was perfect for a party group or a family.  The hotel is within a walk to Disneyland and even better, Roscoes chicken and waffles! There are other flood options within a short walk and this is worth moving away from the Disney crowds.   The beds are typical Marriot and comfy and good. The room has a fridge, microwave and coffee. You could make this a decent home and base.  Parking is not free. The pool area is nice with two spas. Fitness is normal for a courtyard and the staff are very friendly. I would  come back for the value and especially since we really just slept here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, and for choosing us as your home base during your visit to the Disneyland Parks.  I'm happy to know that our friendly staff and comfortable beds met your expectations...and that you found our nearby Roscoe's!  I hope to welcome you back on your next visit to the area.

Summary Heading: Decent Location to the Parks, but not for the business traveler
Summary: I stayed at this property over the weekend for a work event.  I couldnt get into the conference hotel.  The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly, but other than that it was very noisy.  I was on the 3rd floor out of 4 floors and I could hear kids running in the halls on my level and the 4th level.  you could also here the people walking in the room above mine.    On Sunday, which is the day I was checking out, housekeeping knocked on my door 8:30am.  I got out of bed and asked what she wanted and she didnt apologize for waking me or disturbing me, but rather asked if I wasnt checking out that day.    The Bistro in the lobby has a decent breakfast menu, I didnt have dinner there, but a colleague did and said it was good, just a bit pricey.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us.  I'm very sorry that you were disturbed so early Sunday morning and for our housekeeper not properly understanding the inconvenience caused. Please give us the opportunity to fully meet your expectations during your next visit to the area, and we will make sure to book you on the top floor - away from the children excited to visit the Disneyland Parks.

Summary Heading: Couldnt be happier for a convention
Summary: I visited this hotel in November of 2013 for a convention.  I arrived early at the hotel so my room was not yet ready.  They were professional in accepting my bags and identifying them with tags while I went out exploring the city.  When I returned, my room was ready, I had to present ID to get my bags, and I went up to my room.  My room was cool, comfortable, and overlooked the parking lot/Ruth's Chris steakhouse (which is rather nice looking with the fire).  Everything worked well, even including the WiFi which was respectable for hotel WiFi.  Hotel staff were very pleasant and welcoming and accommodating.  The food in the cafe was quite tasty.   It was a plus to have a refrigerator in the room for small snacks, sodas, etc.   The hotel is a rather short walk to the convention
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience!  Don't forget to book your Go-To hotel for your next convention....I'm going to hold you to it.

Summary: We have just spent 13 days staying here and would recommend this to everyone. From the front of house right through to the cleaners - who made the kids beds differently every day with their toys in different places - the service was amazing. Nothing was too hard for any of the staff! Thankyou to all of you for making our stay amazing!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about your experience while staying with us, Humphreys family!  I am happy that we were able to help make your visit to the Disneyland Resort area a bit more pleasant.  I hope to see you when you're up for your next trip!

Summary: After a couple of hiccups on check in when they couldn't find my booking (horror of all horrors), they let me have a room while I sorted things out with my travel agent, and then waived my calls to New Zealand from my account. The front desk agent I dealt with, Terrance, was absolutely wonderful during all of this and continued to be helpful and kind every time I saw him.  My only gripes were really the room location (right next to a side entry door and on the ground floor - you could hear people going in and out the door all night, and you couldn't open the curtains without people in the carpark being able to see in), and the cleaning service was a little under par (not emptying bins a couple of times, really only seeming to do the bare minimum).  The towels were fairly
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your experience.  I've shared your comments with Terrance, which elicited a big grin!  I apologize for our less than stellar housekeeping and the condition of the towels.  As you mentioned these areas are being immediately addressed.  I invite you to stay with us during your next visit to the Disneyland Resort area to experience the improvements....and a different room from 114!

Summary: Great hotel, very nice, very quiet, well located, wonderful staff, very helpful, great swimming pool and hot tub, nice restaurant (for breakfast anyway), laundry facilities.  Just a wonderful place to stay.  Also, you can buy discounted day pass to use the shuttle to Disney at the front desk.  I would go back there in a heart beat.   Great Wifi as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know that you were happy with our hotel and service!  We look forward to your next stay.

Summary: I have been impressed recently with the Courtyards that I've visited, so I chose this one for our first trip to Disneyland.  As expected, the hotel is wonderful.  Everything we needed in this comfortable, clean room.  Front desk staff are friendly and very helpful.  It was nice that they recognized us the second day and called us by name (Mr. & Mrs) right away.  We used the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) buses to go back and forth to DLR each day, but it is just a short walk down the street, same side of the road, to get to Disneyland if you'd rather walk.  We WILL stay here again when we come back.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments about your experience while staying with us - and for your enthusiastic recommendation.  I look forward to welcoming you back next time!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, nice clean room, long walk to Disneyland.
Summary: This is a nice, clean, quiet hotel, best water pressure I've experienced yet at a hotel. The staff were friendly, rooms were a decent size and the beds were supper comfy, parking was easy and well lit.  Our only issue (and the reason for 4 not 5 stars) was the walk to disneyland. We had never stayed at this hotel before and we asked the front desk (via telephone) before we made the reservations how far the walk was, we were told 15 min. It is not 15 min. It is more like half an hour and as we all know you after walking a good 15 miles around Disneyland all day the last thing you want to do is walk 30 min back to the hotel at midnight. The hotel does have a shuttle, $5 for adults and $2 or $3 for kids for the day however you have to walk to the other Marriott just up the road to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience.  I'm very sorry that we underestimated the walk to Disneyland Park and I'm glad that you were able to make more comfortable arrangements at the end of your long day.

Summary: I booked our hotel for out vacation through costco out of convenience- I have stayed with the courtyard brand many many times, but never have I been so impressed with the staff! On my daughter's birthday, we left for Disneyland with her dressed as a princess for the park. The staff made her feel exceptionally special on her big day, bowing and going out of the way to treat her as royalty for the day. There was even a surprise waiting for her in our room that night!!!! I have traveled a lot, stayed with many hotel chains- this is one of the few places I will go out of my way to stay with again.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us the opportunity to host your little princess on her birthday.  I'm glad that we were able to add a little more fun to her experience with our best wishes.

Summary: In there, staff service is awesome, Disneyland tickets are sold in here, also, this hotel is a good Disneyland Resort neighbor hotel (Disneyland and Disney California Adventure are very close). Several restaurants are around. High Speeds Internet Access is really high speed, and free, it doesn't ask you to enter personal information, just your room number and that's it, you can get Mail an make downloads quickly. Overall an excellent hotel.
Manager Response: Your comments about your experience just made my day!  Thank you for taking the time to let us know that we were successful in adding to your experience.

Summary: I had a wonderful stay during my trip to Disney Land. When we arrived the young man greeted us from the desk and was very friendly. The hotel was clean and inviting. The thing that wowed me this visit was something this young man from the front desk did. I called the front desk to see if someone would mind bringing up a couple glasses. A while passed and then I finally heard a knock on the door. I was surprised to see the young man from the front desk who ended up bringing me the glasses himself since there didn't appear to be anyone else available. Great stay!
Manager Response: I'm very glad to know that you had a good experience while staying with us... and thank you for the A++!  I look forward to welcoming you back during your next visit to the Disneyland Resort area.

Summary Heading: Very very once very very pleased !!!!!
Summary: We stayed here while attending Disneyland as a family. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again on our next disney trip :) very nice and comfortable room with great beds. Great customer service and great modern hotel. Great location to Disneyland, we were worried it could be too far from the park but it wasn't at all about a fifteen minute walk. It was great!!! Thank you :)
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know that we were able to add to the success of your family trip.  I look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is our second stay here and each time it's been perfect. We love the family suite, my son loves the bunk beds and his own TV. I have been able to get a great rate each time, and this stay rate came with breakfast. Yes you pay for parking but they let you leave the car after check out so you can use the ART shuttle which is much less expensive and much easier than parking at Disneyland. ART shuttle day pass is 5. for adults and 2. for kids. We will always try to book here when in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how you feel about your experiences!  I am happy to know that we are your hotel of choice and look forward to seeing you during your next visit.

Summary: As far as the hotel itself goes we have no complaints.  Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, pool was great.  However, it is quite a hike to Disneyland.  You can use the transportation system but that gets expensive fast.  In addition you are paying a parking fee daily.  We have stayed at many different places around Anaheim and again this one was very clean and nice but the location was hard, and it would have been nice if there had been a breakfast included for the price that we paid.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. I apologize that you had a less than satisfactory experience because of the hotel rate and its proximity to Disneyland. The hotel is 3/4 of a mile away from the park entrances and is approximately a 15 minute walk for most guests.  We do sell tickets for the ART transit system at the front desk.  This system runs every 20 minutes. All day passes are $5 an adult and $2 for children. Some guests also option for a taxi ride if they do not wish to walk and the fares are generally $8-10.  There is also a Disneyland parking lot across the street where it is $16 to park your vehicle.  Most of our guests do walk but these are other options that are available as well.  The price of our hotel does fluctuate depending on occupancy and if there is a city wide convention in town due to our proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center. Rates can be high for hotels in this particular area if the city of Anaheim is sold out due to the Disneyland Resort or the convention center. We do try and advise possible future guests to book as soon as possible to get the best deal in the resort area.  Again, thank you for the feedback as we take guest satisfaction seriously. We hope to be given the opportunity to see you again on a future visit.  Lisa Dickinson, Front Office Manager Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim Disneyland Resort

Summary: We were happily surprised. I don't know why the chain doesn't update their photos, but the family suite has been updated from what is on their web site. King bed and bathroom make up the first part of the suite and is like a normal hotel room (white linens and bedding) then a fogged glass sliding French door leads to new blonde wood bunks (white sheeting) and a pullout couch. There's also a chair and ottoman. Both rooms have flat panel tvs. The wallpaper in the kids room is a greyscale pic of toons town and the other wall is California screamin.  It is very modern and clean.  You can see the fireworks from the windows too. Always had enough towels, room was always cleaned.  I hate that parking is an extra fee. Just include it in your rate. I also think they should just include
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are glad you enjoyed our newly renovated Family Suite. We just uploaded our new photos of the rooms so that guests can see the new theme as well.  We are happy to hear that you found the room to be clean, comfortable and that you enjoyed the fun pictures and bunk beds.  The Courtyard signature does not have complimentary breakfast but we do have the Bistro in our lobby that is open for breakfast and guests are welcome to order off the menu on a variety of different breakfast items.  Thank you so much again for your comments.  We look forward to seeing you in the future!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: I ended up kind of stranded in Anaheim, and made a reservation online at CBM, and went over from where I was at before noon, and asked if I could check in early.  They were so nice and accommodating, and got me right in!  I needed a ride to the airport in the early morning and they had it all figured out within minutes and I didn't have to worry about anything!! The bed was amazingly comfortable, and the room was very clean and very nice!  I would stay here if I ever come back.  They are so close to Disneyland that you can easily walk from there.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful comment regarding your experience at our hotel.  I am happy to hear we were able to accomodate you with an early checkin and that you found your room to be comfortable and clean.  The staff will be so happy to hear that they made such a great impact on your stay as well.  We really try to make our guests feel welcomed and appreciated while they stay with us and we are delighted to hear such great feedback.  We look forward to seeing you in the future too!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: The hotel and rooms were very nice. The staff was very polite. The only thing we did not like is that the resturaunt in the hotel did not open until 7am, which was not helpful to us because we were there for a volleyball tournament and had to be at the tournament by 7am. Also you do have to pay for parking, which is not included in the room price, so if you stay be ready to pay for parking.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  I apologize that our Bistro hours are from 6:30am to 10:30am on the weekdays and from 7am to 11am on the weekends and that it made it difficult for you to have your breakfast during the tournament schedule. We try our best to accomodate as many of our guests as possible with the hours we can provide for breakfast. We will always take these possible changes in restaurant times into consideration so we thank you for the suggestion.  Parking is always an additional fee in the Anaheim Resort due to the demand for space and the proximity to Disneyland and the Convention Center. We do not like to include it in our rates because not all of our guests end up taking vehicles.  We really appreciate your compliments of the staff and we are happy to see that you enjoyed the hotel and our newly renovated rooms.  Again, thank you for these wonderful comments.  We hope to see you in the future!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: Stayed here to go to Disneyland it was a short walk, 15 minutes to Disneyland, staff were excellent in giving advice about the area and how to plan our visit. Definitely ask for a top floor. We had noisy people above us and were offered another room to move to, would've rather had the people above quiet down! Pool was great too, had a babies pool and another pool for swimmers. Could not fault any of the staff, everyone very welcoming and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this compliment of our staff.  We take great pride in the friendliness and helpfullness of our staff and we are delighted that this made such a positive impact on your stay. We apologize that you had issues with the noise of the family above you and I am glad to know we were able to relocate you in a quieter section of the hotel.  We do have a noise curfew and we do ask for families to be respectful of the guests around them but we understand that it can be difficult for those traveling with young children excited to go to Disneyland.  Again, thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  We look forward to the possibility of seeing you in the future when your travels take you this way again.  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Location is perfect, good value for what you get.
Summary: 20 minute walk to Disney, 5 minute cab ride to Baseball, can't beat the location and price was very reasonable for such convenience.  I think it's in your advantage to pick a hotel chain and be loyal if possible.  We like Courtyard Marriott and it has been consistent for us.  My one suggestion is to put out a pot of coffee for guests that can't wait until the restaurant opens at 7:00.  Most Courtyards we have stayed at do have coffee available.  I know they offer in room coffee, but I have yet to have a decent cup of in room coffee.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  We are delighted to hear that the location was perfect for your trip to Anaheim.  The only complimentary coffee we offer is the in room coffee and coffee maker.  We do serve Starbucks specialty drinks and coffee in our Bistro and the front desk is always available to assist guests with making and ringing up coffee orders before the restaurant opens because we do understand the necessity of having access to coffee early in the morning for some of our guests.  I apologize that you were not made aware of that option.  Again, we are so pleased to hear your positive remarks of our hotel and signature style and we look forward to seeing you return in the future!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Able to Connect on a Walking Path to the Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I stayed here due to an event at the Anaheim Convention Center.  I saw another Trip Advisor review that mentioned there was a walkway available, so I reserved it after the Hilton and Marriott were full and the walkway was great.  I would give this 5* except the staff would not give a AAA discount due to the convention being full.  Of course, there would be a high demand for rooms with the Convention there.  I couldn't use my Marriott discount either. I was able to get a room at the Hilton after the event at a much lower rate for the last night and moved there.  Not sure how to rate as it was $10 less for parking than the Marriott so saved $30 over the 3 nights I stayed.  They still lost my last day which was much lower at the Hilton.  I did enjoy the Fridge/Microwave in the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are a popular destination for convention center attendees who are looking for a quieter option that is also within a quick 5 minute walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center.  Sometimes during convention center dates that provide contractual rates, the hotel is unable to honor discounted rates.  This can also occur during peak summer season.  I am sorry to hear that a discount was not available at the dates you were coming in for, however I am happy you were able to stay with us and enjoyed your room and the friendliness of our staff.  Although we do wish you the best of luck in booking rooms at any of the convention hotels adjacent to the convention center for your convenience, we would always like to be given the opportunity to provide you with exceptional service in the future and we do hope to see you again!  ~Lisa Dickinson~ Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay at when going to Disneyland
Summary: Took a mini roadtrip/vacation to LA to spend a few days in Anaheim, just to go to Disneyland as well as drive around Norwalk/Artesia. We got a pretty good rate for 2 nights and decided to take it. Despite arriving late, the check in counter was fast and quick. Staff is very friendly to everyone's needs. When going to Disneyland, we got some maps for directions to Disneyland as well as the bus routes to take on the ART shuttle. Front desk was very helpful in giving us this information. Room service and maids were super nice and polite throughout our stay. Room was clean all day and night. Beds were comfy, just like every Marriott bed I've slept in. First time staying at Courtyard, the hotel matched the TV commercials with the comfortable ambiance. We only ate breakfast here,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review of our hotel.  We are delighted to hear that you had a great experience during your stay. I know our front desk works hard at making sure that every guest feels comfortable and appreciated and I am glad to see that they were able to provide you with such a positive experience.  The Bistro in our lobby is very popular with guests for breakfast in the morning and it is also open from 5-10pm for dinner (Happy Hour 5-7pm). We are happy that you enjoyed your breakfast and were able to experience the media pods which allow our guests to control their viewing options while relaxing in our restaurant. When your travels take you back this way, we do hope to see you and your family again in the future!  ~Lisa Dickinson~ Front Office Manager

Summary: I was charged with the task to price a few options for a work retreat this summer. I thought Anaheim would be a good location so that we could follow our business meetings with dinner/drinks in Downtown Disney without being so far away for people to drive home (most of our office lives in the Whittier area). We ended up opting for something a little closer, but I can't rave enough about how great the sales department was in working with us! They responded quickly (well before any other hotels that we priced) and were very helpful and patient. I have stayed at this Courtyard as a guest in the past, but this was my first experience working with their sales department. I really wish we could have given them our business and they will be first on my list the next time I have an
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the feedback regarding your interaction with our sales team. I did pass this review onto them and they were very happy to hear that you had a great experience with them. We are always very appreciative whenever a business looks at our hotel as a possibility for an event or group booking and although we missed you this time around, we really do hope to see you in the future too!  ~Lisa Dickinson~ Front Office Manager

Summary: My family and I stayed here on Independence Day weekend. The lobby is cute and colorful. In spite of high floor earlier request, we were given the 2nd floor. I requested the high floor hoping that we can view the Disneyland fireworks. But that didn't really matter because this hotel is only up to 4th floor and is tucked in behind some buildings, one right in the front and on the left side is the other Marriott high rise hotel. From our 2nd floor room, all we see are windows from the front building with clothes line hanging on it…lol However, we don't care about the view because inside our family suite is awesome. One room has 2 queen size beds separated by a sliding french door to the other room where the bunk bed is. There is also a cute couch that can turn into a bed. The room
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. We are so happy to hear that you were able to enjoy one of our newly renovated Family Suites.  This is a very popular room type that we have for families who may want more room space and the bunk bed is always a fun feature for children. We also have Kid Suites with 1 King bed in the main room and with the bunk bed and sofa bed in the kid's section. These are our only suite types at this property and they are always in demand because of their fun nature and appeal for larger families.  We are very excited you were able to experience these new rooms and we are very appreciative of your feedback.  We really hope to see you again in the future!  ~Lisa Dickinson~ Front Office Manager

Summary: We stayed here during our Disneyland stay. Our stay was very nice. The room was comfortable and clean. We never had enough towels--we had to keep asking. I think towels were in high demand. And the elevator was so slow. The hotel is in a nice location--several eateries nearby. We caught the ART to Disneyland, but it was only a 20 minute walk in the heat. We got the 3-day passes and a daily pass--no 4-day passes. Parking is quite safe. Any service requests were quickly responded to. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We are glad to hear that our newly renovated rooms were comfortable and clean. We are only 3/4 of a mile away from the park entrance so a lot of our guests do enjoy either walking or using the ART transit that runs every 20 minutes for a daily fee.  The ART transit system does not have 4 day passes but they do carry other multiple day passes that can save you money when the dates are consecutive.  Our front desk is always more than happy to talk to our guests about this system.   We apologize that our elevators were slow during your stay. The elevator system we use ensures optimum safety with as little noise as possible and because of this the elevators can appear to run slow.  Our hotel however is only four stories high, which we are very thankful for. I am glad that the requests you asked for were sent up immediately.  There is a Marriott standard to the amount of towels placed in each room which we have to follow, however guests can always ask for additional towels for the duration of their stay when making their reservation or talking to the front desk.  Thank you again so much for these wonderful comments and suggestions. We really appreciate this form of feedback that gives us a lot to work with.  We hope to be given the opportunity to welcome you back on a future visit as well.  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: Our family recently stayed for 2 nights in a room with 2 queen beds. The room was clean and furnishings were modern. This hotel is set back from the street which is nice because we didn't experience much noise. However, the angle of the hotel meant that in the late afternoon into the early evening the sun was no longer over the outdoor pool so it was shaded....and not so warm although the pool area is nice. We used the bistro a couple times and found that service to be fine and we were able to bring food and drinks out to the pool area which we liked. If you are planning on walking to the parks do know that this property is a good 20 - 25 minute walk and I am speaking as a family who are active people and used to walking a lot. Otherwise you probably do want to check out the
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review of our property.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and were able to partake in some of our amenities like our Bistro and pool.  Thank you for the comments in relation to the housekeeping staff and pool.  We love hearing these types of suggestions because they give us the chance to improve.  I will definitely pass these ideas on to the staff. Again, we love seeing reviews like this that recommend our property and at the same time, give us so much information to work with from the guests' perspective.  It is more than appreciated. Thank you for these comments and we really do hope to see you in the future!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Great room for family of 4 with some small complaints
Summary: We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort for three days, two nights while we visited Disneyland recently. We had the kids suite with king bed and separate room with bunk bed and sofa bed for our two boys. I loved the room! It was clean, nicely decorated with plenty of space. We were able to get a reasonable rate during the week.   We took Uber to get back and forth from Disneyland instead of the ART shuttle. The cost of the trip was $5 one way ($10 round trip) and we were picked up and dropped off directly in front of the Courtyard. I'm unsure if this is the regular rate or a promotional rate. You should request an estimate through the app to get the cost at the time of your stay.    If we had taken the ART shuttle, we would have been picked up and
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are glad you had a pleasant stay with us and were able to enjoy our newly renovated Kid Suite room. I apologize that it took 30 minutes after our 3pm check-in to accommodate you and your family.  I am however happy to hear that the front desk was able to give you a later checkout time to make up for it. The hotel does include a restaurant and bar service.  The Bistro is open from 5-10pm for dinner and drinks and we have happy hour from 5-7pm.  Our bar does face the pool patio area so I apologize that you were not given that information upon check-in and therefore were unable to use those amenities during your stay.  I will make sure my agents remember to remind guests of our hotel amenities upon check-in so that they will always feel well informed upon their arrival.  Again, thank you so much for these comments. We really appreciate the feedback and look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.  Lisa Dickinson, Front Office Manager

Summary: We stayed as a family of 4 for 3 nights in one room with 2 queens which was quite big and spacious. the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was good, it was next to a Marriott which provided shuttles to Disneyland for a small fee which we used. The only problem we had was the fact that their was no bellboy so we had to take our bags to our room from our car and back by ourselves, also their were a very limited amount of trolleys available. Overall our stay was good.
Manager Response: Thank you for recommendation of our hotel.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed our spacious and newly renovated rooms. I will let the staff know of your compliments towards them.  They will greatly appreciate this.  As a Marriott Courtyard, we do not have a bell desk. Our front desk does store guest luggage and they do assist with concierge duties like booking tours and calling taxis.  The hotel just recently received some more luggage carts for our guests to use which we are very excited about. Thank you again for the feedback in regards to this.  We love to be given the opportunity to improve so we can give an even better experience on guests future visits as well.  We do hope to see you again soon!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: I don't know if it's the Disneyland effect or what, but my God the staff appears happy and super helpful!   We arrived at midnight after a long journey with two very hungry children, tired and weary, however we were greeting by a smiling lady (don't remember her name) at the reception who was glowing at that hour. She told us where to get food at that time etc. (fortunately across the street is Denny's).   The next couple of days we interacted with the effervescent young lady Tiffany who was always ready to answer any questions, she gave some valuable tips for Disney.   Thank God I chose this hotel, my experience is further proof that people make all the difference, who cares about the building!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful feedback of our hotel and front desk staff.  I showed this review to my front desk and they were delighted to see that they made such a positive impact on your stay with us.  We really strive to uphold Marriott standards with the friendliness and helpfulness of our staff and we truly enjoy making our guests feel welcomed and looked after during their stay. Thank you again for the compliments directed towards those agents.  They are greatly appreciated by the hotel and the individuals as well.  We look forward to the chance of seeing you again in the future!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: Room coffee maker was broken.  They promptly replaced it with another used model that spilled the lid whenever I poured.  The rooms were much smaller than the Homewood Suites just around the corner.  It took several calls to the front desk to resolve late night noise issues.  The place was very clean but I have found better value elsewhere.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. I apologize that you had issues with the size of your room during your stay with us. Our two queen rooms and our king rooms are meant to hold to Marriott's high standard of capacity and comfort. We try our best to be competitive with the rooms and pricing in the Anaheim Resort Area and I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations.  We do have suites however with more bedding and additional square footage for parties that may be too large for a standard size room. I also apologize that the coffee maker was not working properly upon your arrival and that the replacement was not working efficiently either. Housekeeping has to do a check on all amenities ordered and sent to guest rooms and I apologize that these items were overlooked. Thank you again for your comments regarding your stay.  We hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a better experience on a future stay in the Anaheim Resort.  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice and  clean. Top floor best
Summary: We had a top floor facing the pool and I can see why everyone would suggest requesting the same thing! Room was very clean and quiet. Could hear fire works from Disney at night but that's it. Would stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful feedback and recommendation of our hotel. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We are a four story hotel with courtyard pool views that can be requested when the reservation is made and we do our best to accommodate these requests.  We are very happy that you enjoyed the view!  The fireworks are hard to see from the property because Disneyland does a great job of "keeping the magic in" but you can see a bit of the show up in the sky from the back of our property. Thanks you again for these great comments and we look forward to seeing you in the future!  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: We have a hard time finding rooms to accommodate our family of 5. On this trip we had an extra friend too. This hotel was perfect for us with their family suite that sleeps 8. There were 2 queen beds, bunk beds and a pull out queen size sleeper sofa. Sharing one bathroom was a challenge when everyone was rushing to get ready in the morning. It is walking distance to Disneyland, but it is a solid 15-20 minute hike. After walking all day in the park until midnight the family was not too thrilled about a midnight hike. I would stay again and got a great rate. It is a nice hotel and I would recommend it for larger families. If you are a party of 4 or less I would stay across the street from Disneyland at the Fairfield inn.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback and recommendation of our Family Suite.  We love these rooms and how they are able to accommodate larger families.  Having the extra room with the bunk beds, sofa sleeper and a TV for the children to enjoy is always a positive aspect of these rooms when parents need their own space as well.  The walk from the hotel to the main gate entrance can be long for families with smaller children so we enjoy having the option of the ART shuttle system that runs every 20 minutes.  The day passes are for purchase at the front desk.  Again, thank you for this great review of our suites and hotel.  We look forward to your future visit.  Lisa Dickinson, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Good for families - 20 minute walk to Disney
Summary: We stayed here a couple of weeks ago for four nights and we were totally pleased with our stay. This was a Disneyland trip for us:) The hotel is a 20 minute very brisk walk to the main gate of the park. You can also pay $5 per adult/$2 per child to ride the ART shuttle which, as other reviewers have mentioned picks you up at the Marriott next door. For the beginning of our trip we decided that the walk was no big deal but later on in the week we decided that the shuttle was sounding pretty good but we instead noticed that there is a Disneyland parking lot basically right across the street on Harbor Blvd so we just moseyed on over there and hopped on that shuttle for free:) Not sure if that is exactly allowed but no one checked and I highly doubt that Disney has much of a problem
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this wonderful feedback for the hotel.  We are happy to hear that your stay was enjoyable and the rooms were comfortable for your family.  We are 3/4 mile walking distance to the park gates so we understand that the walk can be long for families with small children (especially if you are walking all over the Disneyland parks!). Like you mentioned, we do sell the day passes for the ART transit system at our front desk that picks up next door to us at the Anaheim Marriott.  This is always a great option for guests who may want to return to the hotel for a moment's rest during their visit at the Disneyland Resort.  We do not inform guests to use the parking shuttle across the street because that shuttle is meant for Disneyland guests who have paid for parking in the Toy Story parking lot.  I am glad to hear you were able to get on the parking shuttle without charge but there is always a chance that the Disneyland parking enforcement may ask you to turn around so we never suggest it.  Another thank you for your feedback in regards to the Bistro and housekeeping. I know that our Bistro is closed during lunch due to the fact that a lot of our Business travelers and Disneyland guests are out during the day.  We do offer Starbucks however during the time that it is closed and guests are welcome to order at the front desk so we can make them their drinks outside the Bistro's hours of operation.  Our housekeepers understand the need for guest privacy and clean the rooms to the best of their ability with as little inconvenience to our guests as possible. I am sorry to hear that some items were moved and I apologize if that caused worry for you. Housekeeping takes great care when having to touch any item left out that they are afraid may get lost when vacuuming or cleaning. I will pass this on to the housekeeping manager.  Again, we really appreciate all the wonderful comments and information you shared with us on this review of your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.  Lisa Dickinson Front Office Manager

Summary: Stayed here while traveling on business. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Starbucks staff on site were also great. The hotel is undergoing an upgrade but you wouldn't even know it, the constriction crew isn't at all noisy. The rooms are modern and the bed was comfortable. Very close to Disney, walking distance to main gate. Many restaurants in walking distance. About 15 miles from the beach. If I ever make my way back to Anaheim I would surely stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are very fortunate to have so many great reviews here on TripAdvisor and I greatly appreciate you adding your experience.  We take great pride in the friendliness and helpfulness of our staff and we are delighted to hear that they made a positive impact on your stay.  As a hotel that welcomes business travelers and families for Disneyland, we try to make each of our guests experience an enjoyable one by matching their interests and needs while they are staying with us in the Anaheim Resort.  The refreshment of our rooms is over and we are excited to welcome our guests into these brand new rooms. Thank you again for the wonderful feedback! We hope to see you again in the future.   Lisa Dickinson, Front Office Manager

Summary: Ended up staying here last minute because everything else in the surrounding area was booked.  I guess supply and demand held true, because it was very expensive, and not that much to get excited about.  The room was spacious, but the bathroom wasn't that clean, and the AC settings were either hatching baby chicks or arctic circle, with nothing in between.  Very noisy hotel, even though we were on the top floor
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback on your stay at our hotel.  I am sorry that you and your family were inconvenienced by the noise level of the surrounding guests and the lack of cleanliness in the bathroom.  I have spoken to our housekeeping staff to ensure that we always cleans the bathrooms to the high standards of the Marriott brand. As for the noise issues, we apologize again.  We do take sound curfews seriously since our hotel hosts Disneyland Resort families and business travelers alike.   The price of our hotel does fluctuate depending on occupancy and if there is a city wide convention in town due to our proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center. Rates can be high for hotels in this particular area if the city of Anaheim is sold out due to the Disneyland Resort or the convention center. We do try and advise possible future guests to book as soon as possible to get the best deal in the resort area.  Again, thank you for the feedback as we take guest satisfaction seriously. We hope to see you and your family again soon.  Lisa Dickinson, Front Office Manager Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim Disneyland Resort

Summary: Stayed 5 nights at the Courtyard in April with my wife and youngest daughter. The hotel is conveniently located near the Convention Center which is why we chose this hotel as my wife was attending a conference at that location. Overall hotel was very nice with large rooms with mini fridge and coffee maker, nice pool. Reasonably priced breakfast available on site. Friendly staff. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Hotel is a 20 minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland, found this a little long at the end of a long day at Disney but then again, we were at Disney on vacation, so what's a 20 minute walk. Overall very good hotel for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, clean & comfy rooms, and awesome location & staff
Summary: We stayed at the Courtyard Disneyland in March 2014. We picked this hotel due to its proximity to the Disney resorts, the shuttles to Disney, and the price. We were not disappointed.  Our king room was on the 3rd floor in the corner. This hotel has some of the biggest rooms we have ever had at a Courtyard which was awesome. The hotel looks almost brand new; everything from the bed, the carpet, the lobby finish-out, the bathrooms, the fixtures, it's all new and shiny which is wonderful. The bathroom was large and had plenty of space for us to get ready at the same time.  On-site parking is $10 or $15 per day, but that's worth the cost. There were plenty of spaces available, and you only have to pay one fee per 24 hours (we checked in on a Sunday afternoon and left the car there
Manager Response: none

Summary: We traveled to Anaheim for the VEX Robotics World Championship.  We needed to ship the robot to the hotel before our arrival.  Everyone at the hotel was so accommodating and helpful, from the arrival, to the storage and the holding for the return home of my son's and his team's hard work.  The hotel was very clean and conveniently located to all Anaheim attractions.  We would absolutely stay here if visiting again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived on a Monday at 11:30pm.  I had called earlier in the day to see if we could be upgraded as rewards members and they were completely sold out.  Bummer!  Once we arrived we were excited to just get our room.  Surprise!  We were upgraded to a two room suite with 2 queen beds and bunk beds!  Our room overlooked the hotel they are working on next door.  No biggie.  There was one day that they were painting or something but it wasn't that loud.    The pool was nice although we wish it were heated(or warmer if it is heated).    The lady that worked the bar when we were there(March 17-21) was amazing.  She was so attentive and flexible.  Never hesitating to bring us our drinks or food outside so we could relax.  She was always telling us to relax, that it was our vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in February for Disneyland.  We stayed in the Family Suite with King bed, pull out sofa, and twin bunk beds.  Somewhat comfortably fit 5 of us.  Put the pull out sofa bed mattress on the floor after the first night as the frame was squeaky.  There is a sliding door that closes between the King bed area and the sitting area.  The hotel is a little over a mile to the main gate at Disneyland.  Housekeeping did a great job.  The tub stopper was inoperable, but maintenance fixed the next morning for our return later that night.  The FD staff was very friendly.  We had 6 devices needing connection to the WIFI and at first only allowed 3, but the FD changed that and gave us the code to connect extra devices.  The swimming pool and hot tub area were great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed 2 nights (March 10 - 12) and were very pleased with our last-minute change of plans.  We were booked at the actual Marriott (around the block), but was able to get a much better price at the Courtyard (parking price cheaper too), so changed the reservation.  Had some apprehension in doing this b/c many of the Courtyard's recent reviews were not very favorable, and I did not understand why.  We've stayed at other Courtyard Marriotts in the past several years and have never had problems with any of them.  I do recall that one reviewer claimed that they were told over the phone that breakfast was included.  They must have misunderstood b/c Courtyard Marriott never include breakfast.  You can purchase food at their cafe, though.  Regular Marriotts and JW
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place near the Convention Center
Summary: I was in town for the Los Angles Religious Education Congress, a huge annual gathering at the Anaheim Convention Center.  The Courtyard was smaller than the other local hotels (and there are more than a hundred of them in Anaheim!).  The room was comfortable, with nice amenities-- coffee service, fridge, Paul Mitchell toiletries.  The bed was very comfortable.  The layout is a bit odd, with the reception area in the center, and elevators at the extreme ends of the building. Not a big deal, just seemed like a strange architectural choice.  The Bistro in the lobby is handy, with Starbucks coffee and a limited but adequate menu for breakfast and dinner.  When you're really tired after a full day of convention-going, a nice big salad and a cold beer at your hotel can feel like real
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here twice now while visiting Disneyland. Once back in November 2012 and most recently February 2014. I let them know that we were celebrating a birthday on this past trip, and the entire staff was very accommodating, friendly, and helpful! Stephanie, one of the managers, made sure that we were taken care of. On top of that, the bedrooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfortable. Will be sure to stay here again when we go back to Disney in May for my birthday!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The atmosphere was pleasant and the service was very good. Parking was included with room fees and the bed was to die for. Top quality bed and pillows. The rooms were clean, elegant and cozy. Loved it. I recommend it to everyone. Price was a deal
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Courtyard by Marriott - Would stay again
Summary: A great place to stay in walking distance of Disneyland and lots of places to eat out at.  Friendly  front desk staff and a great place in lobby to get Starbucks coffee and whatever else you need.  Lovely clean and spacious rooms with queen size beds and a good sized bathroom.  Great pool and spa also which are kept nice and clean as well - we loved our week and would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value for proximity to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here on the second leg of our California vacation after my cousin's wedding.  The room was quiet but could use some updating as carpet was worn and throw pillows had seen their better days.  I did love the French doors separating the master bedroom from the living space where our daughter slept on the pullout sofa.  The pool water was very warm which is great because my husband is especially difficult to please where that is concerned.  The only disappointment I would have to say was the miscommunication at booking and then check-in.  At the time of booking, we were told breakfast was included with our stay.  However, upon check-in we found out that if we wanted breakfast at the hotel we would need to pay on a daily basis.  They did give us breakfast vouchers for one day
Manager Response: none

Summary: Checked in after a tiring day at Disneyland.  I made reservations with a reservation agent over the phone.  I thought we were getting a 1 bedroom suite, but when checking in was informed it was a studio.  When I informed Diane (Dianna?) of this at the front desk, she quickly upgraded us to a family suite with bunk beds that the kids were more excited about than Disneyland.  Clean and comfy rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Anaheim Courtyard at Disneyland and it was great! The front desk staff was friendly and made the check-in / check-out process quick. Our room was pretty spacious and very clean. The bathrooms have been nicely updated and have granite countertops. We were a 5 minute drive from Disneyland parking and close to lots of Anaheim restaurants. The Anaheim Gardenwalk Shops are a few minutes, they have a delicious California Pizza Kitchen.(I am not usually a fan of chains - but this location was particularly good) My only criticisms of this Courtyard would be the foam beds - I like the fluffy beds and bedding that they use in their other hotels better. (A personal preference) Also, I think the parking fee should be built into the room rate.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Noisy family focused hotel.  The people in the room next to mine made noise from early morning to late night.  There were only a few hours of the day when it was quiet. That left me little time for sleep. Doors slamming, people partying, and kids running through the halls made for a nightmare stay.  Would not recommend if you need peace and quiet.
Manager Response: Hello Daniel H,  We are very sad to hear that you did not fully enjoy your stay at the Anaheim Courtyard by Marriott.  Our first priority is guest satisfaction and we do our very best to ensure that every guest's expectations are exceeded on every level.  We do have a variety of guests that visit the hotel and we would be more than happy to accomodate quiet room requests as best we can.  You are a valuable guest to us and we hope that you may try us again when you are in the Anaheim area.

Summary: The service was fantastic from start to finish--helpful and friendly staff!!! Our room was a good size suite with plenty of room for our family of five to spread out, and have space to relax. The wi-fi worked great with no problems. The parking fee of $14 was in my opinion a tad pricey for just parking in a standard parking lot. We had a great time, and hope to return again soon!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this Courtyard for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon race weekend.  The hotel was a short distance from the parks and the starting line (little less than a mile).  We walked to and from everyday.  The hotel itself was pretty on par with what you will get from Courtyards.  The staff was very nice and helpful when needed.  I did appreciate the granola bars, bottled water, and coffee they put out for the runners that were heading to the start line at 4 am.  The drain in the bathtub was set right, but it wasn't an inconvienence.  Only tip that I would give is the hotel is a bit hard to find as it is kind of hidden behind the Ruth's Chris Steakhouse.  There was construction on the hotel next to it as well, so we didn't see the turn in until we passed it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff of this property couldn't have been nicer or more accomodating. While I agree the elevator was the  "low" point of this facility, the Bistro was certainly a "high" point.  The food was very good with many good and healthy choices. If we had a request, it was taken care of quickly and with a smile.  Staff recommendations for "non chain" restaurants were great.  There were MANY restaurants within walking distance. A BIG plus for this property is the proximity to Disneyland...a very easy walk.  Yet it was far enough away that the crowds weren't a problem. If we are in the area again, we would certainly stay here.  Although we would recommend flying into Orange County (John Wayne) Airport rather than LAX!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really liked this hotel.  Quick check in, staff were friendly, not too big a hotel.  A bit of a walk to Disneyland but you can get a public (ART) bus.  Lots of hotels closer.  A bit crowded just before Christmas.  Thought the price was reasonable.  Breakfast in restaurant was good and free coffee in foyer before 9.   Rooms clean and adequate.  Our only gripe was a loud family next door but that can happen anywhere.  I would gave given this hotel 5 stars, but after we left my daughter discovered she had left her top there, and when we rang (which took us ages to find their number as it is all a central number and cost us heaps as we have an international phone, and couldn't find an email address) the person who answered informed us he  "wasn't lost property", put us through to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good hotel with great location.  Elevators slow, restaurant menu options limited,  but biggest complaint was the air conditioning system.  Either very warm or cold.  Blows air directly at bed and you can't change the direction (therefore I rated "sleep quality" as poor...bedding is fine).  Also, was left only one washcloth each day.  While I was traveling by myself I still think they should leave more than one.  Also, pretty limited TV channels (no Fox News, no CNN)  Hotel was clean but no better than I expected.  Easy walking to Disney or the Anaheim Convention Center.  Will probably stay here again but with just a little attention to details this could be a great Courtyard, not just acceptable
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just came back from 3 nights at this hotel (Jan. 1-4). The hotel itself is perfectly fine. Clean rooms, friendly staff, good location. We walked to Disney most days (about 2 mi) but it was also close to a shuttle stop. And lots if places to eat are nearby.  My only complaint is that there is a new hotel going up right next door -and the noise was constant. The worst was on Saturday when I was on my own after my family left and instead of sleeping in, I was woken at 7am by the construction. 7 am on a Saturday?! That was not fun.  So if you plan on sleeping in at all (which I realize most at Disney don't) or having kiddos try to nap during the day, you will want to stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel while visiting Disneyland. The location is great ! The shuttle picks you up right behind the hotel at the Marriott. Be early for departure because people from several hotels are all waiting for the same shuttle. You can walk to Disney from this hotel but it's about a mile or so. At the front desk there is a place to buy drinks and snacks 24 hours a day which is really convenient and you don't have to worry about finding cash for vending machines. The restaurant is really convenient and was a lifesaver for us. We didn't have to worry about driving and waiting in line at nearby restaurants. The selection is limited to a few items but worked out just fine. Be mindful that this is near Disney so it's not the quietest hotel stay you will ever
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is great, the lobby is nice, but the feel of the rooms is a bit old.  Just a bit dirty.  We cleaned dried material from the couch and picked a few Cheerios off the floor after we arrived.  I felt allergic the whole stay.  For the $200 a night we paid for a suite, we could have done better elsewhere.  At a discounted rate, it might seem more reasonable.  Courtyards can be nice, but this isn't one of the best.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed there recently on a business trip.  The rate was decent considering it was around the holidays.  They didn't mention that parking is difficult and you are charged $14 per night to park.  It is about a 15 minute walk to the entrance to Disney.  The area is safe and I was comfortable walking that far on Harbour Street.  Note that their restaurant closes at 10 but there are other options in the area that are also walking distance.  The hotel was clean and in pretty good repair.  They do offer complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning.  I have stayed at several other Courtyards that didn't and have been told by their employees that Courtyard's don't offer that service.  By experience I know better.   There is another hotel being built right next door so there is some
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent business trip, Chris K.  We appreciate you taking the time out of your busy schedule to complete the review.  Your recommendation to other business and leisure travelers means the world to us!  We value your business and look forward to earning your guest loyalty.  Kindly, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice property, good location, and ez walk to Disney!
Summary: This property is so close to Disneyland even my friend Colby can make the walk! Seriously, this is a great location. It's probably just under a mile and you are inside Disneyland or California Adventure. You are going to walk a few miles anyway so a little more won't hurt.  They also have a shuttle but it's every 15-20 minutes and you can walk there by the time the shuttle arrives. The shuttle costs a few bucks and it's a fine option. The property is set back off the main street, behind Ruth's Chris, which keeps the property quiet. It's funny Mortons is on the next block so if you like nice steak restaurants this place rocks it! Beyond that they have a little cafe in the lobby which is great for a quick breakfast or other meal/snack. The rooms are nice and clean. We had a family
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review, DodgerJohn!  It's wonderful to receive your compliments on all that you and your family enjoyed at our Anaheim hotel.  We're glad our Kids Suite worked out nicely for you.  It truly is the ideal choice for any family seeking spacious accommodations with separate areas for both the parents and the kids.  Yes, we literally steps aways from one of the best steak restaurants in town, but our prime location also allows our guests many other dining options within walking distance.  Again, thank you for sharing your experience by completing the TripAdvisor review.  Come back and see us soon!  Best, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary: When checking in i wasnt even greeted. Stood there for a few mins feeling ignored while lady was answering phone calls and the other clerk saw us and pretended to be cleaning the lobby area. That set the tone for an unpleasent stay. But, Christian i believe s his name in either housekeeping or engineering went all out to make our stay much better. Gentleman needs a promotion if that is the way he cares about his guests. Was pleased by the cleanlyness. Will Definitely go back due to the employees that went all out for us. I hope their work dosnt go unoticed as for the front desk....they lack friendliness.
Manager Response: Thank you for your valued feedback, DFinl.  We apologize for the level of service you received upon your arrival, and are quite disappointed, as this is definitely not typical of what our guests experience with us.  Be assured that these details, as well as your compliments on the excellent service you did receive from certain staff members, have not gone unnoticed.  We are very proud of the high level of friendly service and attentiveness we are known for by our loyal guests and regret that we missed our mark on this occasion.  Please know that we do sincerely care and hope to have another chance to show you just how much we value your business.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention by completing the review.  Kind Regards, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Well maintained, nice features - no shuttle to Disney
Summary: I liked this hotel. It was comfortable and the fittings and fixtures were in excellent condition. Being close to Disney you expect some well worn items, but nothing was broken or scuffed. The bed was comfortable although the pillows were not. There were plenty of clean glasses that were replaced when we used them. The bathroom was a good size. The bedside tables are tiny - take everything off (including the phone) and put it all in a drawer - then you can fit your ipad on one. The bedside light fixtures have a power socket in each, so charging your phones is easy, leaving the desk outlets for cameras, etc. That was a nice touch. The pool is large with a decent sized hot tub.  A few items to note -  Our room was small. With a king bed, couch and coffee table there was enough room
Manager Response: Dear Scott N,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim.  It's wonderful to hear how comfortable you were in our accommodations, and that you enjoyed our amenities and special touches that set us apart from all the rest.  Please know that the Anaheim Resort Transit shuttle is available for a nominal daily fee and has a pick up/drop off location just steps away from our property.  Yes, guests are also welcome to walk to any of the nearby Disney lots to access their shuttles as well.  Disney encourages all guests to take full advantage of their shuttles to get them to where they want to be while visiting any of their parks.  Thank you for your continued loyalty to Marriott properties.  We do hope you will decide to return!  Best Regards, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice, comfortable place to stay...with great restaurants nearby
Summary: The service was fantastic, the hotel was immaculate, had all the features you'd expect.  I asked my travel agent to book a hotel for under NZ$150, and this one fitted the bill perfectly. The bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get out of it, I'm blaming the jet lag ;)   It was just a short walk and a shuttle ride from Disneyland, which is what I had asked for.  I had to walk through a carpark to the Hilton on the other side for the shuttle, but I didn't mind that.  As a solo woman, I didn't feel unsafe at all, even at 8:30pm, because there were others walking from the shuttle to the hotel too.  I'd feel more unsafe walking down the road in New Zealand at night.  I wouldn't recommend the restaurant, though.  I'm not even sure they had a kitchen, I think it was just a
Manager Response: We are delighted to learn of your nice and comfortable stay with us, Jody W.  Your thorough and well detailed review is greatly appreciated, as we value your opinions and insight.  We have recently completed renovations on our lobby which features a whole new experience  with includes The Bistro.  Be assured The Bistro has a kitchen which serves everything from fast and fresh favorites, to hot and hearty meals.  As you mentioned, our amazing location also allows are guests to choose from a vast variety of restaurants within walking distance.  Again, thank you for sharing all that you experienced and enjoyed at our Anaheim hotel.  Best, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Your Standard Courtyard with a Twist
Summary: We stayed here on our trip to Disneyland.  We stayed in a family suite which was very unique with a separate room for the kids with bunkbeds and a pull out couch.  Considering the wear and tear that place must get it was in pretty reasonable condition.  The cost was reasonable so I would say this property is a pretty good value.  The room was clean and seemed well maintained.  I am not a big fan of the foam mattresses in some of the Marriot Courtyards but the bed was comfortable enough for a good nights sleep.  The elevators to me were very slow.  The cable on the TV was out for NBC and CBS so those channels never worked for us which was frustrating.  There are plenty of restuarants close to eat from all levels of food.  The hotel is reasonably close to Disney shuttle lot, too
Manager Response: Thank you, Techsan93, for your detailed summary of your stay with us.  We appreciate you sharing with other TripAdvisor travelers that you enjoyed a good value experience.  Your insight is pertinent to us and our commitment to our guests to provide a comfortable and memorable stay.  We have taken your comments seriously and will include them in our meeting discussions.  Thank you for your recommendation.  We hope to have the pleasure of serving you the next time you are visiting Anaheim, CA.  Kindly, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary: I like the Hotel was clean, was close to Disneyland we walked  2 blocks to the parking and got the shuttle to Disneyland park, is close to a lot of restaurants, but they charge 16.70 for parking each day,  and the restaurant is expensive in 2 nights I was there I didn't see not body eating there, so we went to Carls Jr and got breakfast and ate at the lobby they have free coffee from 6:30am to 9:30am , also the have a coin laundry that we saw when we were leaving because  not body told us about it.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing how incredibly close we are to the Disney Parks, as well as a variety of restaurants and shops!  We apologize that you were not aware of our laundry facilities.  Please keep in mind for your next stay that our websites list a detailed overview of our entire property and all of our amenities.  Thank you, Verito23, for your valued business and great review on your stay with us.  Best Regards, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary: Okay, so any reader will know, I tend to stay at Courtyard Marriotts.   I have to say this one was all over the place.  First off, the service was the standard high level.  What I tend to find is that the hotels that are franchised typically have much better service and staff than the corporate owned ones (e.g., Oyster Bay in the San Francisco Bay area is horrible).     That being said, my biggest issue with this facility is the building.   We were on the top floor, but as we walked, the room would shake and the furniture would shake. The floors also would sag.  I was thinking that the people below us must think we are stomping around.    Also, we could clearly hear the folks in the adjoining rooms.     We had friends staying on the second floor and they said they could hear the
Manager Response: Dear A W,  We are disappointed that your stay was less than impressive.  Please accept our apologies for the inconveniences that you incurred in your room.  We greatly appreciate your input and would like to follow up on the details mentioned in your review.  At your earliest convenience, please call our hotel directly and provide us with further details on the exact location of your room so that we may promptly look into what you described.  We are also sorry that we were not able to fulfill all of your requests.  Your preferences are very important to us, however, our options become limited when operating at full capacity.  Thank you for your kind remarks on our staff and high level of service.  Your valued feedback will assist us in our constant efforts to deliver the best stay Anaheim has to offer.  Best, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary: Reserved a kids suite for our trip to Disneyland.  Two room suite with bunk beds for the kids was perfect! Emily and Phil and the rest of the staff were excellent to work with.  Walking distance to Disneyland!!  After spending the day at the resort it was nice to relax in the pool and hot tub.  Most nights we were the only ones out there!  The food and the Starbucks in the hotel were also excellent!  I would recommend that you stay here!!!
Manager Response: We are very excited at the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland!  Thank you for your fantastic rating and review.  We are extremely happy that our Kids Suite was was perfect for you and your family!  Your wonderful compliments on our service and accommodations are greatly appreciated, as is your high recommendation to other travelers!  Come back so see us again!  Best, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Marriott address: 2045 Harbor Bl., Anaheim, CA, 92802<< Read with Caution>>
Summary: Our experience while staying at this particular Marriott was long suffered and felt through the lack of security in which Marriott (address: 2045 Harbor Bl. Anaheim, CA 92802) has in place. We paid for parking an amount which exceeded $15.00 usd in addition to this charge, our Brand New Toyota Highlander was vandalized and we incurred unnecessary property damage to our vehicle which exceeds over $2,000 usd according to our family auto technician. This was a very unfortunate experience in which we as a family out enjoying a family night out with our children, did not expect to suffer. Our hearts are saddened and we did not expect this to happen at a Marriott Courtyard in which we specifically sat down and planned our mini vacation. Nevertheless, the staff at this location was
Manager Response: Once again, we would like to extend our sincere apologies.  Please know that this unfortunate situation does not represent a typical stay.
