Be assured that we take guest security seriously, as our guests' comfort and safety are of the utmost concern to us.  Although we do have security staff on site in the evening and early morning hours, we hope that you can understand that this type of incident is beyond the control of the hotel.  We are always available to assist our guests in contacting the proper authorities and providing any details when possible.  It is understandable how an incident such as this can set the tone for an entire experience, and hope that you will reconsider returning to enjoy a much improved experience with us.  Thank you for completing the review.  Sincerely, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Make sure to check your account!
Summary: The room was nice but the employees weren't well groomed or friendly. But most importantly they are ripping people off. We booked our stay with Expedia but the hotel charged us again. We called they reversed it. We checked our account again nov 12 and they charged our account again. It was exactly a month later. Either they are imcompitant or the company is stealing. If you have stayed there before I would check your accounts!
Manager Response: Dear Aperez8,  As we expressed to you over the phone, we are extremely sorry the errors.  Thank you very much for your patience and understanding while we corrected the rare glitch in our system.  Again, we apologize for this inconvenience.  Please be assured that these errors were unintentional and that we pride ourselves on our staff's high integrity and professionalism.  Thank you for bringing all of this to our attention.  We appreciate your phone calls and your review.  Kindly, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient for conference centre and Disney
Summary: Clean room with a very comfortable bed. Large desk for working. Good shower. Lovely pool.  My room had an adjoining door through which I could hear the person next door snoring. The fridge was so noisy I switched it off at night. The air conditioning control a bit unpredictable. Breakfast service was slow even though I only wanted cereal. Gym has 2 running machines, a cross trainer and some weights. There is a shuttle bus to Disney but I walked. There is a short cut to the conference centre through the parking area.
Manager Response: Dear Poole11,  We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed our clean accommodations and comfortable beds.  Your high ratings on our location, value, rooms and service are greatly appreciated!  We do have a variety of room locations that they may be a better option for your sleeping preferences.  Please keep this in mind when making your next reservation with us or during the check in process and we would be happy to let you know what we have available.   Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel and for completing the review.  Best,  Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary: My family and I traveled here specifically for the kids room. I have to say this was the worst marriot experience I've ever had. The room had a nasty odor that made me want vomit and the carpet looked like it wasn't cleaned in years. The bedroom window was facing the parking lot and right in front of it was a street light that kept me up all night even with the blinds down,
Manager Response: Dear Clara,  Receiving your review and learning the details of your stay is quite disappointing.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience that occurred, and know that we appreciate any opportunity to make things right while you are staying with us.  We take our commitment to delivering superior customer service extremely seriously and would have taken the necessary steps in order to ensure your comfort. It would certainly be our pleasure to earn your confidence in us and we hope you will decide to give us that opportunity.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention by completing the review.  Sincerely, Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Really nice hotel close to convention censer
Summary: This was a business trip to a conference. Hotel is really close to conference center and also disney land. The atmosphere and the hotel design is really good. Service is at good level and the rooms are spacious.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback, Wegi!  We are so glad that you chose to stay with us on your recent business trip to Anaheim.  Thank you for sharing with others how much you enjoyed the atmosphere and hotel design at the Courtyard by Marriott at Disneyland Resort.  It was a pleasure to have you as our guest and we hope to serve you again on your next visit to the U.S.  Best Regards,  Phil Campanelli, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place for business AND family
Summary: I stayed here while attending a conference as I was able to get a better rate than at the conference hotel next door. I had some reservations about it when I looked at the hotel site and saw pictures of rooms with bunk beds for kids. But, the room I had was great for business, and aside from the occasional patter of excited feet headed to Disneyland, the place was quiet. New, clean, comfortable. Had a nice desk with plenty of places to plug in electronic gadgets. If you've got a meeting at the Anaheim Convention Center or one of the big convention hotels, I'd advise staying here, as the hotel is a good value for the neighborhood and it's only a little more than a block to walk to the convention complex through the hotel parking lot. There's a café in the lobby where you can grab
Manager Response: What an excellent review from such an avid traveler and Top Contributor of TripAdvisor!  Thank you, williedillo!  We couldn't agree with you more; the Couryard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland is a great place for both the business and leisure traveler.  All of the details you have shared with other travelers and the compliments your enjoyable stay are greatly appreciated.  We hope we have earned your guest loyalty, and your business travels bring you back to our area very soon!  Best Regards, Art Collantes, General Manager

Summary Heading: The rooms were nice and thats it...
Summary: We stayed Columbus day weekend, we checked in late night friday, well i guess they liked to clean their rooms early because they knocked on our door at 7am prompt trying to clean. Really? I appriciate a clean room, but I think it could have waited a little bit, we weren't checking out until Sunday. Oh and we requested a pack and play for our 1 year old upon making the reservation, which we though t was an awesome thing, however when we checked in they front desk lady told me they didnt have our rooms blocked so the pack and play wasnt there yet. Upon arrival to our room about 30 minutes passed and there was still no pack and play, I called the front desk to check the ETA since it was 9pm and our 1 year old needed to be sleep, the front desk told us that they have to call someone
Manager Response: We apologize for the error that somehow occurred in reserving your rooms and the miscommunication that took place upon your arrival.  Your patience as we resolved the situation is greatly appreciated.  Thank you for taking the time to complete the TripAdvisor review.  We would certainly be thrilled to have another opportunity to serve you and deliver the hassle-free, improved stay that you deserve.  We understand we have to earn your guest loyalty, and are very eager serve you again soon.  Best, Art Collantes

Summary: We stayed here in September 2013 with our 2 kids (4 and 6) for a trip to disney.  When we got to the property at 9:30am to park our car in the lot - they allowed us to checkin!  So that was so nice.  The room was spotless and the property itsself appeared to be recently remodeled.  We walked to disney from the hotel on both days.  Its probably a little too far for some - but not others.  It was okay for us - but I did have to carry my 4 year old all the way back at the end of day 2.  highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for your high recommendation of our Anaheim hotel, jeff c!  We appreciate you choosing  to bring your family to Anaheim and giving us the opportunity to accommodate you.  It is always our pleasure to fulfill your request for early check in whenever possible.  Thank you for letting us know that you and your family enjoyed a 5 star experience with us and we look forward to delivering more of the same on your return visit.  Sincerely, Art Collantes, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: We stayed here 4 nights. The hotel is situated in walking distance to Disneyland and there are also a lot of restaurants in the surrounding area.  The staff here are awesome especially the staff at reception.  No matter what you asked, they were always very friendly, helpful and if they didn't know, they did their best to find out.  We had a large room with a comfortable bed and pillows. The bathroom was also large with a shower over the bath. We had a good view from our room overlooking the swimming pool and spa pool area.  There are also loungers around the pool.  It is a very nice area to relax in and have a swim. The restaurant served lovely meals, we ate at both breakfast and dinner times.  The portions are rather large although this seems to be common in LA.  The hotel
Manager Response: Dear Nat A,  It was our extreme pleasure to go above and beyond in serving you throughout your stay.  We are happy to inform you that our third part internet provider resolved the connectivity issue that was suddenly occurring in some of our rooms.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  All of your compliments on your enjoyable experience are greatly appreciated.  We can't wait welcome you back to the U.S. and earn another 5 star rating!  Thank you for your review.  Best, Art Collantes, General Manager

Summary: Great hotel good location 5 minute walk to restaurants and shops. Rooms nice but quite dark, comfy beds with fridge and coffee maker. Staff extremely friendly especially front desk and the lady in the coffee shop. Nice pool area which was really quiet when we was there at the beginning of September most days we had the pool and hot tub to ourselves. There's a small games room for the kids and a nice reception area with sofas and chairs where you can watch the football games. Overall a great hotel and would definately stay again.
Manager Response: Dear ben b,  Thank you for visiting Anaheim and choosing to stay with us during your recent holiday in the U.S.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your experience.  There are great advantages to vacationing after the busy summer months have passed and the new school year has begun.  We appreciate your high remarks on our incredible staff, nice accommodations and great location.  Thank you for your review.  We are very excited to hear that would definitely stay again, and hope it will be soon!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: within walking distance to all Disneyland Attractions
Summary: Although the location of this hotel was ideal, you can walk to disneyland, disneys california adventure, downtown disney, as well as alot of different restaurants and shops along that same strip, it wasnt what i expected out of a marriott. their were four adults staying in a room for two nights while we celebrated a birthday at disneyland. when we checked in there was a charge for parking which im not used to at any marriott ive stayed(and i always chose marriott whenever possible) which was a reason we wanted a hotel in walking distance since we didnt want to pay for parking at the park. The fee was about 15 dollars a day which wasnt horrible but then when we tried to park there were NO spots! finally one opened up as someone was leaving but to charge your customers for parking
Manager Response: Dear bward27,  Please accept my apology for failing to deliver an impressive and enjoyable experience at our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to bring your valued insight to my attention, as I have taken your comments seriously and immediately followed up on our shortcomings.  Please know that our parking fee is commensurate with the majority of brand hotels in our entire area.  You will find that the properties that do not specify a parking fee will most likely have higher accommodation rates.  Be assured that your comfort is our top priority and, again, I apologize that your stay was not up to the standards you have come to expect from us.  Thank you for your continued patronage to Marriott brand hotels.  I do hope you will give us another opportunity to gain your confidence in us.  Our staff is dedicated to serving our guests and would appreciate the pleasure of exceeding your expectations.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location for Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I stayed at the Courtyard while attending the D23 Disney Fan Expo Convention.   Pros: The rooms were clean and most of the staff I interacted with were very nice and helpful. When there was a gathering near the pool being noisy right below my window late at night, one call to the front desk had security out there taking care of it very quickly.  Food from quick service counter was tasty. Traveling alone I felt safe in this hotel. It was a short walk away from the Anaheim Convention Center. Free internet!   Cons: When I arrived to check in there was no front desk agent in sight - waited nearly ten minutes for one to appear. There was another guest waiting before me so I don't know how long the agent was missing. Faint musty smell in room. Only one elevator at each end of the
Manager Response: Dear AmyKJT,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel while attending the D23 Disney Fan Expo Convention.  While we are pleased to hear all of your compliments, we also appreciate you bringing our shortcomings to our attention.  We are always eager to listen to our guests' feedback, as we are committed to making the necessary improvements wherever possible.  Please accept our apologies for the delay in both customer and elevator services.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  Our staff hopes that your travels bring you back to our hotel to enjoy an improved stay.  We look forwarded to serving you with the attentiveness you deserve.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Location- Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: I thought this hotel was excellent value for money. It's in an ideal location & we picked it up for $77/night. It did not disappoint! The room was very clean, quiet, large and modern. We had free internet and a mini fridge. There is a nice pool to use as well. I was very pleased with the location as we were within walking distance to Disneyland. If you don't mind a 15-20min walk up the street, it's very close. One night we were tired of walking and ended up just taking the local bus for $2. So either way it's a good deal. My only beef is that you do have to pay for nightly parking but this seems to be a normal practice in the area. Breakfast is not included but you can buy it in the lobby.  If you're into outlet shopping it's also about 5min by car to the Outlets at Orange. It
Manager Response: Thank you for your superb rating and review, Bahams_Babe33!  Your high recommendation to other travelers seeking an Anaheim hotel for a Disneyland vacation is greatly appreciated.  It's wonderful to hear that you would stay with us again without any hesitations.  We hope you've already booked your next visit!  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us and for giving us all of your positive feedback.  Kindest Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Spent one night at this hotel before the Disneyland 10k. Great location, about a 20-25 minute walk from Disneyland. Hotel is decorated nicely and is very clean. Our room was very comfortable and check in and out was easy. Would stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear lovetotravelca02,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel before participating in the Disneyland marathon.  It is always so nice to hear when our guests have a comfortable and enjoyable experience with us.  Thank you for giving us your great feedback.  We are very excited that you would stay with us again in the future.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 5 day with our son , daughter - law , and grandson. We could walk to the park. It was a wonderful stay. I will stay again at this hotel. The staff from the front desk to maid service was exceptional. This is the perfect hotel for "The Disneyland experience". It is also just a few miles from Knox Berry Farm.
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent rating and review, Jellybeanexp!  We are extremely pleased to learn that you and your family enjoyed a wonderful experience and that you will stay again.  Thank you for your positive feedback on our exceptional customer service.  It was our pleasure to be your perfect hotel for The Disneyland experience.  We can't wait to serve you again!  Kindest Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This hotel was as nice as its pictures. We stayed in the Family suite, separately divided rooms, the kids had bunk beds, sofa sleeper and nice queen beds. Hotel was very clean, breakfast was delicious. Our all around trip was amazing. The hotel does expect that you pay for your entire stay up front the night you arrive, which was not a big deal however; for the people registering before us, it was a big deal.... Our experience was excellent, friendly staff, nice heated pool and across the street from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Kelli L,  We appreciate you sharing with other TripAdvisor travelers that you found our Anaheim hotel just as nice as our pictures!  Thank you for detailing the Kids Suite, as we are certain others will find your review helpful.   We are very happy that you had an excellent stay with us and look forward to having you and your family as our guests on your next trip out to California.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Stayed Here in May during Elks Convention
Summary: We had a very nice experience at the Anaheim Marriott. Stayed here during our annual California Hawaii Elks Association convention. Our first stay but we would stay again. Nice rooms and service. Close to Disneyland although we didn't go to Disneyland. We would recommend the hotel to our family and friends.
Manager Response: Dear John B,  Thank you very much for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel during your annual California Hawaii Elks Association Convention.  What an honor it was to have you as our guest!  It is very exciting to learn that you had a nice experience with us and that you would recommend our property to family and friends.  We hope we have earned your guest loyalty and will look forward to serving you again.  Your review is greatly appreciated by our entire team.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My family, which included myself, my husband, 3 boys (6, 4, and 1 yr old) and my parents stayed here while on vacation to Disneyland. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with a smile and welcomed. The amazing staff at the front desk set us up with adjoining rooms so that we could be right next to each other. The rooms so clean and very spacious. We were able to move around easily and fit everyone, even the pack n' play, which they happily provided. Also, when they cleaned the room they set up the pack n' play so nice with my son's animals and blankets ready for bed. Extra touches that made it so special. The rooms were quiet so we could easily get to sleep at night. So important! All of us loved the remodeled lobby and restaurant. Beautiful! Also, the ART shuttle to
Manager Response: Dear MOMOF3060812,  We truly appreciate your 5 star rating and excellent review on your experience at the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort.  Thank you for letting other travelers know just how comfortable and spacious our accommodations are for large families!  Our amazing staff enjoyed serving you and your family with warm and attentive customer service, and we hope to have the pleasure of doing so again very soon.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Marriot = Bad Business practice monopolizing America
Summary: Wow! I am so stunned with the lack of common business skills I really do not know where to start.  Let me begin all the way at the beginning this may be long! I was provided a free room stay due to the poor room and service previously received. With that said any logical business person would not want this to happen twice in a row because it is a direct reflection of the staff and company.  I wanted to take a trip to Disney and picked this location because of my fear to return to the Irvine one where I had my poor experience to begin with. When booking I called to use the voucher and wanted to pay in advance for my stay on the additional night. The corp. phone told me to complete a form and send it to the facility, and so I did.  A week into it I was still calling this hotel
Manager Response: Dear KnL32480,  We would like to sincerely apologize for the inconveniences and thank you for your patience and understanding while we resolved these issues.  There are standard operation procedures that we must abide by, and, again, we are very sorry for the delay that you experienced throughout the process.  If there are any further details you would like to discuss, please contact me directly at the hotel at your earliest convenience.  It is our great hope that we will have the opportunity in the future to regain your confidence in the Marriott brand.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: THIS PLACE...  The room was fine, hotel was fine.  Walking distance to Disneyland, which was great.  That's where the "fine" ends.  - I had to call them FOUR TIMES to get them to push a pre-payment for my room through.  HOW HARD IS IT TO TAKE MY MONEY?  Every time they said they would "put it through today", I finally got an employee with half a brain the last time apparently - I asked when I checked in if there would be a hold on my card for incidentals, was told "no".  There ended up being a hold.  Called Customer Service and they told me "There is a sign saying there will be a hold".  I ASKED THE AGENT DIRECTLY and was told "no", am I to assume they are lying?  Talking to my bank and another employee it seems there shouldn't have been a charge since the room was pre-paid.   -
Manager Response: Dear Ryan L,  We are extremely sorry for the inconveniences and miscommunications.  Please know that there are standard procedures that must be followed, and depending on the type of card used and the bank that supports the card, there are these few occasions where unexpected delays may occur that we do not have any control over.  Again, please accept our apologies.  We do hope you will reconsider giving us the opportunity in the future to regain your confidence in the Courtyard by Marriott brand.  it would be our great pleasure to deliver an improved, hassle-free experience with us on your next visit to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: After spending hours and hours searching hotels online for our stay while at Disneyland, I booked this based on reviews on tripadvisor.  I was very pleasantly surprised just how good it was.  We had a family room with a queen bed and a separate room with bunks/TV and couch.  It was ideal for my husband, me and our two boys.  Considering other hotels near Disneyland can be double the price, I thought this was very good value for money.  We walked to Disneyland and California Adventure which was a 10-15min walk.  The options for eating out around the hotel are excellent.  We had breakfast in the hotel which was superb.  US$5 for a large kids cereal, milk and a banana.  For US$4 they had a big granola with yogurt and fresh strawberries.  An excellent and cheap way to start the day.
Manager Response: Dear Number9NZ,  We appreciate you taking the time to share the good value and great rates you enjoyed.  Thank you for also noting that after many hours of researching you booked your stay with us based on reviews by our valued guests.  It was our extreme pleasure to exceed your expectations and we are excited that you and your family would definitely stay with us again.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: stayed July 2013, good prices considering it was so close to Disneyland, Had good breakfasts,  a small dinner menu, however Ruth Christ Steakhouse was directly in front of the hotel, Staff was pleasant, overall was very satified, the cost for taxi to Disneyland was only $6, Would stay there again
Manager Response: Dear michaelkathleen58,  Thank you for sharing how competitive are rates are with other Tripadvisor travelers.  It's great to learn that you will return to stay with us and that you think the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim is a great place!  We can't wait to see you and your family again!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We called as the hotel we had booked into was not meeting expectations. The Marriott helped us change hotels and was clean, staff were friendly. Pool is nice size for swimming and the food at the Bristol was good. We wished we had stayed the whole trip at this location and will use it next time we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Icemen1977,  We appreciate your sharing with other travelers how much you appreciated our friendly service in assisting you with your hotel changes and that you enjoyed your stay with us.  It was our pleasure to make the remainder of your trip a comfortable experience.  We are thrilled that you will be returning and look forward to having you as our guest again!  With Much Appreciation,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Not a bad place and has some nice additions but no shuttle to Disney. The location is easy and has many eating options around. The am food was good and the manager's snack was nice. It is a solid choice that is less expensive than other options. The staff was awesome at making a tired day better.
Manager Response: Dear John M,  Thank you!  We are very excited to receive your kind feedback and to hear that our awesome staff made your tired days better!  Your comfort is most certainly our top priority and we appreciate your recognition of our exceptional customer service.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent business visit.  We are looking forward to serving you again and earning your guest loyalty.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: A Very Good Place to Use as Disneyland Base
Summary: First off, the only thing i was a bit disappointed with was the somewhat limited menu at the in-house bistro.  Other than that this place is superb, especially for use as a base of operations for visiting Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm.  Shuttle buses to/from Disneyland are a block-and-a-half away and run continuously.  The front desk staff can answer just about ANY question you may have about Disneyland.  They were always friendly, courteous and accommodating.  Example: I had unknowingly double-booked rooms and might have faced a no-show but Jackie at the front desk spotted it while arranging a room nearby for our daughter and son-in-law and grandsons, and tracked me down to discuss it with me and make sure it was an error and then got things corrected.  The grandsons loved
Manager Response: Dear beedub2,  We appreciate you making us your home base while visiting the nearby Anaheim attractions!  It's wonderful to hear how much you and your extended family loved our hotel.  It is always a pleasure to read such kind comments about the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort and our superior staff!  We understand how precious our guests' time is, and do our very best to make every moment memorable!  We appreciate your 5 star rating across the board and hope you will return to stay with us again. Thank you for your fabulous review!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This is a clean nice courtyard. The food in the bistro is delicious!!! There is a bar too. Try the chicken Caesar salad or chicken sandwich. Talk to Victoria the bartender. Nice lady. The rooms are large well appointed and clean. The front desk agents are great!!! Friendly of course, never expect less from Marriott!!! Try it. Nice place.
Manager Response: Dear travelingmaxine,  It is very exciting to receive your 5 star rating and fantastic review on our accommodations, services and good value.  Also, thank you for your wonderful compliments on our staff and restaurant.  Your tips will certainly be helpful to other travelers seeking all that you enjoyed.  We appreciate your Marriott loyalty and recommendation of our Anaheim property.  It will be a great pleasure for all of us to earn another 5 star rating on your next experience at the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort.  Kindest Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Stayed at this hotel and was pretty impressed. Good resting place after a long day in the parks. You can easily walk to the parks from this hotel, takes about 15-20 mins. Very friendly and accommodating staff.
Manager Response: Dear Kristy G,  It was our extreme pleasure to impress you!  We truly enjoy our guests and being of service whenever possible.  Thank you for your very kind remarks on our property and staff.  We hope that you and your friends will choose to stay with us again on your next visit to the U.S.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient to the Convention Center and Disneyland
Summary: Was booking travel for an event at the Convention Center and had wanted to get into the Marriott. Unfortunately, the place was booked and this was my second choice. Since I paid in Marriott points, I have no complaints with the price :-). As for the hotel, it's conveniently located to most things. Since I didn't drive/rent a car, I didn't have to pay the ridiculous parking fee. And, since the event provided most meals, I didn't have to buy breakfast, either. My only complaint was being in room 207, which backs up to the elevator. Fortunately, the bedroom has a door, but even with the door closed, you can still hear it. Also, being a wheel chair accessible room, it took some time to get used to the open shower, and not flood the bathroom. Lastly, the shower took forever to get
Manager Response: Dear MKroehler,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel and taking the time to detail your experience.  You are correct; our fantastic location is convenient to just about everything our exciting city has to offer!  We appreciate you bringing to our attention the delay you experienced in getting a hot water shower so that we can immediately follow up not this.  Thank you for sharing that you enjoyed our hotel and location.  We do hope that your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  We would love to have you as our guest again soon!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great last minute choice - was very happy
Summary: When looking for accommodation, i found there were many places that looked very outdated. Before i knew it, most had sold out and i managed to get a room here. I was very impressed with the service, facilities and service. The hotel exceeded my expectations. I would make the courtyard by Marriott in Anaheim my first choice when returning in future. Exceptionally friendly staff, only a 8 minute walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Tyrone534,  We are honored to be your first choice in Anaheim accommodations and look forward to having you as our loyal guest!  It was our extreme pleasure to exceed your expectations with impressive service, rooms and amenities.  Thank you for mentioning the short and convenient walk to the Disney Parks.  We hope you will be back to visit the U.S. this year.  Our staff can't wait to have you as our guests again.  Kindest Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I would rate this hotel at 3 1/2 stars.  The rooms were nice, however, the walls are a little thin you can hear people talking in the hallways.  The rooms themselves are nice and are pretty large.  The parking fee for this hotel is $14 a night.  The walk to Disney is a little over a mile.
Manager Response: Dear chrisw03,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and providing us with your valued feedback.  We are glad you had an enjoyable stay, however, we apologize for any inconvenience caused from hearing other guests talk in the hallway.  Thank you for sharing how nice and spacious you found our accommodations. We do hope to have the pleasure of having you as our guests again.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Nice quiet rooms since it sits back from Harbor Blvd. Fits 4 people no problem. Don't like paying $14 to park,when most of the other similar hotels on Harbor are free parking, but you are getting a little more quality room than the others, so it works out.   Nice little bistro in the lobby for breakfast and dinner. Super nice front desk staff!  Small pool, but adequate for a refreshing dip!
Manager Response: Dear cruzmomma,  It's great to hear that you enjoyed our nice and quiet accommodations, friendly customer service and newly remodeled restaurant.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback by completing the TripAdvisor review.  You are absolutely correct; other properties in our area that do not have a parking fee will most likely have higher room rates and certainly won't have the Marriott brand quality.  We do hope the that you and your family plan to return Anaheim again.  We would love to have you all as our guests again soon!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I did not get the room that I booked. The room I booked online had bunk beds for my kids. My kids were really excited and then we didn't even get that room. I was over charged, if I knew I was get a basic room for 150$ I would of stayed somewhere else. I don't mind spending the money. I would of spent more for better staff and a room with a bunk bed for my kids because it was a family vacation. They charge 14 $ for parking so it made our room 150 for a basic room. The staff was very rude and unwelcoming! I will never stay there again!
Manager Response: Dear tigerdaizy,  We are very sorry for the miscommunication that occurred and that, unfortunately, we were unable to provide you with your preferred room type.  We have immediately followed up with our staff on your comments, and apologize for the unacceptable level of service described in your review, as this is not the typical experience.  Please know that you will find our rates are quite competitive in the our area.  We appreciate you taking the time to bring the details of your stay to our attention and hope that we are given the opportunity to deliver the improved and impressive stay that you deserve.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Amazing Value located near Convention center and Disneyland.  Had convention with Gourmet Foods Convention and brought family to go to Disney.  Staff, Cleanliness and Service exceeded our expectations.  My son had a slight problem with a cut toe, his own fault, and the staff was amazing how they handled the situation.  They truly care at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Duke S,  We can't thank you enough for our 5 star rating and review!  It's wonderful to learn of your comfort and enjoyment, as we never tire of hearing that we have exceeded our guests' expectations.  Our staff is carefully chosen and all have a genuine passion for customer service.  You are spot on; we do, indeed, care and hope that your son's toe is well and healed.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent business visit and for bringing your family along.  We are honored to be your hidden Anaheim treasure and look forward to earning another 5 star review from you and your family.  Kindest Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Used my points to book a stay for a quick 2 day Disneyland trip. For being a vacation hotspot, this hotel is quiet and a great value. I half expected it to be busy and the staff too harried to deal with visitors. I was wrong. The staff is attentive, friendly, and very helpful.   We checked in early to get a parking spot. This is a good value as you can park in the morning, walk to Disneyland and then check in and get your room in the evening, and leave your car in their lot the next day for a single price compared to Disney charging you 2 days.  Disneyland is a 1.1 mile straight walk with convenience stores along the way.  The Bistro staff were friendly and fast, and the food hit the spot.   I'd suggest this hotel to anyone who wants to avoid feeling like just another tourist.
Manager Response: Dear JMInstructor,  Wow!  Your recognition of our constant efforts to provide our guests with exceptional service is greatly appreciated.  We have shared your review with our staff, as your positive insight is truly a great reward for all of us.  It was our pleasure to exceed your expectations and we look forward to impressing you all over again on your return visit.  Thank you very much for completing the review and recommending our Anaheim hotel to other travelers seeking a memorable experience.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a friends trip to Disneyland. We checked in late and I was given a room near a screaming child and a family who kept turning up the tv volume to mask the sound. Anticipating this could foreshadow the entire evening I asked for a room change. The staff was so accommodating and switched us rooms no questions asked. They were very polite and helpful. I also took their Disney bus and the drivers both ways were lovely. We had a great stay, no complaints and I would go back for sure, although I might be done with Disneyland for awhile. Parking was expensive also... That's one of the downsides.
Manager Response: Dear tiredtravellerCanada,  Thank you for sharing with other travelers that you enjoyed your stay at our Anaheim hotel.  We appreciate you taking the time to recognize our continuous efforts to deliver superior customer service to all of our guests.  Your compliments are the best reward!  We're also glad that you took advantage of the Anaheim Resort Transportation Shuttle that picks you up and drops you off steps away from our hotel for a nominal daily fee.  It's wonderful to learn that you would definitely return to stay with us and we hope it will be soon!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Five minutes drive and with in walking distance of the Disney land park. Major stores (Target) and gas stations nearby. Spacious rooms with updated facilities. Good car park (paid). Reception and restaurants needs to be upgraded, the restaurant has Ala carte menu but would be better with a full buffet breakfast offering.
Manager Response: Dear Mir_Dxb,  We are very happy that you enjoyed our spacious accommodations, updated facilities and amazing Anaheim location!  Thank you for your comments and suggestions.  Your insight is extremely important to us and we appreciate your time in providing us with your feedback.  We will look forward to welcoming you and your family back to the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort.  Kindest Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Went to Disneyland with my sister-in-law -- just the two of us -- to celebrate her birthday. Our intent was to stay Sunday through Tuesday morning so we could get in the incredible fireworks display Sunday night. (Unfortunately, it was too windy, so the show was canceled.) We finally checked into our hotel room around 10 pm and knew we'd have to pay parking...BUT...at the desk we were given the option to throw a die and "win" a prize. Our prize was free parking!   We went to sleep fairly quickly after the long day. I, however, woke up several times with a horrible cough. In the morning, my sister-in-law said I was unresponsive. Fortunately, she got help from the front desk. They were able to give her the name of their on-call doctor and any other help she asked for. When I
Manager Response: Dear kgtraveler2090,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our property while celebrating your sister-in-law's birthday in Anaheim.  It was our pleasure to assist your sister-in-law and we're pleased that you received the proper care needed to get you feeling well again.  Thank you for the great review and for mentioning the exceptional customer service you experienced.  We hope you will both visit again soon to enjoy all that you originally planned.  We'll be anxiously awaiting the opportunity to provide you with an exciting and memorable stay!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: It felt like I only slept with sheets.  Their idea of a blanket was 3 sheets.  Also did not know there was a parking fee.  I would not have stayed at this hotel had I known this.  The rest of the hotel exceeded my expectations.  Staff was very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear RN_linda78,  Thank you for staying with us.  We apologize for the blanket inconvenience and miscommunication in regard to our parking fee.  Please know that we always have extra blanket available for our guests that can be immediately delivered to your room upon your request.  Also, our parking fee is listed on our websites, as well as third party websites, and is standardly reviewed with our guests upon booking a reservation and during the check in process.  Again, we are sorry for any miscommunication that occurred.  It is great to learn that we exceeded your expectations in regard to every other aspect of your stay.  We thank you of your review and look forward to impressing you throughout your entire experience on your next visit.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We had stayed at the nearby Marriott Residence last year, which was a far better hotel for a lower price.   The Courtyard does not include breakfast and we got a better rate at the Residence In last year.  Our towels at Courtyard were thin and torn, our room was next to an elevator which could be incredibly loud, depending on who was waiting for a lift;   there was a lot of early morning floor banging from the room above, they charge $15 to park even though it's really too far to walk to the Disneyland  main gate.  On the positive side, the staff was very efficient and the rooms are very nice, but I don't think we'd stay here again unless everything else was filled.
Manager Response: Dear lynnieBH,  We are sorry that we failed provide the quality stay that you deserve during your recent stay at our hotel.  Please accept our apologies for the morning noise disturbance you experienced from the neighboring guests located above your room.  We appreciate you taking the time to compliment our efficient staff and nice accommodations.  If you return to our area, we hope you will reconsider and stay with us again.  We certainly would appreciate the opportunity to deliver an improved stay. Thank you very much for your review.  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel near Disneyland and the Convention Center
Summary: Stayed here for a convention recently and it did not dissapoint.  The front desk staff were very friendly as was everyone.  The lobby is very nice with a nice little restaurant area with a simple bar where you can get wine, beer and mixed drinks.  Breakfast is made to order and delivered to your table.  The rooms are modernly appointed with flatscreens and a nice working area.  Free wifi in the rooms with nice bandwidth to do whatever you need.  Parking is available for $14/day.  Overall, very nice hotel.
Manager Response: Dear PJT_NJ,  Thank you for your time and effort in giving us your great feedback and 5 star rating!  It is very rewarding for our staff to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us. Thank you for mentioning our brand new lobby and The Bistro.  We certainly had our guests in mind when our design and construction team transformed these two areas into state of the art work, social and dining spaces.  We appreciate your patronage and look forward to serving you again.  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: During our annual trade show this is the place we always try to stay.  It is walking distance to the convention center and the host hotels without the madness or the costs of the full service hotels.  Typical, reliable courtyard, has full bar (drinks are pricey though), breakfast and dinner.
Manager Response: Dear Dave F,  We are delighted to receive your review and be named the best place to stay for Anaheim Convention Center!  Thank you for being our loyal guest year after year and taking the time to tell other travelers about your experience with us by posting a review.  We're so glad that our renowned Courtyard quality experience, affordable rates and close proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center keeps you coming back to stay with us.  Our staff looks forward to your return!  Kindest Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel in February 2013.  While the hotel keeps up with Marriott standards, while in Anaheim, I prefer the Residence Inn not far from the Courtyard.  For the money, the difference in levels of categories for Marriott, the Residence in is far superior.  There is no breakfast at the Courtyard, it is farther away from Disneyland and to me, not so family oriented.  Only staying a couple of nights was ok, but it's a long walk to restaurants, a longer walk to Disneyland and just not really convenient for us.  However, that being said, it does keep with Marriott standards as far as being clean, hotel staff is great and you always know when you stay at a Marriott that there will be no issues that are not immediately resolved.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Californiagirl,  We are happy that you chose to stay at our hotel and appreciate your Marriott brand loyalty.  As you mentioned, the Marriott brand does offer a complete family of hotels in order to meet the traveler's  individual needs and preferences.  Here at the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort, we offer unique accommodations for families, couples and business travelers that truly sets us apart from the rest.  Again, we do appreciate your patronage and time in providing us with your insight.  We're glad to hear that you would return to our Anaheim hotel!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Courtyard downgrades letting 95% of F&B staff go...
Summary: Having stayed here every year for 6 years with a group of 9, we look forward to the cozy restaurant and bar, friendly staff and good menu. Unfortunately Marriott has chosen to close for remodeling which forces their long time staff to find other work. The restaurant has been replaced witrh cold counter service serving a very limited menu on plastic plates and beverages in plastic cups. The staff has been reduced to three. Lunch and foom service has been abandoned. Dinner is served in the same style but only a limited lunch menu is offered. If this isn't bad enough they installed a (suposedley) high tech oven in which everything is cooked that makes a raquet heard trhroughout the lobby and dining area. Of course the room rates continue to climb. If you want service this is no
Manager Response: Dear wilsonnyc,  We apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced.  Please know that as of mid-January our renovations to our lobby and restaurant have been completed.  We are very excited about our new transformations and hope you will return to enjoy an improved experience at our hotel, including our restaurant, The Bistro.  Our staff would appreciate the opportunity to have you back as our guest to enjoy all of our new upgrades and amazing changes!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here one night in February.  The staff was great, the room was clean and comfortable.  The location was fantastic.  We spent the entire day at the parks, and were able to park our car at the hotel early in the day and take the ART system which is located adjacent to this hotel.  Great location for seeing Disneyland/California Adventure!
Manager Response: Dear Mary_Anne1223,  Our entire staff thanks you for the 5 star rating and review on our Anaheim hotel!  We are extremely pleased to hear of your comfort in our clean accommodations.  Also, thank you for mentioning our fantastic location!  We are, indeed, so very close to all of the excitement at the nearby attractions.  Thank you for choosing to bring your family to experience our hotel.  We look forward to your next visit to California.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We were very pleased with our stay at the Courtyard in Disneyland. Clean and nicely renovated property.  Very close to Disneyland with the ART bus system located at the adjacent Marriott.  We would have preferred if the bus dropped right at the hotel, but the short walk wasn't too bad.  Our room was comfortable and quiet and well appointed.  The front desk staff were friendly although I had one who wasn't all that helpful.    The lobby was nice and the restaurant was pretty typical of the Courtyard's across the country.    The rate was very reasonable for a property near Disneyland.    We wish Courtyard's had rooms service, but of course they don't.  Also, the movies all were around $16 which was clearly ridiculous.
Manager Response: Dear Binaustin,  All of us here at the Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim at Disneyland Resort are delighted to learn that you were very pleased with your stay here.  We appreciate you taking the time to share how much you enjoyed our comfortable, quiet and well appointed accommodations.  Although, we are pleased that you had an overall impressive stay, it is a disappointment to hear that we missed our mark at consistently delivering superior service throughout your stay.  Please accept our apology and know that we have immediately addressed this with our staff.  Again,  thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review.  It would be a pleasure to welcome you back to California on your next visit!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Platinum Member likes this hotel except for one thing
Summary: Stayed at this hotel from Jan 20-28. The front desk staff was very professional. The maid service was excellent. The room was nice as well. The only thing that I did not like was the elevator. That elevator had to be the slowest one west of the Mississippi. Besides that, the area is great for business, family and weekend getaways.
Manager Response: Dear njdrum,  It's always a thrill for us to receive such positive feedback from a Marriott Rewards Member!  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with the details of your recent experience at our hotel.  Please know that we have followed up on your comment in regard to our elevator.  Your insight  assists us in our continuous efforts to monitor and improve our services.  We definitely have to agree with you; our area is great for business, family and weekend getaways!  It will be a great pleasure to have you as our loyal guest and we look forward to accommodating you again soon.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I was there for the Namm Show, the most important international Fair of Musical Instrument. Great Hotel, one of the best in Anaheim, near the Convention Centre (just few steps from the entrance) near Disneyland (if you have 1 or 2 days off)...so...what you needs more?
Manager Response: Dear Giorgio P,  We are ecstatic to be named the best accommodations in Anaheim!  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit for the Namm Show.  All of your gracious compliments are certainly appreciated by our entire staff.  We take pride in providing a quality experience for all of our guests and are thrilled to hear that's exactly what you enjoyed!  Again, thank you for taking the time to give us your valuable feedback.  We can't wait to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriot in Anaheim this past July 2012. Through research we found it to be the most reasonably priced hotel in the area. The rooms and common areas were exceptionally clean. The staff at all levels from desk to service were professional and friendly. The pool and sauna were a great treat as it was very hot when we were there and it is shaded nicely with trees. Disneyland is located about four blocks from the hotel If you want to walk or you can or take the free shuttle located in there affiliate hotel next door. The hotel did provide bar and dining services, but the cost is a set price. Arrange that service in a package deal when you book the reservation or you can buy daily, but its a little expensive. There are many restaurant very
Manager Response: Dear Randall F,  We appreciate you sharing with other travelers that, after thorough research, you found our Anaheim hotel to be the most reasonable priced hotel in the area.  Thank you for staying with us this past July.  Your great compliments on our exceptional customer service level have been shared with our staff and are greatly appreciated.  Our top priority is our guests, and we truly enjoy assisting in any way we can to ensure your comfort throughout your entire stay; it's the Marriott way.  Once again, thank you for your rating and review.  We look forward to having you as our loyal guest on your future visits to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at many hotels by Disneyland and I think this one is my new favorite.  Its close to Disneyland.  The rooms are very clean.  The hotel was very quiet.  I know most hotels in the area are used and abused due to the number of people they see.  This one looks brand new.  We got to the hotel late and left early to go to Disneyland so we did not use any of the amenities or eat at the hotel.  The only down side to this hotel is that they charge you for parking, but most of the hotels by Disneyland also charge for parking.
Manager Response: Dear BeckiandJames,  We are ecstatic to be your new favorite Anaheim hotel to stay at while visiting Disneyland!  Thank you for recognizing the brand new condition of our accommodations.  We are very pleased that you enjoy a clean, quiet and memorable stay with us.  Your compliments and review are greatly appreciated.  We will await your return!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, close to Disneyland
Summary: Hotel is very nice, recently renovated lobby, so when you get in it looks like a very expensive hotel. Clean and big rooms, best place to stay when traveling to Disneyland. You can walk to the park every day. Only problem we had was that breakfast was being served after 7 am, but there are other places where to have earlier breakfast.  Internet was free, slow  but OK.  Highly recommended for a family vacation.
Manager Response: Dear curaloco,  We are honored to be named the best place to stay when traveling to Disneyland!  Thank you for your wonderful review and compliments on our Anaheim hotel.  We are also very excited to receive your feedback on our recent renovations!  It's very nice to hear how impressed you were upon your arrival and throughout your stay.  Please visit again soon!  Kind Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: After staying at a similar property in San Francisco earlier in the week, we had high hopes for this Courtyard but it did not compare to its sister hotel. The check-in staff was not particularly helpful, making a point of telling us that they could not accomodate our request for a high floor away from the elevator, even though we had made our reservation months previous. Our room smelled of its previous occupants in an unpleasant way. Most disappointing was the service at the Bistro, which we had enjoyed in the San Francisco hotel. The staff was poorly trained and service was incredibly slow, in a location where getting out the door to the amusement park is especially important. My daughter even was served an apple that was rotten to the core. The Kids Suite was a nice idea with
Manager Response: Dear Alissa G,  We are greatly disappointed to hear that your stay was less than impressive.  We apologize for the inconvenience of not being able to fulfill your request for a high floor away from the elevator. Your patience and understanding is greatly appreciated.  Thank you for bringing to our attention the details of the service and fruit you received at The Bistro, as this is not the typical experience at our restaurant.  We have immediately followed up on your comments to ensure that this remains an isolated incident.  Thank you for your review.  It is our hope that you will decide to give us the opportunity in the near future to exceed your expectations.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manger

Summary: I stay in Anaheim a few times a year at various hotels and had stayed here before with mixed experiences.  Was very impressed at the upgrades to the staff and facility this visit.  A positive attitude seems common with all the staff now.  The maids even said hello to me and smiled.  Am planning on staying here on all my trips to Anaheim from now on.
Manager Response: Dear KfromCal,  We are very happy that you decided to return to our property on your recent visit to Anaheim.  It is very exciting to hear how impressed you were with our recent renovations and exceptional customer service.  Your recognition of our efforts has been shared with our staff and is greatly appreciated.  Thank you for your continued patronage.  We are thrilled that you will be staying with us on all of your trips to the Anaheim area!  Happy New Year! Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel for the price. Friendly and helpful staff, fast check in. The rooms were clean, great location close to Knotts Berry Farm. Breakfast buffet was a nice touch to our busy schedule. We will definately stay here again when we visit Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear JeFoMax,  Thank you for your 5 star rating of your recent experience at our Anaheim hotel!  We appreciate your recognition of our fast, efficient and friendly service.  Our staff realizes our guests have busy schedules with a lot to get accomplished and need to be taken care of accordingly.  It is wonderful to hear that you and your family will definitely be staying with us again on your next visit to Anaheim!  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I stayed for a week at the Courtyard and I will return there as soon as I'm back in Anaheim, the staf was very friendlly and the location its ideal to vist The Block, Disney theme parks and Knotts Berry Farm almost from walking distances! Breakfast buffet is awesome, its such a pitty the redeveloped restaurant opened the day after we left the hotel...
Manager Response: Dear Kennstdu,  Thank you for your week long stay with us and your 5 star rating on your experience!  We are pleased that our location was so convenient to all the Anaheim attractions you visited and that you enjoyed our friendly guest service.  We hope your travels bring you back soon to enjoy our completed lobby and restaurant renovations.  Again, thank you for your fantastic review on our Anaheim hotel!  See you soon! Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: A very nice hotel for the price we paid.  Clean rooms, friendly staff, plus we were even surprised by having access to a free continental breakfast each day which we did not know about until we checked in (supposedly due to the newly renovated lobby/restaurant area?).  Also free was wi-fi, very nice!  Check in was quick and easy and the staff member was very friendly and accommodating.  We used the ART bus shuttle to go to and from the Disneyland Resort and the stop was a short walk from the hotel (the stop is in front of the Courtyard Marriott, which is right next door to this hotel).  You could probably even walk to the resort from this hotel, but our dogs were barking so we chose the shuttle.  For the reasonable price we paid, you can not go wrong at this location.
Manager Response: Dear PHXSports,  Thank you for taking advantage of our great rates and sharing the details of your enjoyable experience with us.  It was our pleasure to surprise you with a complimentary continental breakfast to celebrate the completion of our lobby and restaurant renovations!  Although it is an easy walk to the Disneyland parks, the Anaheim Resort Transit shuttle certainly does offer a convenient alternative that requires an even shorter walk over to the Anaheim Marriott Hotel for pick up and drop off.  Thank you for sharing that you enjoyed our reasonable rates, friendly service and clean accommodations.  Come back and see us again on your next visit to California!  Best Regard, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Will be great when lobby is done
Summary: Rooms are nicely remodeled and very clean.  The lobby is currently in the middle of being remodeled and will be very nice when completed. Love the new look that Marriott is giving the Courtyard brand.  Front desk was efficient and helpful.  Special request for feather-free room had been arranged before our arrival.  At other hotels this request is ignored until we arrive at the room and have to call for housekeeping to change our bedding. This hotel is set back from Harbor Blvd. so it's much quieter than some of the others in the Disney area.  We walked to and from Disneyland, and although it was a long walk, it was manageable.  They also offer transportation to Disney if you do not want to walk.  There are also dozens of restaurants in the area within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Rollingvacationer,  We are so very happy to inform you that our lobby renovations are now complete!  The final renovation phase of our bistro, Panini Grill and Bar, will be completed this weekend.  It was our pleasure to fulfill your request for a feather-free room and have it ready for you upon your arrival.  We enjoy taking care of our guests and ensuring that their experience is comfortable and enjoyable. Thank you for your wonderful review!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I have been staying out here for the last couple weeks for work and this Marriott is a great place to stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other people. The desk staff was friendly and my room was real nice.
Manager Response: Dear gastonglock22,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel during your recent business visit to our area.  We greatly appreciate you sharing that our Marriott property is a great place to stay and that you would definitely recommend our hotel to other travelers.  Thank you for complimenting our nice and comfortable accommodations, as well as our friendly staff.  We do hope that your travels bring you back to see us again soon!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: It took me a while to reserve this hotel because i wanted the best for my famiy. I've never been to this hotel before but the outside and the photos looked great, and it inspired me to get it. my fault i didnt read the reviews and comments were made from other people and i had to experienced it on my own with my fam. at first i thought it was too expensive just for a night, so i had to look around, a month after i checked again and this time the hotel was on sale, a lil cheaper than usual. so finally i thought to myself, why not, new hotel, looks great and rooms looks so good... expensive but i somewhow reserved it because its attractive. so when we arrived there, not only they said it was a walking distance to disneyland, it was still far. they even charged you 14% parking per
Manager Response: Dear Anne C,  Thank you for giving us your opinions and suggestions by completing the review on our property.  We apologize that we failed to deliver an impressive experience.  Please know that our fees are listed on our website and reviewed again during booking process online or with a reservation agent.  Parking is $14/night and charges for movie selections vary and are listed prior to purchase.  Although, we are within walking distance to the Disneyland parks, the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle operated by the City of Anaheim has pickup locations nearby. A $5 per person/per day ticket allows unlimited round trip transportation to the nearby attractions.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience that occurred and hope you will reconsider giving us the opportunity to deliver an enjoyable stay.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Despite the construction, which should be finished soon, we had a good stay at this hotel. Desk staff was VERY friendly & accomodating, letting us check our luggage early AM.  They offered to give us a room early, but I had requested the top floor (4th) & was happy to have that guaranteed for later. The later check-in was very smooth & we arrived at the room just in time for the Disney fireworks. The window (remember, top floor) gave us a direct view of the fireworks, which was a special end to our Disney day. Yes, the walk is a bit long, but not a problem even after the long day.  There's always the bus down Harbor Blvd if you choose to ride.
Manager Response: Dear LindaEncinitas,  You are correct; our lobby renovations are now complete!  We are extremely excited about our brand new transformations including our sophisticated front desk pods, home theater, business center and library!  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We appreciate you taking the time to share the details of your enjoyable and comfortable stay with us. Thank you for mentioning that our staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We are very happy that you and your family enjoyed watching the Disney firework show from the comfort of your room.  That is always a big bonus, especially for our younger guests!  Thank you for your rating and review on our Anaheim hotel.  We hope you will be back to see  and enjoy all of our amazing, new transformations!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed in October and the lobby and restaurant area was under construction so everything was a mess. It was very noisy during the day but fortunately we were away at Disneyland. Even though I booked through the Marriott site they did not inform me about the construction. The front desk personnel stated that since they didn't know when the construction would start they couldn't tell any guests! What a poor, unbelievable excuse.  Upon arrival, I was told that I could not cancel without forfeiting my one nights deposit. And then they have the gall to charge $14 to park in an asphalt parking lot! (During our visit to LA our previous hotel was the Loews Hollywood Hotel, where covered self-parking was only $10/ day.) There was no effort to compensate the hotel guests for the
Manager Response: Dear dcharlesb,  We apologize that we missed our mark in delivering an impressive stay.   Also, we are sorry for any inconvenience you experienced due to our renovations.  Your patience and understanding is greatly appreciated.  We are very excited that our lobby transformation has been completed and that our restaurant renovations will be completed in less than a week!   It is disappointing to hear that our pillows, beds and toiletries did not fit your preference, however, we appreciate you giving us your opinions and suggestions. Also, please know that we did post information in regard to our renovations on the homepage of our websites.  Please accept our apologies for failing to inform you of what to expect.  If there is anything further you would like to discuss with me, personally, please contact me at your earliest convenience directly at our Anaheim hotel.  Thank you for your time in completing the review.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: don't visit until they finish construction!!
Summary: no signage, can't find the entrance doors, some doors are locked without signs, elevators  crazy slow,  I was on the second floor...take the stairs you say?  LOL  I tried and found other guests experienced the same thing, once i exited stairs I found myself in a locked parking lot.  SIGNS PEOPLE  PUT UP SOME DECENT SIGNS the checkin was a closet, seriously a tiny room.  they had a "restaurant" that was just a tiny room with tables...and they locked the outside entrance to it, you had to walk around to get inside.   nice people but very disappointing marriott stay.  our friends were awakened by maid service at 8 am....seriously, who wants their room cleaned at 8 am?  once you are awakened, its kind of hard to get back to sleep, right?   we were charged for the $4 bottle of water
Manager Response: Dear HappyMDCamper,  We are very happy to inform you that our lobby renovations are now completely finished! Thank you very much for your patience and understanding.  We apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced due to our restaurant renovations.  Our brand new restaurant will be completed during the first week of December and we are very excited about all that it will offer our guests.  Also, please know that we do provide privacy door hangers in each room that may be placed on the outside of your door to alert our housekeeping staff.  We appreciate your review and hope your business travels bring you back to enjoy our hotel and all of our completed renovations.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Because we were attending a professional show at the Anaheim Convention Center we assumed that this Marriot would be up to the standards of hotels in the area.  Not so.  First, the street signage made it almost impossible to locate.  Next, there was construction on the hotel which was very unwelcoming. They even blocked off two parking places near the entrance when only one was needed to get in a side door to register. Although the check in area seemed to be a linen closet, the attendants were friendly and helpful.  The "bar" was so minimal they could not make a simple martini.  Complimentary water disappeared after day one and was not replaced. We were told $4.00 bottles were available.  Not exactly a "magical experience" next door to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear SMS11-2,  We apologize for the inconveniences mentioned in your review.  Your patience and understanding during our renovations are greatly appreciated.  We are also sorry that our construction fails to be the warm welcome you should expect from a Marriott property.  Please know that the construction crew blocked two spaces in our parking lot in order to ensure the safety of our guests around their work area.  We are thrilled to inform you that our transformations are almost complete and are certain that you will be pleased with the results!  Thank you for your valuable feedback.  If there is anything further you would like to discuss, please contact me directly at the hotel at your earliest convenience.  It would be our great pleasure to have the opportunity to deliver the magical experience you deserve on your next visit to our area.  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Original construction is the real downer.
Summary: I, too, stayed here while the lobby is under renovation. It makes for an interesting arrival experience, but the staff members I encountered were great.  My room was on the third floor at one of the ends of the halls, so even if I had not been up and at the convention center before daily work began I doubt I would have heard anything.  The biggest disappointment about this hotel is the cheap construction. It is "stick" built, so it is like being in a large four level house. My first morning I heard people talking in the room next door, then the non-stop crying of a toddler. Many times I was privy to the heavy stepping people in the room above me. It was like being in a cheap apartment where your upstairs neighbors constantly create irritations simply from walking.  Other aspects
Manager Response: Dear Aaron L,  Thank you for your patience and understanding during our lobby and restaurant renovation process.  Fortunately, our construction is days away from being completed.  We are sorry to hear that we missed our mark in delivering an overall impressive stay, and apologize for any noise disturbance you heard from other guests.  Your valued opinions and suggestions are greatly appreciated.  We hope you will keep in mind our comfortable accommodations, outstanding location and exceptional customer service on your next visit to our area.  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review on our property.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I had no idea the hotel was under construction.  When I entered the make-shift lobby the pounding and sounds were so loud I instantly got a migraine.  I directly went to the make-shift restaurant and called Marriott to cancel my reservation.  I am sure this hotel will be lovely once the construction is complete.  Until the, I will be staying elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear kellyhouston,  We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced due to our renovations.  Please know that our transformations are due to be completed within the next two weeks.  We are disappointed that we did not have the pleasure of accommodating you, and hope that you will decide to give us that opportunity on your return visit to Anaheim.  Again, please accept our apologies.  Thank you for your valued feedback.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Had an initial problem with a noisy neighbour and very poor interconnecting doors. After a move to another room everything was great  Building works are ongoing but didn't really bother us. Had breakfast at hotel and always plenty of room in temporary restaurant   Richard was very friendly and helpful when he served us drinks/food in temporary bar area in the evenings  Would be 'Excellent' if not for the poor acoustics between rooms
Manager Response: Dear iancarpy,  We are very happy that your stay was enjoyable!  It was our pleasure to relocate you into another room.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity, while you were staying with us, to ensure your comfort by informing us of the noisy neighboring guest.  We apologize for this inconvenience.  Your review has been shared with our staff and your comments on the great service you received are greatly appreciated!  We are also pleased that the renovations taking place in our lobby and restaurant did not bother you and your family. Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel.  We hope to welcome you back to the U.S. on your next visit.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: It was ALL about the bunkbeds!
Summary: We were looking for a hotel close to disney that had a suite. My 6-year old daughter has always wanted a bunkbed (which she isn't getting) and was totally thrilled to sleep in one for a couple of nights. There was a french door between the kids side and the adult side that made it convenient for us to stay up while the kids we to bed. The room was tidy and modern, though smaller than I had expected. Not a big deal.  The biggest negative was that the hotel is very noisy. The construction noise didn't really bother us but the noise from the people in the rooms on either side and in the hallway was really loud. People are super excited to go to Disney early in the morning and return late at night and we heard ALL of it! We subsequently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and it was so
Manager Response: Dear Switzercat,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel during your recent visit to the U.S.  We are thrilled to hear that your daughter loved the bunk beds in our Kids Suite!  Thank you for sharing with other travelers how tidy, modern and convenient our Kids Suites truly are.  You're right; it is great that parents have the option of staying up in one room while the kids go to bed in the other.  We do apologize for the noise and excitement from other guests.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  Our entire team hopes that you and your family will decide to stay with us again on your next visit to our area.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I wish I would have been informed that the hotel was under renovation before we booked the rooms.  I was traveling alone with a 4 year old and a 17 month old and it was a huge hassle trying to get around in there make-shift lobby, restaurant, and other parts.  Parking was a hassle because there were not enough places close to the front so I had to park in Timbuktu to find a place and lug in all our belongings and stroller.  There was no one able to help me get m things up to my room so a very nice stranger helped me.  I thought there would be a microwave in our room but there wasnt.  I had to hear up things in a little microwave in the lobby.  The jack hammer noise made it impossible to try to get some rest during the day.  I used the laundry facilities to wash some clothes and
Manager Response: Dear maryann w,  We are sincerely sorry for the inconveniences you faced during your recent stay with us.  Thank you for your patience and understanding during our renovations.  Our lobby and restaurant transformations are due to be completed in just a few weeks.  We appreciate you bringing the details of your stay to our attention.  It is disappointing to hear that we failed to impress you, a loyal Marriott patron.  It is our hope that you will give us the opportunity to regain your confidence in Marriott properties.  We would greatly appreciate the pleasure of having you as our guest again to deliver an enjoyable stay by exceeding your expectations.  Again, please accept our apologies. Thank you for your valued feedback.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Under Renovations so guessing you can get a good deal
Summary: Pricelined this hotel and was very happy with our one night stay.  (65/night-SUnday) The hotel's lobby and restaurant was being renovated which is why i think i was able to get a good rate.    **Regarding the renovation: For us, we will take advantage of any good deal we can get that doesn't effect our opinion on the stay.  Yes, there was a makeshift lobby and restaurant but we don't really care about that.  I personally don't need a grand hotel lobby to "make" my experience nor do i care that much about the restaurant when we were going to be at Disney the whole day and saving a few bucks on the hotel is always appreciated esp when we felt like the savings had no effect on the room, pool and our overall stay.  We experienced No Noise or issues related to the renovations.  It
Manager Response: Dear nickiwms,  It's wonderful to learn that you were very happy with your experience with us.  We're pleased that you took advantage of our affordable rates and chose to stay at our Anaheim hotel.  Thank you for sharing how comfortable you were in our accommodations and that you enjoyed our toiletries, as well as other amenities.  Your recommendation of our property is greatly appreciated.
