We are excited that you would definitely stay with us again and will look forward to having you and your family as our guests again soon!  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place, close to convention center and Disney.
Summary: Though the front lobby was under construction while I was there, the hotel was clean, quiet and a 5 minute walk (max) to the Anaheim Convention center. While the fitness center is really small, the Marriott across the parking lot has a huge gym, which Courtyard guests are allowed to use. They even have towels on ice there! The pool area is nice, gets WIFI signal, and the beds were clean and comfy. I was there for seven days for work, and didn't mind it much. The room was plenty big for me to spread out my clothes, get some work done, etc. The only thing I wish the room had had was a microwave to go with the mini fridge. The staff were friendly and very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Nicole G,  We appreciate your valuable time in sharing the details of your clean, quite and comfortable stay with us.  Thank you for mentioning our very close proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center, great WiFi signal throughout our hotel and comfy beds.  We are pleased that our spacious rooms allowed you to spread out your clothes and get some work done.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your seven day business trip to Anaheim.  We will look forward to the pleasure of having you as our guest again in the near future.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Stayed here in a family suite during our trip to Disneyland.  I had read mixed results on line and was pleasantly surprised on my visit.  A big negative, and its temporary, is the renovation under way which has moved the registration desk and restaurant.  I am sure this will be nice when done.  No doubt the elevators, two of them, are slow and small.    Staff was very helpful and friendly.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Gubulldogfan,  We are delighted to hear that you were pleasantly surprised on your stay with us!  Thank you for mentioning that our renovations are definitely temporary.  Completion date is in just a few weeks!  We appreciate your great comments on our helpful and friendly staff, as well as our nice property.  We're happy that you would stay again and hope it will be soon!  Thank you for your review.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We booked the hotel based on the photographs in the picture and the pictures of the family suite with bunkbeds.  Price seemed quite reasonable for what it appeared we would get.  When we arrived, hotel was under construction with a makeshift entrance, makeshift lobby and makeshift "dining room".  The lobby staff was VERY friendly and helpful and provided great information at check in.  We were also happy to be able to check in early.  That is the end of the good stuff.  The elevator was extremely slow to arrive (for the entire stay) - it's only a 4-story hotel, so a 2-3 minute wait every time you use the elevator is a bit annoying.  We opened our room and it smelled bad, but we decided to open the window (2 inches is what it allowed) and turned on the air - it seemed to help,
Manager Response: Dear BTfromAZ,  Thank you for your extensive details on your recent experience with us.  We are extremely sorry that we fell short of delivering an impressive stay.  We strive to deliver a superior experience along with exceptional customer service.  Your insight assists us in achieving these goals. Thank you for your patience and understanding during our renovations.  Again, we apologize for the inconveniences that occurred during your stay, and appreciate all of your very valuable feedback.  It is our hope that you will decide to give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel 6 odd months ago, we arrived late at night after being held up all day at Washington DC airport, so possibly not in the best of moods.  We arrived and the front desk sign is being held up with masking tape and the sign outside says "You don't need to wear a hard hat upon entering", we look at each other and think it is a joke.  No it isn't.  The whole of the down stairs section is under construction, dust everywhere.  Now we understand that hotels need to update, however why not contact us and let us know and give us the option of possibly going else where?  We walk to the front desk and there is a guy there yelling his head off how unhappy he was.  It was 11.30pm and we had been up since 3.30am and had had enough.  We said to the two ladies how come we were
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had had a long day flying from Washington DC to Anaheim and had a 7 hour delay inbetween stuck at the airport, we arrived after picking up the rental car at 11.30pm and could not believe that the sign saying Service Desk here was stuck on the wall with masking tape, there is another sign outside saying "you do not need a hard hat to enter", we go in and there is another customer at the front desk screaming his head off and saying he wants his money back.  We are all over tired and look around and there is dust everywhere and construction all over the place, the place looks horrible.  We say to the front desk people what is going on here.  They say "it is written all over our website that we are under construction" - as if we are idiots for not knowing.  I said "we booked and
Manager Response: Dear LissyLou255100,  We are sincerely sorry for the inconvenience you experienced due to our on-site renovations.  Thank you and your family for your patience and understanding.  Our lobby and restaurant renovations will be completed in the next few weeks and we are excited about the amazing transformations that will add a great deal to our guests' experiences with us.  Thank you for sharing the details of your stay by completing the review on our hotel.  We certainly do hope that we will have the pleasure of accommodating you and your family on your next visit to the U.S.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: advertised newest but turn up and under renovation
Summary: we booked 2 rooms in june 2012 for our oct holiday we searched the web and saw a picture and review that this resort was the newest , when we arrived i was met by 2 un helpful female working in  a makeshift entrance, i enquired that they advertise they are the newest and she commented they are, so why the renovation, no lobby and no resturant, all of a sudden our final 5 days of a 32 day usa holiday which there had been no hickups was now going to finish in a dusty old motel with no resturant
Manager Response: Dear davtom,  We apologize for any inconveniences that you experienced due to our renovations.  Our lobby and restaurant renovations are undergoing an amazing transformation that will soon be completed by mid November.  Thank you very much for your patience and understanding during this process as we make these necessary changes to enhance each guest experience with us.  Once again, we are sorry that your stay fell short of impressive.  We do hope you will decide to return and give us the opportunity to deliver an overall enjoyable and comfortable stay.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disneyland, large rooms and ok breakfast
Summary: We stayed here to visit Disneyland and even if it was a bit of a stretch for a 7-year-old, we walked back and forth to the hotel.   The room was large and with a nice enough kitchen. The room was a bit dark, being on the bottom floor and with a parking lot view. But we were not that much in the room, so we did not care that much. It was clean and comfortable.  We did not cook, but every evening someone had barbeque in the garden. It looked nice but we ate at the mall just a block away. Lots of stores were closed but there were still a handful of restaurants within a wide price range.  The pool area was rather small but clean and with enough sun chairs.  Definitely an option, given we would return.
Manager Response: Dear Hoppetossan,  We appreciate you making us your choice in Anaheim accommodations on your recent visit to our area.  Thank you for complimenting us on our clean and comfortable accommodations.  We are very pleased that you and your family enjoyed your stay and our convenient location.  There is quite a wide selection of shops and restaurants within walking distance from our hotel, which makes it easy for everyone to find something to their liking.  Thank you for your great review.  Come back and visit us again soon!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This spot was really perfect for us to stay at near Disneyland. It's in walking distance, and you can catch a shuttle to Disneyland through the parking lot at the Marriott Hotel, about a 2 minute walk. The hotel was clean (almost nauseatingly so), the staff was helpful and friendly, and the rooms were well appointed (for a lower end hotel). The downside was that the room was incredibly noisy (room 250) as it was above the laundry room. We kept our air conditioner on tho, and couldn't hear the noise. The pool was perfect and the hot tub was HUGE! There was even a little shallow pool just for little ones. We had breakfast there and it was pretty good. I'd definitely stay there again, just for the hot tub and pool! It was a great place to relax in between Disney-mania.
Manager Response: Dear darcywal,  We are thrilled to be your perfect spot in Anaheim accommodations while visiting Disneyland!  Thank you for pointing out how clean our entire hotel is and that our staff is helpful and friendly.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed our pool area and large hot tub.  We hope you and your family will return soon to enjoy more of all that we have to offer!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I booked a room here through Southwest vacations and got a great rate when combined with my flight and a rental car. The hotel is close to Disneyland - but might be hard to walk back after a full day of walking around Disney. They do have the ANT shuttle nearby for $4 roundtrip per person. The hotel was clean and comfortable. There were a few things that our housekeeper forgot like emptying the water out of the ice bucket each day, but other than that, she did a great job.   There are many good restaurants and shops nearby, so I recommend that guests do some internet research before you go. There are many better options than the overpriced Ruth Chris restaurant that is by the hotel. Speaking of that, parking was tough on weekend nights, as Ruth Chris and the hotel share a
Manager Response: Dear Nicole P,  We appreciate you taking the time to share the details of your stay with us and other travelers.  Thank you for mentioning our clean and comfortable accommodations, affordable rates and great location.  We are located very close to Disneyland, as well as a wide variety of good restaurants and shops.  Also, thank you for your traveling tip; we are certain that other travelers will appreciate your advice to get a head start on choosing their dining and shopping preferences.  We hope that you will be back again soon to enjoy more of all that we have to offer!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Really close to Disney, Great Price
Summary: Checked in on Sunday night for a 2 night stay, Asked for a High Floor when making Reservations and when we checked in they gave us the Handicapped room witch we weren't happy about but we were Tired and hungry and just want to eat and go to bed, Went to the cheesecake factory down the road. When we got back a was getting ready for bed you could hear the Fireworks going off at DisneyLand since this Hotel is right across the street from Disney. The Lobby is really nice and Staff was freindly on Monday compared to Sunday night. Most of the Marriotts that I stay at usally offers free breakfast but not this one. They other thing they charge to park in there parking lot, most of the hotels in the Area don't charge for that. Other than a few things this was a really nice hotel, but not
Manager Response: Dear Darrin K,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your 2 night visit in Anaheim.  We apologize that in order to fulfill your request for a higher room, we had to check you into a room with handicapped accessibility.  Your preferences and comfort are very important to us; however, there are those unfortunate occasions that our options are limited when we are operating at full capacity.  We appreciate your patience and understanding.  Also, please know that the majority of brand hotels in our area charge a parking fee.  You will find the properties that do not will, most definitely, have higher accommodation rates.  We are happy that you enjoyed a nice experience at our hotel, as well as our close proximity to Disneyland.  It is our hope that you will keep in mind the quality stay at affordable rates and decide to stay with us again on your next visit to our area.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We arrived early so they stored our luggage and we headed to the park. We arrived back at the hotel at 10:30PM and were told there were no more rooms. We loaded all our belongings back into the car and stayed at the Sheraton right down the road. It was definitely a hassle but our room was paid for that night so we didn’t complain.  The next morning we were finally able to check in at the Courtyard and moved all or our stuff into the room. We arrived back from the park that night to a room full of ants. We were told there were no rooms to move us to but they did send somebody down to wipe down all the ants. The room was nice other than the ants.  We came back to the room one day to swim and rest a little. When we tried to order a pizza we were told that food isn’t available
Manager Response: Dear Michael M  We apologize for any hassle or inconvenience that was caused.  You are correct; unfortunately, if you booked through a third party Marriott points cannot be awarded.  Please contact our hotel directly so that we can review your reservation details and clear up any miscommunication with the Marriott Rewards Center.  It would be our pleasure to assist you with this and get your Marriott points awarded to you as soon as possible.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  We appreciate you bringing this matter to our attention and look forward to resolving this situation with the Marriott Rewards Center.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: OK for the price and location.
Summary: We (wife, 16 year old son and myself) stayed here for 4 nights in mid-July. The location is fairly close to Disneyland but I'm not sure I would really want to make the mile walk after a day at the park (and you do pay for parking $14 plus tax) at the motel.  The rooms were fine, clean and big enough for this type of Courtyard. The pool was nice and large. The maids were all very friendly (unlike the front desk personnel- they mostly seemed disiniterested). Some other issues were- I had requested an early check-in (2 hours) and a top floor room and got neither, the mini frig was not working when we checked in and after two calls to the front desk my son and I moved the frig and cabinet to discover it was just unplugged- never did get a response from the front desk and on the
Manager Response: Dear John B,  We are very sorry to hear of the challenges you experienced during your stay. Please accept our apologies for the unacceptable level of service you received, and be assured that this is not the standard practice of our hotel.  Thank you for bringing these details to our attention, as we have immediately taken the necessary corrective actions to ensure that this does not happen again.  Also, we apologize that we were not able to fulfill your request in regard to the location of your room. When we are operating at full capacity, we do our best to satisfy our guests' preferences; however, unfortunately, this is not always possible. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed our accommodations and that you would stay with us again.  Our staff looks forward to delivering a memorable stay along with the top notch customer service that you deserve.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We were supposed to stay at HomeWood Suites but decided to stay here since we had marriott gift cards that we thought we could use toward the restaraunts. We were wrong. The restaraunts here aren't apart of the Marriott corporation and we were told we could use them next door at that Marriott hotel's restaraunts. Okay didn't make sense but anyhow we did and would have liked to have stayed over there. This place looks nice but just an uncomfortable stay for families. The feel here is more for the business crowd. The kids really enjoyed the kids suite with the bunkbeds and there own little seperate living area. The room was spacious but yes a little dirty like other guests have mentioned. I didn't want to use the coffee maker at first it was so dusty but I washed it and it was
Manager Response: Dear ronniegirl55,  Please accept our apologies for any inconveniences that occurred during your stay.  The details you mentioned in regard to the housekeeping service you received are unacceptable.  We have taken immediately action to further investigate this error to ensure that this does not reoccur.  Also, please be assured that our property is inspected for any type of pest by a third party company on a regular basis. Their reports confirm that we are, and have consistently been, free and clear of any pest, including bed bugs.  We are very sorry to learn of your unfortunate circumstances and hope that you and your daughter are well.  Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This is closer to the Convention Center than maps make it appear. There is a back way through the other hotel parking lots. The breakfast at the restaurant was one of the best hotel restaurants I've been to. There is a laundry area, but it does get locked at 10 pm. The rooms are clean and in good shape. As with other hotels in the area, be prepared to pay for parking as well. This location is also next door to the Ruth's Chris Steakhouse which is outstanding.
Manager Response: Dear dhensley,  Thank you for your fantastic review on our Anaheim hotel!  We are thrilled to receive your compliments on our accommodations, location and restaurant.  It's very exciting to hear that our restaurant is one of the best hotel restaurants you have ever been to!  Our chef takes great pride in preparing each and every meal that is served, and appreciates the on-going positive rave he receives.  Thank you for also mentioning that we are closer to certain local attractions than the online maps make it appear.  Again, thank you for staying with us and posting your review.  We hope to see you on your next visit to California!  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We were here for our Disneyland vacation with our kids (3 and 5).  The room's couch was ripped and wasn't attended to after we notified the front desk.  The curtains in the room don't close all they way and since the room was right by the pool, people can see into the room.  The front desk staff was alright.  It was obvious the room was not dusted, there was a layer of dust on the shelf that is in the closet; so either the room hasn't been occupy in a while or it was just not thoroughly cleaned,  We have stayed at this hotel a couple years ago and the quality of this hotel has gone down over time.
Manager Response: Dear azcat00,  Thank you for choosing to return to our hotel for your family Disneyland vacation.  It is very disappointing to hear that you encountered inconveniences that we failed to immediately resolve.  Please accept our apologies and know that theses details have been reviewed and addressed with our entire staff.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention so that we are able to take immediate action to resolve these issues, as well as further investigate the details to ensure this does not happen again.  We appreciate your patronage and hope that you and your family decide to give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  It would be our pleasure to deliver the enjoyable and memorable experience that brought you back to stay with us.  Thank you for your review.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Hotel's management is on the ball and makes this hotel a great stay.  The hotel is clean, up-to-date and exceeds expectations.  Management and Staff:  Reservations, the desk staff, and housekeeping especially went out of their way to make our 6 day stay in Anaheim an excellent one.  We had a great experience.    Location:  The hotel is steps away from the Anaheim convention center.  Our walk was about the length of a long city block but we didn't have to cross any streets.  It was convenient and pleasant.      Pool:  The hotel has a nice pool that looked inviting but we didn't have time to try it out! There was also a baby pool and a hot tub.  Parking:  Parking is $14/day at the hotel plus $2 tax -- so around $16/day.  This is reasonable for the area and I just figured it in as
Manager Response: Dear LaVida,  It is our pleasure and our commitment to be on the ball to ensure that you enjoy the best experience while exceeding your expectations.  We are thrilled to hear that we succeeded in delivering an enjoyable stay!  Thank you for all of the wonderful compliments on our customer service, rooms, amenities and parking.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed our sparkling clean and spacious accommodations upon your arrival, as well as each evening when you returned to your room.  Your excellent review is appreciated by our entire team, and your traveling tips are sure to come in handy to fellow travelers.  Again, thank you for detailing all of the wonderful aspects to your experience with us.  We hope you will visit us again on your next trip to California.  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: OK for Disney or Convention visit
Summary: Stayed four nights in June for a convention at the nearby Anaheim CC and was pleased with the room and service.  Although I didn't eat at the location, it seemed to have limited restaurant service and I don't recall room service being available but with so much food available elsewhere it wasn't a problem.  Enjoyed the whirlpool after a long day on my feet. Within walking distance to CC and to Disney I believe.  I did have some trouble with splitting the bill with a work colleague however. We told the staff we were splitting but they couldn't give us a printout for all the days in both our names. Claimed we should have warned them, but actually we did.  For the price I thought this Courtyard was not as nice as others I've stayed in.
Manager Response: Dear dmohr14805,  We apologize about the miscommunication in regard to the printout of your bill and for the unacceptable level of service your received during your check out process.  We appreciate you bringing this to our attention so that we may ensure this doesn't happen again.  If you should need further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me directly at the hotel.  It's great that you enjoyed our location, as well as our spa after a long day at the Anaheim Convention Center.   We thank you for completing the review.   It is our hope that you will decide to stay with us again on your next visit to California.  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: A place I will never set foot in again!
Summary: I had a reservation for a 2 night stay and at the time of checking they told me they were at capacity. Further, this was a reservation I scheduled 1 month prior and I also had in hand a gift certificate issued by the general manager for a 2 night stay having gone through a similar experience. Poor service from top-down. I will NEVER set foot in another Marriott!
Manager Response: Dear Expertreviewer951,  We apologize for any misunderstanding or inconvenience that occurred during your booking process and at our hotel.  Although you had a gift certificate, reservations must be made by calling our hotel directly to let us know you have a certificate you would like to redeem.  It would have been our pleasure to go over the details on the certificate with you over the phone.  We are very sorry that you were unable to use the certificate at that time.  Again, please accept our apologies.  We appreciate your understanding and hope that you will decide to give us the pleasure of having you and your family as our guests in the future.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Very clean and convenient to convention center
Summary: Stayed here Oct 2011, usually stay at the Anaheim Marriott but the Courtyard was half the price. The hotel is very clean, staff was super friendly and very accommodating. There was a lit path that went to the Marriott's parking lot for easy access to the Convention Center. The room was great, had a large bathroom, mini fridge, desk, table and sofa. For the price and location this place was the best.
Manager Response: Dear MichaelP99,  Wow! We appreciate your excellent review and ratings!  Thank you for deciding to take advantage of our affordable rates and stay with us.   We appreciate your time in complimenting us on our super friendly and accommodating staff, spacious and comfortable rooms and convenient location.  We are very excited to hear our place is the best!  Thank you of your review.  We will await your return!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Clean room & nice location free wi-fi.  Verey close to disney parks by using marriot bus
Manager Response: Dear Q8iy,  It's great to hear that you enjoyed our clean accommodations, prime location and complimentary wi-fi.  We are, indeed, located very close to all of the Disney excitement! We're pleased that the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) shuttle was convenient for you to take advantage of.  Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us.  We hope you will be back to see us again on your next visit to the U.S.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean and friendly hotel in Disneyland area
Summary: Nice clean hotel. Checked in early and gave us a temporary king room then moved us to double queen. Nice and roomy. Bathroom was nice with granite bench top and shower/bath combo. Air con was a bit loud so we didn't really use it during the night. Friendly staff at front desk and restaurant staff always heated my baby milk whenever I asked. About a 20 min walk to Disneyland. Can be a bit much in the hot sun. We caught the bus from out front of the Marriott which is a 5 min walk from the courtyard.
Manager Response: Dear TiarePrincess,  It was our pleasure to accommodate an early check in, then move you to your preferred room type.  Thank you for your great compliments on our comfortable and spacious rooms, as well as our friendly staff.  We're glad to be of help when it came to heating your baby's bottles. Please keep in mind for your next visit that we are happy to assist you in any way we can to ensure that you and your family are enjoying your experience.  Thank you for your review.  We hope to see you again soon.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I've stayed here on two occasions in the last year. The property is newer than most in the surrounding area which appeals to me, I tend to book newer hotels when I can. What you get staying here is a clean yet small room. I have always found the staff to be friendly and courteous. It is very convenient to DL and DCA definitely within walking distance although they do charge a nightly parking fee of $10, I believe (if you have an annual pass with parking this can be annoying since you can stay somewhere a mile further away and park for free and park at the park for free as well). Like most Courtyard Marriott there are no real perks for being an Elite member which is a downside for me. As well as no free breakfast. One funny thing at check in this last time they mentioned that as
Manager Response: Dear Anneisfashion,  We do appreciate your continued patronage to Marriott brand properties, including our Anaheim hotel.  Thank you for your compliments on our friendly and courteous staff, as well as our convenient location.  It's always exciting for our guests to be within walking distance to all of the Anaheim attractions.  We also appreciate your suggestions in regard to our small token of appreciation to our Elite members.  It is never our intention to make our guests feel anything but comfortable and welcomed.  Your comments will be taken into serious consideration.  Thank you for recommending our property as a good spot for a Disneyland trip.  We hope you and your family will be back to stay with us again soon.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Courtyard usually isn't my first choice, simply because I get tired of the food selection. And sometimes, living out of a suitcase, the only food you get is when you're at a hotel. However, if you're on business or pleasure, this Courtyard, in Anaheim, is the way to go. The front desk staff are extremely friendly and accomodating. And, the bar is well-situated, (inside, between the area that opens to the outdoors and a warm, inviting fireplace). I met a friend there who was so impressed by the surroundings that he wanted to meet there again, the next time I was in town (instead of going out to eat at a "nicer" restaurant). I'm certain this was because Vicki, at the bar, became a part of our fun conversations, the ambience was soothing, and the pizza was tastey and light. Also,
Manager Response: Dear BuzeeBee,  We are honored by your title of A Cut Above Most Courtyards!  It is also very exciting to receive an outstanding, detailed review and rating from such an avid traveler as yourself.   We would have to agree with you; whether on business or pleasure travel, the Courtyard Anaheim at Disneyland Resort is definitely the way to go!  It is our sincere pleasure to deliver extremely friendly and accommodating customer service throughout your entire stay.  We also appreciate you mentioning several amenities that you enjoyed, as well as your friend.  Your review and rooms tips will also be appreciated by many fellow travelers.  Thank you for your high recommendation.  We will await your return!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We spent two days with our kids and grandchildren hopping between Disneyland and California Adventure. The days were long, but a great deal of fun. That said, we set out to reserve a hotel room that would be clean, quiet and comfortable. And we found just that in the Marriott Courtyard in Anaheim on Harbor Blvd. The desk personnel were wonderful to del with and very helpful in guiding us in using the local transit system to travel back and forth to the theme parks. Our room wa extremely quiet and very comfortable. We did not find their morning "buffet" to be anything to jump up and down about, but the service was excellent. We'll stay there again the next time we visit the Disney parks.
Manager Response: Dear Avus,  Thank you for choosing our Anaheim hotel as your quiet and comfortable home away from home.  It's wonderful to hear that you and your grandkids enjoyed a great experience with us.  It is always our pleasure to assist you at any time throughout your stay. We appreciate your kind remarks on our helpful customer service.  We are all very pleased that you will be staying with us again on your next visit to the Disney parks.  Thank you for completing the review.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: When you get a staff like this, your stay will be seemless.   They go above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied.  The property itself could use updating, but the final verdict:  I'd stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear jazzy6991,  We are ecstatic! Thank you for your outstanding review!  We are honored to receive such excellent compliments on our exceptional customer service, especially from an avid traveler such as yourself.  We are happy that you enjoyed a seamless experience with us and that you would stay at our hotel again. Thank you for your great feedback.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We checked in the hotel last night and I was very saddened to see that despite me requesting a clean room, we were checked into a room which had dirty chairs, hair in the bath tub and dirty carpet. The bed headboard is soo dirty. We've been staying in your hotels each time we are in los Angeles and I'm really disappointed with the cleaniness of the rooms, I called the front desk last night and this morning they moved us into another room, which is also not that clean. The bath tub soap dish area has mildew growing. Now we have to stay 2 more days there, imagine how it feels to stay in a dirty room, I don't feel comfortable at all. It's really unfortunate the management didn't care about us even though we are a loyal Marriott reward member. My question is that do you have any
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: They overbooked the hotel and sent my family and I to a crappy hotel gratis!
Summary: I'm thoroughly displeased with the marriott. my family and I were shipped off to a so called sister hotel, which turned out to be a dump. my family and I checked out of the hotel room within 2 hours of checking in. this was a nightmare,and unacceptable for the marriott hotel. thanks for ruining my day vacation.
Manager Response: Dear ilove2travel951,  Please accept our sincere apologies. Please know that is not our standard practice to have to re-locate our guests to another hotel in the area.  We are extremely sorry for this inconvenience and appreciate your patience and understanding.  It is our hope that you will consider giving us the opportunity to deliver an amazing experience at our hotel in the future.  Thank you for your feedback and time in completing the review on our property.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nothing Special but Nothing Too Bad
Summary: This is a very average Courtyard by Marriott property.  It clearly caters to families instead of business travelers.  It can be noisy at night with kids running up and down the hallways.  Overall the room was clean, comfortable and decent internet service.  The staff was fine nothing overly special as they did not go out of their way.
Manager Response: Dear ddmullis,  We are disappointed to hear that we failed to exceed your expectations.  Please accept our apologies and know that your valued feedback has not gone overlooked.  We take immediate action and follow up on all of our guests comments and suggestions.  Albeit, we are pleased that overall you enjoyed our comfortable and clean accommodations, we are sorry that you did not receive the exceptional customer service level that you deserve.  Your feedback has already been addressed in a recent staff meeting to ensure that this remains an isolated incident.  We thank you for your review and hope you will decide to stay with us again.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I'm not sure what to think about this hotel!!  I guess it was both good and bad.  The day we arrived our room was ready early and we had a great experience checking in!  We went up to our room dropped our bags off and on we went for a full day of beach fun!  We got back to the hotel late and exhausted and ready to get our baths taken and climb into bed!  I took my 7 yr. old in to give her a bath and after getting her in noticed long black hair on the walls and short curly hair in the tub.  If your a mom you can imagine how fast I grabbed my child out of the bath!  There she is half wet and cold and I have to call the front desk to tell them our bathroom was obviously not cleaned!  They said they could comp our parking for the week.  While I was grateful for the gesture it didn't
Manager Response: Dear BigBransonLover,  We apologize for the inconveniences that occurred in your room during your recent stay, and appreciate the opportunity to, as you mentioned, make it right. It was our pleasure to ensure that your room was properly cleaned for the remainder of your stay.  Also, please know that our property is contracted with a third party pest control specialist, which services our entire property on a regular basis. In the rare and unfortunate event that a pest is spotted, we promptly place a call to the vendor to respond immediately.  Although, we are very happy that you and your family enjoyed staying in one of our Kids Suites, our hope is that you will decide to give us another opportunity to deliver an overall comfortable and enjoyable experience.  It would be our pleasure to exceed any expectations you may have.  Thank you for completing the review.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Returned to this hotel for a 2 night stay as convenient walking distance to convention center. Of course they know when there are conventions as the rate jumps over $200 and such is business.  Upon arrival at 1PM I was quickly turned away to say check in is 3PM although a gold member and informed my request earlier.  I had  a meeting and really needed to freshen up so the desk clerk says "whenever houskeeping will get to your room".  Is it possible to ask them to clean my room sooner and was told no!"  Finally almost an hour later I was told my room is reaady as if a big favor.  Room is acceptable but old and outdated, especially for the prices they charge even if no convention.  Only 1 elevator is slow Parking is $14 a day and just another revenue maker as across the street
Manager Response: Dear Rich W,  We apologize that we were unable to fulfill your early check in request.  Although, we do our best to accommodate all of our guests preferences and requests that are made during the reservation process, unfortunately, it is not always possible.  During the busy spring and summer months we are most often operating at full capacity and our housekeeping staff must always ensure that each guest room is properly cleaned and prepared.  Thank you for bringing the unacceptable responses you received during check in to our attention, as they have been noted and were immediately addressed.  We certainly appreciate your patronage and hope that you will, once again, return to allow us to exceed the expectations that you may have.  Thank you for completing the review on our hotel.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Loud and noisy find somewhere else
Summary: I did not have a good time at this hotel. It was loud all the time. Their breakfast bar was overpriced and had bad food. And you had to wait like5 minutes just to use the elevator.  They did give good service
Manager Response: Dear Corinealious,  Please accept our apology for any noise inconvenience or delay in using the elevator during your stay.  We are pleased that you enjoyed our exceptional customer service, and hope that this will bring you back to give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  It would be our sincere pleasure to deliver an experience that will have you coming back to visit us each time you are in the Anaheim area.  Again, we are sorry for failing to impress you during your stay.  We hope to see you in the near future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This is our second stay at the Courtyard, once again getting a great rate with Marriott's rate guarantee program. Rooms were clean, a little more noise this time due to people coming from Disneyland after midnight. Not the hotels fault. TV's have been upgraded to flat screen. We had a nice view of Disney fireworks from our room. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear trucker64,  We appreciate you choosing to come back and stay with us again!  Thank you for your great feedback on our Anaheim hotel.  We are very happy that you enjoyed the Disneyland firework show from the comfort of your room.  It's another added bonus our guests really enjoy; no matter what age they are!  Again, thank you for your high ratings and great review.  We look forward to your continued patronage.  It will be our pleasure to deliver another enjoyable and memorable experience.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The rooms were so clean and the beds so comfy. In fact the beds were so nice it was hard to get up for our days at Disney :). The staff was very friendly and helpful, and that includes everyone! The doors were very easy to open (someone made a comment about that), easier than any other hotel I have been at. The elevators worked well and were very clean (plus there were so many it wouldn't have mattered if one was down). Everyone was very helpful and accomodating. I wanted a nice clean room with a comfy bed at a very reasonable price close to Disney and this hotel met all those expectations. The balcony was a nice touch, we were able to leave the door open and have nice cool air all evening. Room service was great as well. I have no complaints at all and would stay here again :)
Manager Response: Dear Ebattle,  It's great to hear that you had a wonderful experience with us!  We appreciate your excellent compliments and high ratings.  Thank you for responding to previous reviews in regard to doors and elevators.  Your review will certainly be helpful to other travelers.  We can't wait to have you as our guest again in the near future!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I like the balcony it was alsome service everything meet are standards.  Witch was great. Love it will see them soon as possibly
Manager Response: Dear Leonardo T,  Thanks for the awesome review and ratings on our Anaheim hotel!  We are very happy that we will have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I've stayed in at least 50 Courtyards and this ranks as the second worst.  Either has severe financial difficulties or incompetent management.  Either way it sucks for the paying customer.  One elevator was busted all week and second was being held together was duct tape,  When I inquired at front desk, desk clerk stated he was unaware of problem.  Breakfast only had 4 hot food items when Couyard standard is 8 - 10.  Would have been acceptable for a Motel 6 but absolutely sucks for a Courtyard.  Marriott should revoke the franchise.
Manager Response: Dear TilmboATL,  We are very sorry to hear of your disappointing experience with us, and apologize for failing to exceed your expectations.  In regard to the elevators, we are awaiting parts for both of them.  Unfortunately, the lead time on the panel that is currently being manufactured for the one that is operating is over 3 weeks.  We realized the inconvenience this may have caused you and thank you for your patience and understanding.  Again, please accept our apology for failing to deliver an enjoyable stay.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: There are no parking spaces in front of the hotel; once you enter the grounds you need a "key" to leave.  The only alternative is to park in the back and walk all around the building carrying your luggage to enter the lobby.  The worst arrangment I hvae ever exprienced - spoiled the visit!  There are too many other choices in that area to ever stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Jeannemacl,  We are sorry to hear that our parking arrangements were in any way an inconvenience to you.  To clarify, we do have parking spaces in front of our hotel and we apologize that there were not any available when you arrived.  We thank you for your patience and understanding and appreciate you bringing these details of your visit to our attention.  Thank you for your review.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel! Clean, beautiful rooms and everything well kept!
Summary: Located down the street from Disneyland. Rooms are very nice and beautiful, all up to date. Bathrooms are spacious and beautiful with granite countertops. Very quiet, slept in peace and quiet! :) Front desk service were super friendly. Unfortunately the beds werent so comfy, neither were the pillows. I woke up with a stiff neck a few times. But everything else I was happy with made up for it.
Manager Response: Dear Hope S,  Wow!  We are very excited to receive such excellent feedback on our accommodations, customer service and unbeatable location!  Please keep in mind that we would be happy to switch out your pillows on your next visit if you find that the ones in your room aren't to your liking.  Again, thank you very much for taking the time to share how much you enjoyed your experience with us.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Overall it is really good. But to be picky...
Summary: We try to make the trip to Disneyland every year and have stayed at a few of the different hotels on Harbour.  This is a really nice place.  Not fancy, but really, really good for families. Location is always a priority for us when we go to Disney.  It is nice to be able to walk back to the hotel if you have small children who need a nap, or you just want to eat your meals back there.  It's about a 10 minute walk to main gate.  There are a few closer but not a big deal.  It is great having the McDonalds in the parking lot to grab a bunch of egg mcmuffins to bring back to the room while the family is getting ready for the day.  The rooms are nice and clean.  Staff was friendly.  Price was good.  We paid about $100 bucks/night in April.  Biggest bummer was paying for parking at
Manager Response: Dear MyWifeCallsMeCheep,  We appreciate you bringing the miscommunication in regard to parking to our attention and apologize for the inconvenience.  We do charge a daily parking fee of $12, as it states on our website.  Thank you for all of your great comments on our property.  We're glad you enjoyed our affordable rates and convenient location too!  Our hope is that you and your family will choose to stay with us again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Really could not ask for more.
Summary: I really thought highly of this place.  Very clean, well maintained hotel,and surprising reasonaable considering it's close proximity to The Wordl's Biggest Gimmick.  If I am stupid enough to return to Disneyland again, I would stay here in a heartbeat.  The only thing I did not like was the walk to the Disney shuttle bus at the hotel's sister hotel, the Marriott.  This was a short and convienent walk, but I just was'nt crazy about cutting across a parking lot in the dark.  If they offered a shuttle at the hotel, it would be perfect.
Manager Response: Dear NDfarmgirl,  We're excited to hear that you really could not ask for more!   We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your excellent review. We do hope you will return to the Anaheim area again.  There really are many other Anaheim attractions waiting for you to visit and explore.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here on two occasions - both times we were happy with our arrangements. - Four adults and two children.  The room was more than adequate for us with the children having a bunk bed room and the grandparents a separate bedroom with an onsuite.  Breakfast was included and was a do-it-yourself.  It got us off to a good start for the day.  We took the Disneyland bus which served the hotel.  Well worth considering for a family.
Manager Response: Dear VancouverIslanders41,  It's wonderful to hear that you and your family were happy with both of your recent experiences with us.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review on our Anaheim hotel.  We appreciate the great ratings and hope you'll be back to visit again soon.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel and location for a convention
Summary: Stayed at this Marriott for 4 nights while at a convention.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Glad the window opens a little for the fresh air.  Some rooms have a balcony which would of been nice to have.   Wish the concierges lounge was open for weekend breakfast.  Hotel was full and had to wait a while  to get into restaurant for breakfast.   Overall very pleased with the experience.
Manager Response: Dear TarHeelsareBest,  Thank you for sharing your experience during your recent 4 night stay with us.  It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed our Anaheim hotel and convenient location.  We are sorry about the wait to get into our restaurant and appreciate your patience and understanding.  Again, thank you for your review.  We will look forward to your return!  Best Regards,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I like this hotel despite being a Courtyard.  My experience with the Courtyard by Marriott has been mostly negative compared to the other Marriott brand hotels.  Their rooms are a little different and we stayed in the kid's suite which was nice.  The transportation to the Park is not really that convenient as you have to walk to the Marriott next door and then catch the bus.  I personally would stay at the Marriott next time.
Manager Response: Dear TravelsABunch,  Thank you for your review.  We are glad to hear that your experience at our Courtyard was a positive one and that you enjoyed our Kids Suite.  We hope you will keep our comfortable accommodations and quality stay at affordable rates in mind on your next visit to our area.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The hotel is good if you are looking for an pretty cheap place close to the park.  You can walk over to the Marriott across the parking lot to catch the shuttle to the park.  I found the walls to be very thin though and when our neighbours returned at 11pm it sounded like they were in my room talking and it woke me up. There was also a lot of noise in the hallway.  If you are a light sleeper or your kids are it is a bit much.  We had the family suite with bunkbeds in one room and queen in the other.  However they are not really two rooms just seperated by a glass sliding door so light goes through and you have to go through room with queen bed to get to washroom by front door.  I did not like the layout and it was tight.  But if you are only sleeping in your room it is not a
Manager Response: Dear ChrisMac7,  We are very sorry to hear of the inconveniences you experienced during your recent stay with us.  Please accept our apologies.  Thank  you for bringing these details to our attention.  We are constantly striving to deliver the very best experience for each of our guests and always appreciate valuable feedback.  Our hope is that you will decide to give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We chose this hotel based on TA reviews and its convenient location for Disneyland, which was our main reason for the stay, enjoying Halloween weekend. Very pleasant, knowledgable and exceptionally helpful staff, particularly front desk, who even printed Google Maps for us to our destinations. Also the servers at the buffet breakfast, which is reasonably priced and very good value. Rooms are fairly large, clean and well equipped. Beds are very comfortable with pillow options. The location is easy to find from the interstate, though there is no traffic noise and we it was easy to get a good night's sleep. The pool looked lovely though we ran out of day to give it a try. The $12 charge for parking is a pain when you pay Disney another $15 for their park and ride (which is almost
Manager Response: Dear jezzieboy,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during the recent Halloween weekend.  Its great to hear how much you enjoyed our exceptional customer service level.  It is always a pleasure to assist you in any we can to help make your stay an enjoyable one.  Thank you for commenting on our affordable rates, spacious accommodations and breakfast buffet.  We appreciate your excellent ratings on our property and hope you will decide to stay with us again on your return visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Still the best hotel for Disneyland!
Summary: My husband and I stayed 4 nights this October and we had such a wonderful time. This was our second visit and was even better than the first. Hotel was really quiet and room was spacious and clean. Breakfast which was included in the rate was delicious. Loved the waffles which you make yourself and the scrambled eggs!  Location is about 15-20 min walk to Disneyland. We walked a couple of mornings but decided to get the ART shuttle from the Marriott next door the other times. Only bummer is the $12 that you have to pay daily for parking. Recommend this hotel for couples and families with teenage kids.
Manager Response: Dear Jazzy83,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us again on your recent visit to the Anaheim area.  We appreciate all of the great details you shared about your wonderful experience with us.  Thank you for the outstanding ratings on our Anaheim hotel and for recommending us to other travelers.  We hope you will be back to visit again soon!  Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Spend your Hotel Money Somewhere else
Summary: We stayed at this hotel thinking that since it was a marriott brand hotel, it will be the same as other Marriott hotels we've stayed in over the years. The price was $109 + taxes - not bad! Hoever, when we got to the room, it was not what we've been accustomed to in other Marriott brand hotels. The carpet was dirty and the bathroom was not cleaned properly. It was late at night already when we arrived that is why we didn't bother changing rooms because we're tired and just wanted to sleep. The couch pull out bed was terrible. i had an aching back when we left the next day. I will never stay at this hotel again.  The air conditioner was loud and not working well. This hotel gives Marriott a bad name. The service was even bad. We were checking in when the clerk received a phone
Manager Response: Dear MangAndres,  We are very disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy experience with us.  Thank you for bringing the details of what occurred during your stay to our attention.  We appreciate your feedback, as we take our guests' comments and opinions very seriously.  We also apologize for the delay you experienced during check in while our front desk staff assisted other guests.  Again, thank you for completing the review on our property.  Sincerely,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Good little Marriott. Very clean and good location. Checked in later and the front desk was helpful and definitely improved the stay. Parking was a little crowded and the fee seemed a little senseless. Other then that I'd go there again
Manager Response: Dear Kleimy,  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed our customer service, accommodations and location.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent business trip and for taking the time to complete the review.  We hope your travels with bring you back to the Anaheim area in the near future.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The hotel was well located near the pick up Disneyland bus.   Service was very good and the room was spacious and well lighted compared to other hotel I'd been too. The bathroom was again a bit small but adequate and clean.   It was difficult to find a parking space because the parking lots were shared with other hotels nearby (and we went there during off peak season).   It would probably quite expensive to stay at this hotel around this area but we used our points to redeem 1N stay so it was worth it.
Manager Response: Dear ice_latte,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for complimenting us on our customer service, accommodations and convenient location.  We hope you'll take a look at our affordable rates and stay with us again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  We hope to see you again!  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: This was our second stay at the Courtyard and it was wonderful. Last year was our first time staying there and my boyfriend and I were upset that the walk was so long and that there was no transportation... with further investigation when I started planning out second trip I found out about the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART), so we thought we would give it another chance. The ART is the most useful purchase while in Disneyland! You do have to walk over to the neighbouring Marriott, but whats 3 minute walk.  The hotel is super clean and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Check out is 11am but we asked to have it extended to 11:30am and they had no problem extending it. The pool was a little cold even on a warm day but it did the trick. For the price of the hotel the
Manager Response: Dear sunkissed16,  We are definitely pleased that you decided to stay with us again!  Thank you for sharing the details of what brought you back to our property and mentioning the convenient Anaheim Resort Transit system.  Thank you for your excellent review and ratings on our Anaheim hotel.  We are very excited to hear that you will continue to stay with us for all of your future visits to Anaheim!  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a 2 night stay for my birthday. Checkin was awesome as well as check out. Friendly, helpful staff. The hotel is clean and seemed new. The hotel maid was awesome. She made a cute little bow out of the towels and a flower out of the tissue. I loved that little touch!! There is not a safe in the room which we could have used (for our ipad, car keys, etc). We just hid our stuff and were glad to see it was still there when we got back to our hotel. I like hotels with safes!! The walls are really thin like previously reported. I didn't hear it at night but in the morning, you can hear everyone on either side of you and their whole conversation, doors slamming etc. At least we woke up the same time they did or I would have not been happy. The free
Manager Response: Dear lovept,  Thank you for choosing to make us a part of your Birthday celebration!  We appreciate all of your wonderful compliments and ratings on our customer service, accommodations and amenities.   Also, thank you for your suggestions.  We value your opinion, as it helps us in our continuous efforts to deliver the most enjoyable experience for our guests.  We are excited that you would stay with us again, and look forward to your arrival.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I was a little disappointed in this hotel. First, the walls are paper thin. We could hear everything in the room right next to us. Second, the bus that takes you from the hotel to Disneyland Park (ART) does not pick you up right at the hotel, like I have experienced in years past. That is probably my fault, I should have asked specifically..but, since every other hotel I have stayed at comes right there I didn't know to ask. The rooms are clean, and has enough space for my family of four. The pool is nice, and has a little "kiddie" pool for the kids as well. The front desk employees are very nice, and housekeeping does a good job. Overall, I would say it met my needs but I probably won't be back. The Marriott that is right by this property (where the ART tram picks up) is where
Manager Response: Dear cwindsor8769,  We apologize for any miscommunication that occurred when reserving your room with us.  Please accept our apologies for this inconvenience.  Thank you for your comments on our customer service and amenities.  We hope that all that you enjoyed with us will help you to reconsider staying with us again in the future.  We appreciate your time in sharing your experience and giving us your valued feedback.   Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good room and staff, but noisy
Summary: We stayed here two nights to attend Mickey's Halloween party. I would only recommend this hotel to heavy sleepers because the walls are paper thin. I always hear that about hotels and it never bothered me, but now... I get it. Both mornings, we kept getting woken up by screaming children, yelling adults and just TV and normal conversation next door. It was not very restful. If I have a choice, I'll stay at Doubletree Orange again for the same price on priceline.   On the upside, we got a great deal through priceline (check out betterbidding.com for tips on bidding), the room was clean and well appointed, pretty spacious and the hotel staff were really nice. They gladly held our luggage after we checked out and wanted to go to the parks before we drove home. Maybe I'll just bring
Manager Response: Dear JosephineGia,  We are very sorry to hear that your sleep was interrupted by the screaming and yelling of other guests.  Please accept our apologies for this unfortunate inconvenience.  We do appreciate your time in letting us know the details of your experience with us.  It is great to hear that you enjoyed your spacious and well appointed accommodations, as well as our friendly and helpful customer service.  Thank you for your great ratings on our Anaheim hotel.  Our hope is that you will decide to come back and see us again.  Best Regards,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent. We stay here every time
Summary: I live in San Diego and visit Anaheim frequently. I stay here every time I go to anaheim. Food was excellent; they have an omelet bar and breakfast buffet. Staff was super friendly. Bathrooms were clean. Free coffee and tea located in the lobby in the morning. There is a great Italian restaurant that you can to "Buca de Peppo". I stayed at the Hyatt down the street before and would rather stay here than the Hyatt.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I put my sister and her family up here for a visit to Disney. Great location and also walking distance to several chain restaurants. Also right next door to a Ruth's Chris if you want a more upscale dinner. Nice lobby and adequate parking. Staff was very helpful and there was no wait to check in or ask questions. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was great. Pool was small but very clean, and hot tub was nicely doused in bleach (as it should be at these types of places!).  My sister wanted me to alert everyone about what she felt was a little scam a lady desk clerk had going. She said when they asked for a taxi to be called to take them to Disney, a towncar and driver showed up. She protested and said "no we wanted a taxi" and they said "yes this
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here several times and this hotel never disappoints. The staff is always friendly, rooms are nice and clean and the parking is a great deal!
Manager Response: Dear TravelFam39,  Thank you for your continued patronage.  We appreciate the excellent review and ratings on our Anaheim hotel and are thrilled to hear that we are consistently delivering an enjoyable experience.  Again, thank you for always making us your choice in accommodations while visiting the Anaheim area.  We will look forward to having you as our guest again soon.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Very nice and clean hotel. Kids get their own room with their own tv. We were given higher floor facing Disneyland and were surprise to see fireworks every single nights! Our kids were very excited with their own double bunk beds, free Internet, Disney channel on TV and fireworks! The hotel also gives extra towels. Breakfast is delicious and reasonably priced.   The downside are that fitness room is really small and under equipped and it's quite a distance to Disneyland if you are planning to walk or take the Disney shuttle bus. For us, we didn't experience the latter problem because we planned to drive to Disney from the hotel.  Overall, a wonderful hotel and we did enjoy our stay.
Manager Response: Dear PJONG,  It's great to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us in one of our Kids Suites and that you enjoyed the nightly spectacular Disneyland firework show from the comfort of your suite.  Thank you for completing the review on our Anaheim hotel.  We appreciate your compliments and suggestions, and hope to see you on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Typical Marriott Courtyard. We had the kid suite which was great. walking distance (about 10 minutes) to the park. rooms were nice and clean.
Manager Response: Dear IITrips,  We appreciate your time in completing the review and sharing your experience with us.  Thank you for the great review and ratings.  We are very pleased you enjoyed one of our Kids Suites and our unbeatable location.  We look forward to having you back again soon.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: loved it and we will be back
Summary: Everything was spotless in our room, shuttle to Disneyland was easy access in front of the hotel.  This was a first stay at a Hotel for my grandson at 4 years old he loved the pool and of course he didn't want to leave Disneyland!!  Staff was friendly and great.
Manager Response: Dear lovdogs,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us for such a special occasion!  What a great honor to be a part of your grandson's very first hotel experience.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we are doing in our continued commitment to assisting you with exceptional customer service and delivering an enjoyable stay.  We will look forward to being your choice in Anaheim accommodations on your next visit to the area.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful and so close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is so nice and clean. The desk staff was so graceful and lovely to deal with. One of them even knew our issues with the Sabbath and the electronic key so it was very helpful. ONE MAJOR disappointment... the cleaning crew does not speak a word of english! very sad. The pool is so family oriented. My son never wanted to get out of the water. It is just a great hotel for Families who want to relax and go to Disneyland. We were very happy and will stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear relaxingenergie,  We appreciate your time in giving us your feedback on your experience with us.  Thank you for the great comments and ratings.  We are very happy that you will be back to enjoy our Anaheim accommodations and amenities again soon!  Best Regards,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Hotel in a Great Location.
Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights from July 26 thru August 1.  Overall we thought the hotel was a good place to stay for doing Disneyland and California Adventure.    The Good-  The hotel is right on Harbor Blvd about one mile from the main Disney Entrance.  It is also only about two miles from the I-5 Expressway so you have easy access to get to other places.  The hotel itself was clean and tidy with very comfortable beds.  The pool was fantastic, my daughter wanted to swim everyday!  They also have two hot tubs.  They also have a large breakfast area that is always busy in the morning, although I never ate there.  Another plus is they have free coffee in the Lobby.  The Bad-  Technically this hotel is considered a walking hotel to Disney, that is true in the morning when you are
Manager Response: Dear writerguy1976,  Thank you for your detailed review on your recent experience at our Anaheim hotel.  We appreciate all of your compliments on our accommodations and amenities.  It's great to hear how your family enjoyed taking some time to swim everyday, and also that you were very comfortable in our beds.  Again, thank you for your feedback.  We hope to see you and your family on your next visit.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Courtyard by Disneyland Resort and I have to say that our visit was superb. From an functional standpoint, the room was well designed and helped us keep all of our belongings organized on our vacation. There was a place for everything with a coffee/fridge area, plenty of shelves, multiple areas to hang clothes, and even a retractable clothesline in the shower. The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked like a charm. Our room was also cleaned everyday before we returned in the early afternoon to rest and swim, and the pool area was spacious with plenty of tables and chairs.  I made requests and asked questions of the staff multiple times during our visit and they were all outstanding. Exceptional customer service
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here 4 times in the past couple of years when we visit Disneyland. I have always loved it, and so this time around I didn't hesitate to make my reservations here.  But I didn't really enjoy it this time. :(  One of the things that I always appreciated at this hotel was that they were always able to check us in early.  We arrived at around 11:45 am on Friday morning. I went in and asked the man at the front desk if we would be able to check in early. He looked at the computer and said "No, we don't have anything available, check in is at 3:00, enjoy your day and come back at 3".  Hmph. So what do we do now? We have kids stuffed in the van that needed to change clothes and use the restroom after a 7 hour drive.  I went out to my husband disappointed and told him we
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Overrun by ANTS and Rude Service
Summary: This was a second visit to the Courtyard by Marriott branded hotel, first visit was at the LAX location a couple years earlier and that experience was pretty nice, so it seemed like a safe bet to trust the brand.  Big mistake. Big. Huge! On arrival everything seemed in place and on par. After a couple hours rest prior to our trip to the beach, we noticed a few ants crawling around the bed and some spots in the room. Though it was not a major inconvenience at the time (we had not been bitten yet), we carried on normally, without complaint. On return later that evening a few misplaced ants were still wondering the room, again, not a huge inconvenience, except it made us a little uneasy as we attempted to get some sleep for the busy day at Disneyland the following day. We did wake
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of five drove a RV to Disneyland and had to find a hotel that would accomodate the RV. Courtyard did better than that. We got to have a great parking spot next door which was where the DIsney Shuttle departed from.  Not only is this a family friendly place the food is good, I feel my kids were safe and it was within walking distance to a Red Robin. Our room was a huge room that was a handicapped suite. It had two  large flat screensTVs and a bar area and a diningroom. Just needed a microwave. Still we loved the layout. It was easy to have a hot breakfast downstairs, head to Disneyland then come back in the evening to dinner somewhere close. Very clean, Great Pool, no bedbugs. I will always stay here in the future. Very welcoming staff. Families should stay here.
Manager Response: Dear lakemom3,  We are ecstatic to hear that you will always stay with us in the future!  Thank you for choosing us to be a part of your California vacation.  We are honored to receive such flattering compliments on our accommodations, customer service and location.  It was our sincere pleasure to give you and your family the royal treatment.  That is exactly what we believe each of our guests deserve!  Again, thank you for your patronage.  We look forward to the next opportunity of delivering a memorable experience for you and your family.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights on points while we visited Disneyland and took in an Angel's game. After staying at Courtyard Liberty Station in San Diego, this property paled in comparison.   It cost $12 to park. Everything about this property was adequate. The hotel could use a renovation. We paid a small fee and had a family suite. My kids loved the bunk beds and their own little room. It was good to have a fridge, second tv, microwave,couch and sliding doors to separate the room. The bedding on the bunk beds was worn and looked old.    This was the half-way point for our trip up the coast, so we used their laundry room. Had no problem getting a washer/dryer-- everything was clean.   The people who work there were awesome. Every single person was friendly and happy to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a great stay. The location was awesome and the staff were all friendly and happy to help. Would recommend and have no complaints :)
Manager Response: Dear xxJazzxx,  Thank you very much for your recommendation of our Anaheim hotel to other travelers.  We are thrilled to hear that you had a great stay!  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We appreciate your excellent ratings and compliments on our customer service.  It truly is our pleasure to assist our guests in any way we can.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to the U.S.!  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location BUT noisy sound transmission
Summary: Good location within walking distance to Disneyland if you're the hiking type (about 1.5 miles or so down Harbor Blvd.)  We stayed here on a last minute basis for a week and used little of the hotel resources beyond the parking lot and the room.  There is a parking charge which always annoys me but I knew it was coming so I'm not really complaining.  The room was nicely appointed and maintained with the big item being a suite available with bunk beds (which my daughter craved for the experience.)  So the room layout is two queens or 1 king in one room and the bunk bed plus a pull out couch in the second.  Lots of room for a large family.  Our initial room was set up for handicapped access with a roll-in shower.  We checked in very late and the clerk told us and offered a room
Manager Response: Dear Gurnee Traveler,  Thank you for choosing our Anaheim hotel for your family's week long vacation to California.  We appreciate you sharing the details of your experience by completing the review and are thrilled that you found our large Kids Suite perfect accommodations for you and your family.  It was our pleasure to make your room relocation a seamless process.  We hope to welcome you back on your next vacation to the Anaheim area.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The front desk girls were very nice.  The room was clean and quiet.  The towels were not provided (or forgotten about in the room), but when I called to get some they came right away.  The location was close to Disneyland by shuttle bus or a long walk.  We liked the pool very much and were really happy to have the flexibility to return to the hotel during the day at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Rpstory,  Thank you for staying with us.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed our accommodations, amenities and location.  As you mentioned, it is great to be located so close to Disneyland!  It allows our guests the option of returning to our hotel for a midday break from Disneyland or other Anaheim attractions.  Thank you for your review and we hope you will be back to visit again soon.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel as part of our usa trip so we could visit disneyland. The hotel was clean and had very comfortable beds.There were 10 of us and as the hotel was quite small this was good as everyone found it easy to stick together.  Pool area ws nice with hot tub . There could have been more sunloungers as people arriving back from the parks in afternoon sometimes didn't always get beds. The food was good breakfast enough for anyone to fill up on both hot and cold choces. Our main problem with the hotel was the bar wasn't open very much. We got someone to open it earler than 5 pm as there were 10 thirtsy adults!! Then it closed early too once at 9.45pm. It was about 3/4 mile walk from Disneyland. Would recommend for families visiting theme parks.
Manager Response: Dear fergy25,  We appreciate you making us your choice in Anaheim accommodations while visiting the U.S.  Thank you for your great comments, recommendation of our property and sharing your tips with other travelers.  We hope that your travels bring you back to the U.S. to stay with us again soon!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Short Stopover but a great hotel!
Summary: I was overnighting in Orange County/Anaheim whilst on my way home to Australia, I decided to overnight here mainly because i figured since my flight the following day left at 10pm i could tire myself out at Disneyland and then head straight to LAX. I had previously stayed at the Cortona Inn (See previous review) 6 years prior, but this time decided to try another hotel, i didnt realise until i got there that the Courtyard is actually next door to the Cortona.  I got into LAX terminal 7 after flying in from Phoenix and decided to cab it to the hotel, Big mistake as it was 5pm on a thursday..... 1 hour and a $150 cab fare later!!!! i got to the hotel and at check in my booking (Through Expedia) they had trouble finding until i gave the confirmation number. After the guy checked me
Manager Response: Dear Harvsman,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your one night stay in the Anaheim area.   We are very happy to receive your great review and ratings on our hotel, and glad we were able to assist you and arrange your cab ride for you.  We appreciate your compliments on our friendly customer service, as well as your recommendation of our Anaheim hotel.  Again, thank you for staying with us.  We hope to see you on your next visit to the U.S.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: My daughter and I arrived around 9:30 PM after a long day at Disneyland.  Front desk person was friendly and soon we were going up to our room which was large,  faced the parking lot. Two queen beds just the right amount of hard/softness, a neat bathroom, plenty of light, nice television.  Bathroom door didn't squeak, floor didn't  creak, no noise in the hallway through the night, no door slamming, everything  worked, nice decor.  We didn't partake of the breakfast or use the pool. I wasn't expecting so nice a place.  I would definitely return to this Courtyard the  next time I visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Kristofur,  We are very excited to hear that you and your daughter enjoyed our Anaheim hotel!  Thank you for your lovely, detailed, compliments and for sharing your experience with other travelers.  It was our pleasure to exceed your expectations and we can't wait to do it again on your next visit!  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if going to Disneyland.
Summary: Overall a great hotel. No real complaints. Very clean and great service. Within walking distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It's cheap and you get what you pay for
Summary: We picked this hotel because it was economical and semi close to Disneyland.
